01747                         default:
01748                                 break;
01749                 }
01750                 
01751                 return stre;
01752         }
01753 
01754         // Utility macro for last character handling
01755         #define ENDSWITH(c, e) ((c) == (e) || ((c) == 0 && endch == (e)))
01756 
01757         PUGI__FN char_t* strconv_comment(char_t* s, char_t endch)
01758         {
01759                 gap g;
01760                 
01761                 while (true)
01762                 {
01763                         while (!PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_comment)) ++s;
01764                 
01765                         if (*s == '\r') // Either a single 0x0d or 0x0d 0x0a pair
01766                         {
01767                                 *s++ = '\n'; // replace first one with 0x0a
01768                                 
01769                                 if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1);
01770                         }
01771                         else if (s[0] == '-' && s[1] == '-' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>')) // comment ends here
01772                         {
01773                                 *g.flush(s) = 0;
01774                                 
01775                                 return s + (s[2] == '>' ? 3 : 2);
01776                         }
01777                         else if (*s == 0)
01778                         {
01779                                 return 0;
01780                         }
01781                         else ++s;
01782                 }
01783         }
01784 
01785         PUGI__FN char_t* strconv_cdata(char_t* s, char_t endch)
01786         {
01787                 gap g;
01788                         
01789                 while (true)
01790                 {
01791                         while (!PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_cdata)) ++s;
01792                         
01793                         if (*s == '\r') // Either a single 0x0d or 0x0d 0x0a pair
01794                         {
01795                                 *s++ = '\n'; // replace first one with 0x0a
01796                                 
01797                                 if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1);
01798                         }
01799                         else if (s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>')) // CDATA ends here
01800                         {
01801                                 *g.flush(s) = 0;
01802                                 
01803                                 return s + 1;
01804                         }
01805                         else if (*s == 0)
01806                         {
01807                                 return 0;
01808                         }
01809                         else ++s;
01810                 }
01811         }
01812         
01813         typedef char_t* (*strconv_pcdata_t)(char_t*);
01814                 
01815         template <typename opt_eol, typename opt_escape> struct strconv_pcdata_impl
01816         {
01817                 static char_t* parse(char_t* s)
01818                 {
01819                         gap g;
01820                         
01821                         while (true)
01822                         {
01823                                 while (!PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_pcdata)) ++s;
01824                                         
01825                                 if (*s == '<') // PCDATA ends here
01826                                 {
01827                                         *g.flush(s) = 0;
01828                                         
01829                                         return s + 1;
01830                                 }
01831                                 else if (opt_eol::value && *s == '\r') // Either a single 0x0d or 0x0d 0x0a pair
01832                                 {
01833                                         *s++ = '\n'; // replace first one with 0x0a
01834                                         
01835                                         if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1);
01836                                 }
01837                                 else if (opt_escape::value && *s == '&')
01838                                 {
01839                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g);
01840                                 }
01841                                 else if (*s == 0)
01842                                 {
01843                                         return s;
01844                                 }
01845                                 else ++s;
01846                         }
01847                 }
01848         };
01849         
01850         PUGI__FN strconv_pcdata_t get_strconv_pcdata(unsigned int optmask)
01851         {
01852                 PUGI__STATIC_ASSERT(parse_escapes == 0x10 && parse_eol == 0x20);
01853 
01854                 switch ((optmask >> 4) & 3) // get bitmask for flags (eol escapes)
01855                 {
01856                 case 0: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_false, opt_false>::parse;
01857                 case 1: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_false, opt_true>::parse;
01858                 case 2: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_true, opt_false>::parse;
01859                 case 3: return strconv_pcdata_impl<opt_true, opt_true>::parse;
01860                 default: return 0; // should not get here
01861                 }
01862         }
01863 
01864         typedef char_t* (*strconv_attribute_t)(char_t*, char_t);
01865         
01866         template <typename opt_escape> struct strconv_attribute_impl
01867         {
01868                 static char_t* parse_wnorm(char_t* s, char_t end_quote)
01869                 {
01870                         gap g;
01871 
01872                         // trim leading whitespaces
01873                         if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space))
01874                         {
01875                                 char_t* str = s;
01876                                 
01877                                 do ++str;
01878                                 while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*str, ct_space));
01879                                 
01880                                 g.push(s, str - s);
01881                         }
01882 
01883                         while (true)
01884                         {
01885                                 while (!PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_attr_ws | ct_space)) ++s;
01886                                 
01887                                 if (*s == end_quote)
01888                                 {
01889                                         char_t* str = g.flush(s);
01890                                         
01891                                         do *str-- = 0;
01892                                         while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*str, ct_space));
01893                                 
01894                                         return s + 1;
01895                                 }
01896                                 else if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space))
01897                                 {
01898                                         *s++ = ' ';
01899                 
01900                                         if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space))
01901                                         {
01902                                                 char_t* str = s + 1;
01903                                                 while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*str, ct_space)) ++str;
01904                                                 
01905                                                 g.push(s, str - s);
01906                                         }
01907                                 }
01908                                 else if (opt_escape::value && *s == '&')
01909                                 {
01910                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g);
01911                                 }
01912                                 else if (!*s)
01913                                 {
01914                                         return 0;
01915                                 }
01916                                 else ++s;
01917                         }
01918                 }
01919 
01920                 static char_t* parse_wconv(char_t* s, char_t end_quote)
01921                 {
01922                         gap g;
01923 
01924                         while (true)
01925                         {
01926                                 while (!PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_attr_ws)) ++s;
01927                                 
01928                                 if (*s == end_quote)
01929                                 {
01930                                         *g.flush(s) = 0;
01931                                 
01932                                         return s + 1;
01933                                 }
01934                                 else if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space))
01935                                 {
01936                                         if (*s == '\r')
01937                                         {
01938                                                 *s++ = ' ';
01939                                 
01940                                                 if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1);
01941                                         }
01942                                         else *s++ = ' ';
01943                                 }
01944                                 else if (opt_escape::value && *s == '&')
01945                                 {
01946                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g);
01947                                 }
01948                                 else if (!*s)
01949                                 {
01950                                         return 0;
01951                                 }
01952                                 else ++s;
01953                         }
01954                 }
01955 
01956                 static char_t* parse_eol(char_t* s, char_t end_quote)
01957                 {
01958                         gap g;
01959 
01960                         while (true)
01961                         {
01962                                 while (!PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_attr)) ++s;
01963                                 
01964                                 if (*s == end_quote)
01965                                 {
01966                                         *g.flush(s) = 0;
01967                                 
01968                                         return s + 1;
01969                                 }
01970                                 else if (*s == '\r')
01971                                 {
01972                                         *s++ = '\n';
01973                                         
01974                                         if (*s == '\n') g.push(s, 1);
01975                                 }
01976                                 else if (opt_escape::value && *s == '&')
01977                                 {
01978                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g);
01979                                 }
01980                                 else if (!*s)
01981                                 {
01982                                         return 0;
01983                                 }
01984                                 else ++s;
01985                         }
01986                 }
01987 
01988                 static char_t* parse_simple(char_t* s, char_t end_quote)
01989                 {
01990                         gap g;
01991 
01992                         while (true)
01993                         {
01994                                 while (!PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_parse_attr)) ++s;
01995                                 
01996                                 if (*s == end_quote)
01997                                 {
01998                                         *g.flush(s) = 0;
01999                                 
02000                                         return s + 1;
02001                                 }
02002                                 else if (opt_escape::value && *s == '&')
02003                                 {
02004                                         s = strconv_escape(s, g);
02005                                 }
02006                                 else if (!*s)
02007                                 {
02008                                         return 0;
02009                                 }
02010                                 else ++s;
02011                         }
02012                 }
02013         };
02014 
02015         PUGI__FN strconv_attribute_t get_strconv_attribute(unsigned int optmask)
02016         {
02017                 PUGI__STATIC_ASSERT(parse_escapes == 0x10 && parse_eol == 0x20 && parse_wconv_attribute == 0x40 && parse_wnorm_attribute == 0x80);
02018                 
02019                 switch ((optmask >> 4) & 15) // get bitmask for flags (wconv wnorm eol escapes)
02020                 {
02021                 case 0:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_simple;
02022                 case 1:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_simple;
02023                 case 2:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_eol;
02024                 case 3:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_eol;
02025                 case 4:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wconv;
02026                 case 5:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wconv;
02027                 case 6:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wconv;
02028                 case 7:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wconv;
02029                 case 8:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wnorm;
02030                 case 9:  return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wnorm;
02031                 case 10: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wnorm;
02032                 case 11: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wnorm;
02033                 case 12: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wnorm;
02034                 case 13: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wnorm;
02035                 case 14: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_false>::parse_wnorm;
02036                 case 15: return strconv_attribute_impl<opt_true>::parse_wnorm;
02037                 default: return 0; // should not get here
02038                 }
02039         }
02040 
02041         inline xml_parse_result make_parse_result(xml_parse_status status, ptrdiff_t offset = 0)
02042         {
02043                 xml_parse_result result;
02044                 result.status = status;
02045                 result.offset = offset;
02046 
02047                 return result;
02048         }
02049 
02050         struct xml_parser
02051         {
02052                 xml_allocator alloc;
02053                 char_t* error_offset;
02054                 xml_parse_status error_status;
02055                 
02056                 // Parser utilities.
02057                 #define PUGI__SKIPWS()                  { while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_space)) ++s; }
02058                 #define PUGI__OPTSET(OPT)                       ( optmsk & (OPT) )
02059                 #define PUGI__PUSHNODE(TYPE)            { cursor = append_node(cursor, alloc, TYPE); if (!cursor) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_out_of_memory, s); }
02060                 #define PUGI__POPNODE()                 { cursor = cursor->parent; }
02061                 #define PUGI__SCANFOR(X)                        { while (*s != 0 && !(X)) ++s; }
02062                 #define PUGI__SCANWHILE(X)              { while ((X)) ++s; }
02063                 #define PUGI__ENDSEG()                  { ch = *s; *s = 0; ++s; }
02064                 #define PUGI__THROW_ERROR(err, m)       return error_offset = m, error_status = err, static_cast<char_t*>(0)
02065                 #define PUGI__CHECK_ERROR(err, m)       { if (*s == 0) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(err, m); }
02066                 
02067                 xml_parser(const xml_allocator& alloc_): alloc(alloc_), error_offset(0), error_status(status_ok)
02068                 {
02069                 }
02070 
02071                 // DOCTYPE consists of nested sections of the following possible types:
02072                 // <!-- ... -->, <? ... ?>, "...", '...'
02073                 // <![...]]>
02074                 // <!...>
02075                 // First group can not contain nested groups
02076                 // Second group can contain nested groups of the same type
02077                 // Third group can contain all other groups
02078                 char_t* parse_doctype_primitive(char_t* s)
02079                 {
02080                         if (*s == '"' || *s == '\'')
02081                         {
02082                                 // quoted string
02083                                 char_t ch = *s++;
02084                                 PUGI__SCANFOR(*s == ch);
02085                                 if (!*s) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_doctype, s);
02086 
02087                                 s++;
02088                         }
02089                         else if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '?')
02090                         {
02091                                 // <? ... ?>
02092                                 s += 2;
02093                                 PUGI__SCANFOR(s[0] == '?' && s[1] == '>'); // no need for ENDSWITH because ?> can't terminate proper doctype
02094                                 if (!*s) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_doctype, s);
02095 
02096                                 s += 2;
02097                         }
02098                         else if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] == '-' && s[3] == '-')
02099                         {
02100                                 s += 4;
02101                                 PUGI__SCANFOR(s[0] == '-' && s[1] == '-' && s[2] == '>'); // no need for ENDSWITH because --> can't terminate proper doctype
02102                                 if (!*s) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_doctype, s);
02103 
02104                                 s += 4;
02105                         }
02106                         else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_doctype, s);
02107 
02108                         return s;
02109                 }
02110 
02111                 char_t* parse_doctype_ignore(char_t* s)
02112                 {
02113                         assert(s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] == '[');
02114                         s++;
02115 
02116                         while (*s)
02117                         {
02118                                 if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] == '[')
02119                                 {
02120                                         // nested ignore section
02121                                         s = parse_doctype_ignore(s);
02122                                         if (!s) return s;
02123                                 }
02124                                 else if (s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && s[2] == '>')
02125                                 {
02126                                         // ignore section end
02127                                         s += 3;
02128 
02129                                         return s;
02130                                 }
02131                                 else s++;
02132                         }
02133 
02134                         PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_doctype, s);
02135                 }
02136 
02137                 char_t* parse_doctype_group(char_t* s, char_t endch, bool toplevel)
02138                 {
02139                         assert(s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!');
02140                         s++;
02141 
02142                         while (*s)
02143                         {
02144                                 if (s[0] == '<' && s[1] == '!' && s[2] != '-')
02145                                 {
02146                                         if (s[2] == '[')
02147                                         {
02148                                                 // ignore
02149                                                 s = parse_doctype_ignore(s);
02150                                                 if (!s) return s;
02151                                         }
02152                                         else
02153                                         {
02154                                                 // some control group
02155                                                 s = parse_doctype_group(s, endch, false);
02156                                                 if (!s) return s;
02157                                         }
02158                                 }
02159                                 else if (s[0] == '<' || s[0] == '"' || s[0] == '\'')
02160                                 {
02161                                         // unknown tag (forbidden), or some primitive group
02162                                         s = parse_doctype_primitive(s);
02163                                         if (!s) return s;
02164                                 }
02165                                 else if (*s == '>')
02166                                 {
02167                                         s++;
02168 
02169                                         return s;
02170                                 }
02171                                 else s++;
02172                         }
02173 
02174                         if (!toplevel || endch != '>') PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_doctype, s);
02175 
02176                         return s;
02177                 }
02178 
02179                 char_t* parse_exclamation(char_t* s, xml_node_struct* cursor, unsigned int optmsk, char_t endch)
02180                 {
02181                         // parse node contents, starting with exclamation mark
02182                         ++s;
02183 
02184                         if (*s == '-') // '<!-...'
02185                         {
02186                                 ++s;
02187 
02188                                 if (*s == '-') // '<!--...'
02189                                 {
02190                                         ++s;
02191 
02192                                         if (PUGI__OPTSET(parse_comments))
02193                                         {
02194                                                 PUGI__PUSHNODE(node_comment); // Append a new node on the tree.
02195                                                 cursor->value = s; // Save the offset.
02196                                         }
02197 
02198                                         if (PUGI__OPTSET(parse_eol) && PUGI__OPTSET(parse_comments))
02199                                         {
02200                                                 s = strconv_comment(s, endch);
02201 
02202                                                 if (!s) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_comment, cursor->value);
02203                                         }
02204                                         else
02205                                         {
02206                                                 // Scan for terminating '-->'.
02207                                                 PUGI__SCANFOR(s[0] == '-' && s[1] == '-' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>'));
02208                                                 PUGI__CHECK_ERROR(status_bad_comment, s);
02209 
02210                                                 if (PUGI__OPTSET(parse_comments))
02211                                                         *s = 0; // Zero-terminate this segment at the first terminating '-'.
02212 
02213                                                 s += (s[2] == '>' ? 3 : 2); // Step over the '\0->'.
02214                                         }
02215                                 }
02216                                 else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_comment, s);
02217                         }
02218                         else if (*s == '[')
02219                         {
02220                                 // '<![CDATA[...'
02221                                 if (*++s=='C' && *++s=='D' && *++s=='A' && *++s=='T' && *++s=='A' && *++s == '[')
02222                                 {
02223                                         ++s;
02224 
02225                                         if (PUGI__OPTSET(parse_cdata))
02226                                         {
02227                                                 PUGI__PUSHNODE(node_cdata); // Append a new node on the tree.
02228                                                 cursor->value = s; // Save the offset.
02229 
02230                                                 if (PUGI__OPTSET(parse_eol))
02231                                                 {
02232                                                         s = strconv_cdata(s, endch);
02233 
02234                                                         if (!s) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_cdata, cursor->value);
02235                                                 }
02236                                                 else
02237                                                 {
02238                                                         // Scan for terminating ']]>'.
02239                                                         PUGI__SCANFOR(s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>'));
02240                                                         PUGI__CHECK_ERROR(status_bad_cdata, s);
02241 
02242                                                         *s++ = 0; // Zero-terminate this segment.
02243                                                 }
02244                                         }
02245                                         else // Flagged for discard, but we still have to scan for the terminator.
02246                                         {
02247                                                 // Scan for terminating ']]>'.
02248                                                 PUGI__SCANFOR(s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && ENDSWITH(s[2], '>'));
02249                                                 PUGI__CHECK_ERROR(status_bad_cdata, s);
02250 
02251                                                 ++s;
02252                                         }
02253 
02254                                         s += (s[1] == '>' ? 2 : 1); // Step over the last ']>'.
02255                                 }
02256                                 else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_cdata, s);
02257                         }
02258                         else if (s[0] == 'D' && s[1] == 'O' && s[2] == 'C' && s[3] == 'T' && s[4] == 'Y' && s[5] == 'P' && ENDSWITH(s[6], 'E'))
02259                         {
02260                                 s -= 2;
02261 
02262                                 if (cursor->parent) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_doctype, s);
02263 
02264                                 char_t* mark = s + 9;
02265 
02266                                 s = parse_doctype_group(s, endch, true);
02267                                 if (!s) return s;
02268 
02269                                 if (PUGI__OPTSET(parse_doctype))
02270                                 {
02271                                         while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*mark, ct_space)) ++mark;
02272 
02273                                         PUGI__PUSHNODE(node_doctype);
02274 
02275                                         cursor->value = mark;
02276 
02277                                         assert((s[0] == 0 && endch == '>') || s[-1] == '>');
02278                                         s[*s == 0 ? 0 : -1] = 0;
02279 
02280                                         PUGI__POPNODE();
02281                                 }
02282                         }
02283                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '-') PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_comment, s);
02284                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '[') PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_cdata, s);
02285                         else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_unrecognized_tag, s);
02286 
02287                         return s;
02288                 }
02289 
02290                 char_t* parse_question(char_t* s, xml_node_struct*& ref_cursor, unsigned int optmsk, char_t endch)
02291                 {
02292                         // load into registers
02293                         xml_node_struct* cursor = ref_cursor;
02294                         char_t ch = 0;
02295 
02296                         // parse node contents, starting with question mark
02297                         ++s;
02298 
02299                         // read PI target
02300                         char_t* target = s;
02301 
02302                         if (!PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_pi, s);
02303 
02304                         PUGI__SCANWHILE(PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol));
02305                         PUGI__CHECK_ERROR(status_bad_pi, s);
02306 
02307                         // determine node type; stricmp / strcasecmp is not portable
02308                         bool declaration = (target[0] | ' ') == 'x' && (target[1] | ' ') == 'm' && (target[2] | ' ') == 'l' && target + 3 == s;
02309 
02310                         if (declaration ? PUGI__OPTSET(parse_declaration) : PUGI__OPTSET(parse_pi))
02311                         {
02312                                 if (declaration)
02313                                 {
02314                                         // disallow non top-level declarations
02315                                         if (cursor->parent) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_pi, s);
02316 
02317                                         PUGI__PUSHNODE(node_declaration);
02318                                 }
02319                                 else
02320                                 {
02321                                         PUGI__PUSHNODE(node_pi);
02322                                 }
02323 
02324                                 cursor->name = target;
02325 
02326                                 PUGI__ENDSEG();
02327 
02328                                 // parse value/attributes
02329                                 if (ch == '?')
02330                                 {
02331                                         // empty node
02332                                         if (!ENDSWITH(*s, '>')) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_pi, s);
02333                                         s += (*s == '>');
02334 
02335                                         PUGI__POPNODE();
02336                                 }
02337                                 else if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space))
02338                                 {
02339                                         PUGI__SKIPWS();
02340 
02341                                         // scan for tag end
02342                                         char_t* value = s;
02343 
02344                                         PUGI__SCANFOR(s[0] == '?' && ENDSWITH(s[1], '>'));
02345                                         PUGI__CHECK_ERROR(status_bad_pi, s);
02346 
02347                                         if (declaration)
02348                                         {
02349                                                 // replace ending ? with / so that 'element' terminates properly
02350                                                 *s = '/';
02351 
02352                                                 // we exit from this function with cursor at node_declaration, which is a signal to parse() to go to LOC_ATTRIBUTES
02353                                                 s = value;
02354                                         }
02355                                         else
02356                                         {
02357                                                 // store value and step over >
02358                                                 cursor->value = value;
02359                                                 PUGI__POPNODE();
02360 
02361                                                 PUGI__ENDSEG();
02362 
02363                                                 s += (*s == '>');
02364                                         }
02365                                 }
02366                                 else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_pi, s);
02367                         }
02368                         else
02369                         {
02370                                 // scan for tag end
02371                                 PUGI__SCANFOR(s[0] == '?' && ENDSWITH(s[1], '>'));
02372                                 PUGI__CHECK_ERROR(status_bad_pi, s);
02373 
02374                                 s += (s[1] == '>' ? 2 : 1);
02375                         }
02376 
02377                         // store from registers
02378                         ref_cursor = cursor;
02379 
02380                         return s;
02381                 }
02382 
02383                 char_t* parse(char_t* s, xml_node_struct* xmldoc, unsigned int optmsk, char_t endch)
02384                 {
02385                         strconv_attribute_t strconv_attribute = get_strconv_attribute(optmsk);
02386                         strconv_pcdata_t strconv_pcdata = get_strconv_pcdata(optmsk);
02387                         
02388                         char_t ch = 0;
02389                         xml_node_struct* cursor = xmldoc;
02390                         char_t* mark = s;
02391 
02392                         while (*s != 0)
02393                         {
02394                                 if (*s == '<')
02395                                 {
02396                                         ++s;
02397 
02398                                 LOC_TAG:
02399                                         if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) // '<#...'
02400                                         {
02401                                                 PUGI__PUSHNODE(node_element); // Append a new node to the tree.
02402 
02403                                                 cursor->name = s;
02404 
02405                                                 PUGI__SCANWHILE(PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol)); // Scan for a terminator.
02406                                                 PUGI__ENDSEG(); // Save char in 'ch', terminate & step over.
02407 
02408                                                 if (ch == '>')
02409                                                 {
02410                                                         // end of tag
02411                                                 }
02412                                                 else if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space))
02413                                                 {
02414                                                 LOC_ATTRIBUTES:
02415                                                         while (true)
02416                                                         {
02417                                                                 PUGI__SKIPWS(); // Eat any whitespace.
02418                                                 
02419                                                                 if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) // <... #...
02420                                                                 {
02421                                                                         xml_attribute_struct* a = append_attribute_ll(cursor, alloc); // Make space for this attribute.
02422                                                                         if (!a) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_out_of_memory, s);
02423 
02424                                                                         a->name = s; // Save the offset.
02425 
02426                                                                         PUGI__SCANWHILE(PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol)); // Scan for a terminator.
02427                                                                         PUGI__CHECK_ERROR(status_bad_attribute, s); //$ redundant, left for performance
02428 
02429                                                                         PUGI__ENDSEG(); // Save char in 'ch', terminate & step over.
02430                                                                         PUGI__CHECK_ERROR(status_bad_attribute, s); //$ redundant, left for performance
02431 
02432                                                                         if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space))
02433                                                                         {
02434                                                                                 PUGI__SKIPWS(); // Eat any whitespace.
02435                                                                                 PUGI__CHECK_ERROR(status_bad_attribute, s); //$ redundant, left for performance
02436 
02437                                                                                 ch = *s;
02438                                                                                 ++s;
02439                                                                         }
02440                                                                         
02441                                                                         if (ch == '=') // '<... #=...'
02442                                                                         {
02443                                                                                 PUGI__SKIPWS(); // Eat any whitespace.
02444 
02445                                                                                 if (*s == '"' || *s == '\'') // '<... #="...'
02446                                                                                 {
02447                                                                                         ch = *s; // Save quote char to avoid breaking on "''" -or- '""'.
02448                                                                                         ++s; // Step over the quote.
02449                                                                                         a->value = s; // Save the offset.
02450 
02451                                                                                         s = strconv_attribute(s, ch);
02452                                                                                 
02453                                                                                         if (!s) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_attribute, a->value);
02454 
02455                                                                                         // After this line the loop continues from the start;
02456                                                                                         // Whitespaces, / and > are ok, symbols and EOF are wrong,
02457                                                                                         // everything else will be detected
02458                                                                                         if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_start_symbol)) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_attribute, s);
02459                                                                                 }
02460                                                                                 else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_attribute, s);
02461                                                                         }
02462                                                                         else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_attribute, s);
02463                                                                 }
02464                                                                 else if (*s == '/')
02465                                                                 {
02466                                                                         ++s;
02467                                                                         
02468                                                                         if (*s == '>')
02469                                                                         {
02470                                                                                 PUGI__POPNODE();
02471                                                                                 s++;
02472                                                                                 break;
02473                                                                         }
02474                                                                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '>')
02475                                                                         {
02476                                                                                 PUGI__POPNODE();
02477                                                                                 break;
02478                                                                         }
02479                                                                         else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_start_element, s);
02480                                                                 }
02481                                                                 else if (*s == '>')
02482                                                                 {
02483                                                                         ++s;
02484 
02485                                                                         break;
02486                                                                 }
02487                                                                 else if (*s == 0 && endch == '>')
02488                                                                 {
02489                                                                         break;
02490                                                                 }
02491                                                                 else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_start_element, s);
02492                                                         }
02493 
02494                                                         // !!!
02495                                                 }
02496                                                 else if (ch == '/') // '<#.../'
02497                                                 {
02498                                                         if (!ENDSWITH(*s, '>')) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_start_element, s);
02499 
02500                                                         PUGI__POPNODE(); // Pop.
02501 
02502                                                         s += (*s == '>');
02503                                                 }
02504                                                 else if (ch == 0)
02505                                                 {
02506                                                         // we stepped over null terminator, backtrack & handle closing tag
02507                                                         --s;
02508                                                         
02509                                                         if (endch != '>') PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_start_element, s);
02510                                                 }
02511                                                 else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_start_element, s);
02512                                         }
02513                                         else if (*s == '/')
02514                                         {
02515                                                 ++s;
02516 
02517                                                 char_t* name = cursor->name;
02518                                                 if (!name) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_end_element_mismatch, s);
02519                                                 
02520                                                 while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*s, ct_symbol))
02521                                                 {
02522                                                         if (*s++ != *name++) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_end_element_mismatch, s);
02523                                                 }
02524 
02525                                                 if (*name)
02526                                                 {
02527                                                         if (*s == 0 && name[0] == endch && name[1] == 0) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_end_element, s);
02528                                                         else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_end_element_mismatch, s);
02529                                                 }
02530                                                         
02531                                                 PUGI__POPNODE(); // Pop.
02532 
02533                                                 PUGI__SKIPWS();
02534 
02535                                                 if (*s == 0)
02536                                                 {
02537                                                         if (endch != '>') PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_end_element, s);
02538                                                 }
02539                                                 else
02540                                                 {
02541                                                         if (*s != '>') PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_end_element, s);
02542                                                         ++s;
02543                                                 }
02544                                         }
02545                                         else if (*s == '?') // '<?...'
02546                                         {
02547                                                 s = parse_question(s, cursor, optmsk, endch);
02548                                                 if (!s) return s;
02549 
02550                                                 assert(cursor);
02551                                                 if ((cursor->header & xml_memory_page_type_mask) + 1 == node_declaration) goto LOC_ATTRIBUTES;
02552                                         }
02553                                         else if (*s == '!') // '<!...'
02554                                         {
02555                                                 s = parse_exclamation(s, cursor, optmsk, endch);
02556                                                 if (!s) return s;
02557                                         }
02558                                         else if (*s == 0 && endch == '?') PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_bad_pi, s);
02559                                         else PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_unrecognized_tag, s);
02560                                 }
02561                                 else
02562                                 {
02563                                         mark = s; // Save this offset while searching for a terminator.
02564 
02565                                         PUGI__SKIPWS(); // Eat whitespace if no genuine PCDATA here.
02566 
02567                                         if (*s == '<')
02568                                         {
02569                                                 // We skipped some whitespace characters because otherwise we would take the tag branch instead of PCDATA one
02570                                                 assert(mark != s);
02571 
02572                                                 if (!PUGI__OPTSET(parse_ws_pcdata | parse_ws_pcdata_single))
02573                                                 {
02574                                                         continue;
02575                                                 }
02576                                                 else if (PUGI__OPTSET(parse_ws_pcdata_single))
02577                                                 {
02578                                                         if (s[1] != '/' || cursor->first_child) continue;
02579                                                 }
02580                                         }
02581 
02582                                         s = mark;
02583                                                         
02584                                         if (cursor->parent)
02585                                         {
02586                                                 PUGI__PUSHNODE(node_pcdata); // Append a new node on the tree.
02587                                                 cursor->value = s; // Save the offset.
02588 
02589                                                 s = strconv_pcdata(s);
02590                                                                 
02591                                                 PUGI__POPNODE(); // Pop since this is a standalone.
02592                                                 
02593                                                 if (!*s) break;
02594                                         }
02595                                         else
02596                                         {
02597                                                 PUGI__SCANFOR(*s == '<'); // '...<'
02598                                                 if (!*s) break;
02599                                                 
02600                                                 ++s;
02601                                         }
02602 
02603                                         // We're after '<'
02604                                         goto LOC_TAG;
02605                                 }
02606                         }
02607 
02608                         // check that last tag is closed
02609                         if (cursor != xmldoc) PUGI__THROW_ERROR(status_end_element_mismatch, s);
02610 
02611                         return s;
02612                 }
02613 
02614                 static xml_parse_result parse(char_t* buffer, size_t length, xml_node_struct* root, unsigned int optmsk)
02615                 {
02616                         xml_document_struct* xmldoc = static_cast<xml_document_struct*>(root);
02617 
02618                         // store buffer for offset_debug
02619                         xmldoc->buffer = buffer;
02620 
02621                         // early-out for empty documents
02622                         if (length == 0) return make_parse_result(status_ok);
02623 
02624                         // create parser on stack
02625                         xml_parser parser(*xmldoc);
02626 
02627                         // save last character and make buffer zero-terminated (speeds up parsing)
02628                         char_t endch = buffer[length - 1];
02629                         buffer[length - 1] = 0;
02630                         
02631                         // perform actual parsing
02632                         parser.parse(buffer, xmldoc, optmsk, endch);
02633 
02634                         xml_parse_result result = make_parse_result(parser.error_status, parser.error_offset ? parser.error_offset - buffer : 0);
02635                         assert(result.offset >= 0 && static_cast<size_t>(result.offset) <= length);
02636 
02637                         // update allocator state
02638                         *static_cast<xml_allocator*>(xmldoc) = parser.alloc;
02639 
02640                         // since we removed last character, we have to handle the only possible false positive
02641                         if (result && endch == '<')
02642                         {
02643                                 // there's no possible well-formed document with < at the end
02644                                 return make_parse_result(status_unrecognized_tag, length);
02645                         }
02646 
02647                         return result;
02648                 }
02649         };
02650 
02651         // Output facilities
02652         PUGI__FN xml_encoding get_write_native_encoding()
02653         {
02654         #ifdef PUGIXML_WCHAR_MODE
02655                 return get_wchar_encoding();
02656         #else
02657                 return encoding_utf8;
02658         #endif
02659         }
02660 
02661         PUGI__FN xml_encoding get_write_encoding(xml_encoding encoding)
02662         {
02663                 // replace wchar encoding with utf implementation
02664                 if (encoding == encoding_wchar) return get_wchar_encoding();
02665 
02666                 // replace utf16 encoding with utf16 with specific endianness
02667                 if (encoding == encoding_utf16) return is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf16_le : encoding_utf16_be;
02668 
02669                 // replace utf32 encoding with utf32 with specific endianness
02670                 if (encoding == encoding_utf32) return is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf32_le : encoding_utf32_be;
02671 
02672                 // only do autodetection if no explicit encoding is requested
02673                 if (encoding != encoding_auto) return encoding;
02674 
02675                 // assume utf8 encoding
02676                 return encoding_utf8;
02677         }
02678 
02679 #ifdef PUGIXML_WCHAR_MODE
02680         PUGI__FN size_t get_valid_length(const char_t* data, size_t length)
02681         {
02682                 assert(length > 0);
02683 
02684                 // discard last character if it's the lead of a surrogate pair 
02685                 return (sizeof(wchar_t) == 2 && static_cast<unsigned int>(static_cast<uint16_t>(data[length - 1]) - 0xD800) < 0x400) ? length - 1 : length;
02686         }
02687 
02688         PUGI__FN size_t convert_buffer(char_t* r_char, uint8_t* r_u8, uint16_t* r_u16, uint32_t* r_u32, const char_t* data, size_t length, xml_encoding encoding)
02689         {
02690                 // only endian-swapping is required
02691                 if (need_endian_swap_utf(encoding, get_wchar_encoding()))
02692                 {
02693                         convert_wchar_endian_swap(r_char, data, length);
02694 
02695                         return length * sizeof(char_t);
02696                 }
02697         
02698                 // convert to utf8
02699                 if (encoding == encoding_utf8)
02700                 {
02701                         uint8_t* dest = r_u8;
02702                         uint8_t* end = utf_decoder<utf8_writer>::decode_wchar_block(data, length, dest);
02703 
02704                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest);
02705                 }
02706 
02707                 // convert to utf16
02708                 if (encoding == encoding_utf16_be || encoding == encoding_utf16_le)
02709                 {
02710                         uint16_t* dest = r_u16;
02711 
02712                         // convert to native utf16
02713                         uint16_t* end = utf_decoder<utf16_writer>::decode_wchar_block(data, length, dest);
02714 
02715                         // swap if necessary
02716                         xml_encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf16_le : encoding_utf16_be;
02717 
02718                         if (native_encoding != encoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest));
02719 
02720                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint16_t);
02721                 }
02722 
02723                 // convert to utf32
02724                 if (encoding == encoding_utf32_be || encoding == encoding_utf32_le)
02725                 {
02726                         uint32_t* dest = r_u32;
02727 
02728                         // convert to native utf32
02729                         uint32_t* end = utf_decoder<utf32_writer>::decode_wchar_block(data, length, dest);
02730 
02731                         // swap if necessary
02732                         xml_encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf32_le : encoding_utf32_be;
02733 
02734                         if (native_encoding != encoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest));
02735 
02736                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint32_t);
02737                 }
02738 
02739                 // convert to latin1
02740                 if (encoding == encoding_latin1)
02741                 {
02742                         uint8_t* dest = r_u8;
02743                         uint8_t* end = utf_decoder<latin1_writer>::decode_wchar_block(data, length, dest);
02744 
02745                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest);
02746                 }
02747 
02748                 assert(!"Invalid encoding");
02749                 return 0;
02750         }
02751 #else
02752         PUGI__FN size_t get_valid_length(const char_t* data, size_t length)
02753         {
02754                 assert(length > 4);
02755 
02756                 for (size_t i = 1; i <= 4; ++i)
02757                 {
02758                         uint8_t ch = static_cast<uint8_t>(data[length - i]);
02759 
02760                         // either a standalone character or a leading one
02761                         if ((ch & 0xc0) != 0x80) return length - i;
02762                 }
02763 
02764                 // there are four non-leading characters at the end, sequence tail is broken so might as well process the whole chunk
02765                 return length;
02766         }
02767 
02768         PUGI__FN size_t convert_buffer(char_t* /* r_char */, uint8_t* r_u8, uint16_t* r_u16, uint32_t* r_u32, const char_t* data, size_t length, xml_encoding encoding)
02769         {
02770                 if (encoding == encoding_utf16_be || encoding == encoding_utf16_le)
02771                 {
02772                         uint16_t* dest = r_u16;
02773 
02774                         // convert to native utf16
02775                         uint16_t* end = utf_decoder<utf16_writer>::decode_utf8_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(data), length, dest);
02776 
02777                         // swap if necessary
02778                         xml_encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf16_le : encoding_utf16_be;
02779 
02780                         if (native_encoding != encoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest));
02781 
02782                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint16_t);
02783                 }
02784 
02785                 if (encoding == encoding_utf32_be || encoding == encoding_utf32_le)
02786                 {
02787                         uint32_t* dest = r_u32;
02788 
02789                         // convert to native utf32
02790                         uint32_t* end = utf_decoder<utf32_writer>::decode_utf8_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(data), length, dest);
02791 
02792                         // swap if necessary
02793                         xml_encoding native_encoding = is_little_endian() ? encoding_utf32_le : encoding_utf32_be;
02794 
02795                         if (native_encoding != encoding) convert_utf_endian_swap(dest, dest, static_cast<size_t>(end - dest));
02796 
02797                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest) * sizeof(uint32_t);
02798                 }
02799 
02800                 if (encoding == encoding_latin1)
02801                 {
02802                         uint8_t* dest = r_u8;
02803                         uint8_t* end = utf_decoder<latin1_writer>::decode_utf8_block(reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(data), length, dest);
02804 
02805                         return static_cast<size_t>(end - dest);
02806                 }
02807 
02808                 assert(!"Invalid encoding");
02809                 return 0;
02810         }
02811 #endif
02812 
02813         class xml_buffered_writer
02814         {
02815                 xml_buffered_writer(const xml_buffered_writer&);
02816                 xml_buffered_writer& operator=(const xml_buffered_writer&);
02817 
02818         public:
02819                 xml_buffered_writer(xml_writer& writer_, xml_encoding user_encoding): writer(writer_), bufsize(0), encoding(get_write_encoding(user_encoding))
02820                 {
02821                         PUGI__STATIC_ASSERT(bufcapacity >= 8);
02822                 }
02823 
02824                 ~xml_buffered_writer()
02825                 {
02826                         flush();
02827                 }
02828 
02829                 void flush()
02830                 {
02831                         flush(buffer, bufsize);
02832                         bufsize = 0;
02833                 }
02834 
02835                 void flush(const char_t* data, size_t size)
02836                 {
02837                         if (size == 0) return;
02838 
02839                         // fast path, just write data
02840                         if (encoding == get_write_native_encoding())
02841                                 writer.write(data, size * sizeof(char_t));
02842                         else
02843                         {
02844                                 // convert chunk
02845                                 size_t result = convert_buffer(scratch.data_char, scratch.data_u8, scratch.data_u16, scratch.data_u32, data, size, encoding);
02846                                 assert(result <= sizeof(scratch));
02847 
02848                                 // write data
02849                                 writer.write(scratch.data_u8, result);
02850                         }
02851                 }
02852 
02853                 void write(const char_t* data, size_t length)
02854                 {
02855                         if (bufsize + length > bufcapacity)
02856                         {
02857                                 // flush the remaining buffer contents
02858                                 flush();
02859 
02860                                 // handle large chunks
02861                                 if (length > bufcapacity)
02862                                 {
02863                                         if (encoding == get_write_native_encoding())
02864                                         {
02865                                                 // fast path, can just write data chunk
02866                                                 writer.write(data, length * sizeof(char_t));
02867                                                 return;
02868                                         }
02869 
02870                                         // need to convert in suitable chunks
02871                                         while (length > bufcapacity)
02872                                         {
02873                                                 // get chunk size by selecting such number of characters that are guaranteed to fit into scratch buffer
02874                                                 // and form a complete codepoint sequence (i.e. discard start of last codepoint if necessary)
02875                                                 size_t chunk_size = get_valid_length(data, bufcapacity);
02876 
02877                                                 // convert chunk and write
02878                                                 flush(data, chunk_size);
02879 
02880                                                 // iterate
02881                                                 data += chunk_size;
02882                                                 length -= chunk_size;
02883                                         }
02884 
02885                                         // small tail is copied below
02886                                         bufsize = 0;
02887                                 }
02888                         }
02889 
02890                         memcpy(buffer + bufsize, data, length * sizeof(char_t));
02891                         bufsize += length;
02892                 }
02893 
02894                 void write(const char_t* data)
02895                 {
02896                         write(data, strlength(data));
02897                 }
02898 
02899                 void write(char_t d0)
02900                 {
02901                         if (bufsize + 1 > bufcapacity) flush();
02902 
02903                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0;
02904                         bufsize += 1;
02905                 }
02906 
02907                 void write(char_t d0, char_t d1)
02908                 {
02909                         if (bufsize + 2 > bufcapacity) flush();
02910 
02911                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0;
02912                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1;
02913                         bufsize += 2;
02914                 }
02915 
02916                 void write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2)
02917                 {
02918                         if (bufsize + 3 > bufcapacity) flush();
02919 
02920                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0;
02921                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1;
02922                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2;
02923                         bufsize += 3;
02924                 }
02925 
02926                 void write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2, char_t d3)
02927                 {
02928                         if (bufsize + 4 > bufcapacity) flush();
02929 
02930                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0;
02931                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1;
02932                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2;
02933                         buffer[bufsize + 3] = d3;
02934                         bufsize += 4;
02935                 }
02936 
02937                 void write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2, char_t d3, char_t d4)
02938                 {
02939                         if (bufsize + 5 > bufcapacity) flush();
02940 
02941                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0;
02942                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1;
02943                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2;
02944                         buffer[bufsize + 3] = d3;
02945                         buffer[bufsize + 4] = d4;
02946                         bufsize += 5;
02947                 }
02948 
02949                 void write(char_t d0, char_t d1, char_t d2, char_t d3, char_t d4, char_t d5)
02950                 {
02951                         if (bufsize + 6 > bufcapacity) flush();
02952 
02953                         buffer[bufsize + 0] = d0;
02954                         buffer[bufsize + 1] = d1;
02955                         buffer[bufsize + 2] = d2;
02956                         buffer[bufsize + 3] = d3;
02957                         buffer[bufsize + 4] = d4;
02958                         buffer[bufsize + 5] = d5;
02959                         bufsize += 6;
02960                 }
02961 
02962                 // utf8 maximum expansion: x4 (-> utf32)
02963                 // utf16 maximum expansion: x2 (-> utf32)
02964                 // utf32 maximum expansion: x1
02965                 enum
02966                 {
02967                         bufcapacitybytes =
02968                         #ifdef PUGIXML_MEMORY_OUTPUT_STACK
02969                                 PUGIXML_MEMORY_OUTPUT_STACK
02970                         #else
02971                                 10240
02972                         #endif
02973                         ,
02974                         bufcapacity = bufcapacitybytes / (sizeof(char_t) + 4)
02975                 };
02976 
02977                 char_t buffer[bufcapacity];
02978 
02979                 union
02980                 {
02981                         uint8_t data_u8[4 * bufcapacity];
02982                         uint16_t data_u16[2 * bufcapacity];
02983                         uint32_t data_u32[bufcapacity];
02984                         char_t data_char[bufcapacity];
02985                 } scratch;
02986 
02987                 xml_writer& writer;
02988                 size_t bufsize;
02989                 xml_encoding encoding;
02990         };
02991 
02992         PUGI__FN void text_output_escaped(xml_buffered_writer& writer, const char_t* s, chartypex_t type)
02993         {
02994                 while (*s)
02995                 {
02996                         const char_t* prev = s;
02997                         
02998                         // While *s is a usual symbol
02999                         while (!PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*s, type)) ++s;
03000                 
03001                         writer.write(prev, static_cast<size_t>(s - prev));
03002 
03003                         switch (*s)
03004                         {
03005                                 case 0: break;
03006                                 case '&':
03007                                         writer.write('&', 'a', 'm', 'p', ';');
03008                                         ++s;
03009                                         break;
03010                                 case '<':
03011                                         writer.write('&', 'l', 't', ';');
03012                                         ++s;
03013                                         break;
03014                                 case '>':
03015                                         writer.write('&', 'g', 't', ';');
03016                                         ++s;
03017                                         break;
03018                                 case '"':
03019                                         writer.write('&', 'q', 'u', 'o', 't', ';');
03020                                         ++s;
03021                                         break;
03022                                 default: // s is not a usual symbol
03023                                 {
03024                                         unsigned int ch = static_cast<unsigned int>(*s++);
03025                                         assert(ch < 32);
03026 
03027                                         writer.write('&', '#', static_cast<char_t>((ch / 10) + '0'), static_cast<char_t>((ch % 10) + '0'), ';');
03028                                 }
03029                         }
03030                 }
03031         }
03032 
03033         PUGI__FN void text_output(xml_buffered_writer& writer, const char_t* s, chartypex_t type, unsigned int flags)
03034         {
03035                 if (flags & format_no_escapes)
03036                         writer.write(s);
03037                 else
03038                         text_output_escaped(writer, s, type);
03039         }
03040 
03041         PUGI__FN void text_output_cdata(xml_buffered_writer& writer, const char_t* s)
03042         {
03043                 do
03044                 {
03045                         writer.write('<', '!', '[', 'C', 'D');
03046                         writer.write('A', 'T', 'A', '[');
03047 
03048                         const char_t* prev = s;
03049 
03050                         // look for ]]> sequence - we can't output it as is since it terminates CDATA
03051                         while (*s && !(s[0] == ']' && s[1] == ']' && s[2] == '>')) ++s;
03052 
03053                         // skip ]] if we stopped at ]]>, > will go to the next CDATA section
03054                         if (*s) s += 2;
03055 
03056                         writer.write(prev, static_cast<size_t>(s - prev));
03057 
03058                         writer.write(']', ']', '>');
03059                 }
03060                 while (*s);
03061         }
03062 
03063         PUGI__FN void node_output_attributes(xml_buffered_writer& writer, const xml_node& node, unsigned int flags)
03064         {
03065                 const char_t* default_name = PUGIXML_TEXT(":anonymous");
03066 
03067                 for (xml_attribute a = node.first_attribute(); a; a = a.next_attribute())
03068                 {
03069                         writer.write(' ');
03070                         writer.write(a.name()[0] ? a.name() : default_name);
03071                         writer.write('=', '"');
03072 
03073                         text_output(writer, a.value(), ctx_special_attr, flags);
03074 
03075                         writer.write('"');
03076                 }
03077         }
03078 
03079         PUGI__FN void node_output(xml_buffered_writer& writer, const xml_node& node, const char_t* indent, unsigned int flags, unsigned int depth)
03080         {
03081                 const char_t* default_name = PUGIXML_TEXT(":anonymous");
03082 
03083                 if ((flags & format_indent) != 0 && (flags & format_raw) == 0)
03084                         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < depth; ++i) writer.write(indent);
03085 
03086                 switch (node.type())
03087                 {
03088                 case node_document:
03089                 {
03090                         for (xml_node n = node.first_child(); n; n = n.next_sibling())
03091                                 node_output(writer, n, indent, flags, depth);
03092                         break;
03093                 }
03094                         
03095                 case node_element:
03096                 {
03097                         const char_t* name = node.name()[0] ? node.name() : default_name;
03098 
03099                         writer.write('<');
03100                         writer.write(name);
03101 
03102                         node_output_attributes(writer, node, flags);
03103 
03104                         if (flags & format_raw)
03105                         {
03106                                 if (!node.first_child())
03107                                         writer.write(' ', '/', '>');
03108                                 else
03109                                 {
03110                                         writer.write('>');
03111 
03112                                         for (xml_node n = node.first_child(); n; n = n.next_sibling())
03113                                                 node_output(writer, n, indent, flags, depth + 1);
03114 
03115                                         writer.write('<', '/');
03116                                         writer.write(name);
03117                                         writer.write('>');
03118                                 }
03119                         }
03120                         else if (!node.first_child())
03121                                 writer.write(' ', '/', '>', '\n');
03122                         else if (node.first_child() == node.last_child() && (node.first_child().type() == node_pcdata || node.first_child().type() == node_cdata))
03123                         {
03124                                 writer.write('>');
03125 
03126                                 if (node.first_child().type() == node_pcdata)
03127                                         text_output(writer, node.first_child().value(), ctx_special_pcdata, flags);
03128                                 else
03129                                         text_output_cdata(writer, node.first_child().value());
03130 
03131                                 writer.write('<', '/');
03132                                 writer.write(name);
03133                                 writer.write('>', '\n');
03134                         }
03135                         else
03136                         {
03137                                 writer.write('>', '\n');
03138                                 
03139                                 for (xml_node n = node.first_child(); n; n = n.next_sibling())
03140                                         node_output(writer, n, indent, flags, depth + 1);
03141 
03142                                 if ((flags & format_indent) != 0 && (flags & format_raw) == 0)
03143                                         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < depth; ++i) writer.write(indent);
03144                                 
03145                                 writer.write('<', '/');
03146                                 writer.write(name);
03147                                 writer.write('>', '\n');
03148                         }
03149 
03150                         break;
03151                 }
03152                 
03153                 case node_pcdata:
03154                         text_output(writer, node.value(), ctx_special_pcdata, flags);
03155                         if ((flags & format_raw) == 0) writer.write('\n');
03156                         break;
03157 
03158                 case node_cdata:
03159                         text_output_cdata(writer, node.value());
03160                         if ((flags & format_raw) == 0) writer.write('\n');
03161                         break;
03162 
03163                 case node_comment:
03164                         writer.write('<', '!', '-', '-');
03165                         writer.write(node.value());
03166                         writer.write('-', '-', '>');
03167                         if ((flags & format_raw) == 0) writer.write('\n');
03168                         break;
03169 
03170                 case node_pi:
03171                 case node_declaration:
03172                         writer.write('<', '?');
03173                         writer.write(node.name()[0] ? node.name() : default_name);
03174 
03175                         if (node.type() == node_declaration)
03176                         {
03177                                 node_output_attributes(writer, node, flags);
03178                         }
03179                         else if (node.value()[0])
03180                         {
03181                                 writer.write(' ');
03182                                 writer.write(node.value());
03183                         }
03184 
03185                         writer.write('?', '>');
03186                         if ((flags & format_raw) == 0) writer.write('\n');
03187                         break;
03188 
03189                 case node_doctype:
03190                         writer.write('<', '!', 'D', 'O', 'C');
03191                         writer.write('T', 'Y', 'P', 'E');
03192 
03193                         if (node.value()[0])
03194                         {
03195                                 writer.write(' ');
03196                                 writer.write(node.value());
03197                         }
03198 
03199                         writer.write('>');
03200                         if ((flags & format_raw) == 0) writer.write('\n');
03201                         break;
03202 
03203                 default:
03204                         assert(!"Invalid node type");
03205                 }
03206         }
03207 
03208         inline bool has_declaration(const xml_node& node)
03209         {
03210                 for (xml_node child = node.first_child(); child; child = child.next_sibling())
03211                 {
03212                         xml_node_type type = child.type();
03213 
03214                         if (type == node_declaration) return true;
03215                         if (type == node_element) return false;
03216                 }
03217 
03218                 return false;
03219         }
03220 
03221         inline bool allow_insert_child(xml_node_type parent, xml_node_type child)
03222         {
03223                 if (parent != node_document && parent != node_element) return false;
03224                 if (child == node_document || child == node_null) return false;
03225                 if (parent != node_document && (child == node_declaration || child == node_doctype)) return false;
03226 
03227                 return true;
03228         }
03229 
03230         PUGI__FN void recursive_copy_skip(xml_node& dest, const xml_node& source, const xml_node& skip)
03231         {
03232                 assert(dest.type() == source.type());
03233
