05182         PUGI__FN xml_parse_result xml_document::load(std::basic_istream<char, std::char_traits<char> >& stream, unsigned int options, xml_encoding encoding)
05183         {
05184                 reset();
05185 
05186                 return impl::load_stream_impl(*this, stream, options, encoding);
05187         }
05188 
05189         PUGI__FN xml_parse_result xml_document::load(std::basic_istream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >& stream, unsigned int options)
05190         {
05191                 reset();
05192 
05193                 return impl::load_stream_impl(*this, stream, options, encoding_wchar);
05194         }
05195 #endif
05196 
05197         PUGI__FN xml_parse_result xml_document::load(const char_t* contents, unsigned int options)
05198         {
05199                 // Force native encoding (skip autodetection)
05200         #ifdef PUGIXML_WCHAR_MODE
05201                 xml_encoding encoding = encoding_wchar;
05202         #else
05203                 xml_encoding encoding = encoding_utf8;
05204         #endif
05205 
05206                 return load_buffer(contents, impl::strlength(contents) * sizeof(char_t), options, encoding);
05207         }
05208 
05209         PUGI__FN xml_parse_result xml_document::load_file(const char* path_, unsigned int options, xml_encoding encoding)
05210         {
05211                 reset();
05212 
05213                 FILE* file = fopen(path_, "rb");
05214 
05215                 return impl::load_file_impl(*this, file, options, encoding);
05216         }
05217 
05218         PUGI__FN xml_parse_result xml_document::load_file(const wchar_t* path_, unsigned int options, xml_encoding encoding)
05219         {
05220                 reset();
05221 
05222                 FILE* file = impl::open_file_wide(path_, L"rb");
05223 
05224                 return impl::load_file_impl(*this, file, options, encoding);
05225         }
05226 
05227         PUGI__FN xml_parse_result xml_document::load_buffer_impl(void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options, xml_encoding encoding, bool is_mutable, bool own)
05228         {
05229                 reset();
05230 
05231                 // check input buffer
05232                 assert(contents || size == 0);
05233 
05234                 // get actual encoding
05235                 xml_encoding buffer_encoding = impl::get_buffer_encoding(encoding, contents, size);
05236 
05237                 // get private buffer
05238                 char_t* buffer = 0;
05239                 size_t length = 0;
05240 
05241                 if (!impl::convert_buffer(buffer, length, buffer_encoding, contents, size, is_mutable)) return impl::make_parse_result(status_out_of_memory);
05242                 
05243                 // delete original buffer if we performed a conversion
05244                 if (own && buffer != contents && contents) impl::xml_memory::deallocate(contents);
05245 
05246                 // parse
05247                 xml_parse_result res = impl::xml_parser::parse(buffer, length, _root, options);
05248 
05249                 // remember encoding
05250                 res.encoding = buffer_encoding;
05251 
05252                 // grab onto buffer if it's our buffer, user is responsible for deallocating contens himself
05253                 if (own || buffer != contents) _buffer = buffer;
05254 
05255                 return res;
05256         }
05257 
05258         PUGI__FN xml_parse_result xml_document::load_buffer(const void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options, xml_encoding encoding)
05259         {
05260                 return load_buffer_impl(const_cast<void*>(contents), size, options, encoding, false, false);
05261         }
05262 
05263         PUGI__FN xml_parse_result xml_document::load_buffer_inplace(void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options, xml_encoding encoding)
05264         {
05265                 return load_buffer_impl(contents, size, options, encoding, true, false);
05266         }
05267                 
05268         PUGI__FN xml_parse_result xml_document::load_buffer_inplace_own(void* contents, size_t size, unsigned int options, xml_encoding encoding)
05269         {
05270                 return load_buffer_impl(contents, size, options, encoding, true, true);
05271         }
05272 
05273         PUGI__FN void xml_document::save(xml_writer& writer, const char_t* indent, unsigned int flags, xml_encoding encoding) const
05274         {
05275                 impl::xml_buffered_writer buffered_writer(writer, encoding);
05276 
05277                 if ((flags & format_write_bom) && encoding != encoding_latin1)
05278                 {
05279                         // BOM always represents the codepoint U+FEFF, so just write it in native encoding
05280                 #ifdef PUGIXML_WCHAR_MODE
05281                         unsigned int bom = 0xfeff;
05282                         buffered_writer.write(static_cast<wchar_t>(bom));
05283                 #else
05284                         buffered_writer.write('\xef', '\xbb', '\xbf');
05285                 #endif
05286                 }
05287 
05288                 if (!(flags & format_no_declaration) && !impl::has_declaration(*this))
05289                 {
05290                         buffered_writer.write(PUGIXML_TEXT("<?xml version=\"1.0\""));
05291                         if (encoding == encoding_latin1) buffered_writer.write(PUGIXML_TEXT(" encoding=\"ISO-8859-1\""));
05292                         buffered_writer.write('?', '>');
05293                         if (!(flags & format_raw)) buffered_writer.write('\n');
05294                 }
05295 
05296                 impl::node_output(buffered_writer, *this, indent, flags, 0);
05297         }
05298 
05299 #ifndef PUGIXML_NO_STL
05300         PUGI__FN void xml_document::save(std::basic_ostream<char, std::char_traits<char> >& stream, const char_t* indent, unsigned int flags, xml_encoding encoding) const
05301         {
05302                 xml_writer_stream writer(stream);
05303 
05304                 save(writer, indent, flags, encoding);
05305         }
05306 
05307         PUGI__FN void xml_document::save(std::basic_ostream<wchar_t, std::char_traits<wchar_t> >& stream, const char_t* indent, unsigned int flags) const
05308         {
05309                 xml_writer_stream writer(stream);
05310 
05311                 save(writer, indent, flags, encoding_wchar);
05312         }
05313 #endif
05314 
05315         PUGI__FN bool xml_document::save_file(const char* path_, const char_t* indent, unsigned int flags, xml_encoding encoding) const
05316         {
05317                 FILE* file = fopen(path_, (flags & format_save_file_text) ? "w" : "wb");
05318                 return impl::save_file_impl(*this, file, indent, flags, encoding);
05319         }
05320 
05321         PUGI__FN bool xml_document::save_file(const wchar_t* path_, const char_t* indent, unsigned int flags, xml_encoding encoding) const
05322         {
05323                 FILE* file = impl::open_file_wide(path_, (flags & format_save_file_text) ? L"w" : L"wb");
05324                 return impl::save_file_impl(*this, file, indent, flags, encoding);
05325         }
05326 
05327         PUGI__FN xml_node xml_document::document_element() const
05328         {
05329                 for (xml_node_struct* i = _root->first_child; i; i = i->next_sibling)
05330                         if ((i->header & impl::xml_memory_page_type_mask) + 1 == node_element)
05331                                 return xml_node(i);
05332 
05333                 return xml_node();
05334         }
05335 
05336 #ifndef PUGIXML_NO_STL
05337         PUGI__FN std::string PUGIXML_FUNCTION as_utf8(const wchar_t* str)
05338         {
05339                 assert(str);
05340 
05341                 return impl::as_utf8_impl(str, wcslen(str));
05342         }
05343 
05344         PUGI__FN std::string PUGIXML_FUNCTION as_utf8(const std::basic_string<wchar_t>& str)
05345         {
05346                 return impl::as_utf8_impl(str.c_str(), str.size());
05347         }
05348         
05349         PUGI__FN std::basic_string<wchar_t> PUGIXML_FUNCTION as_wide(const char* str)
05350         {
05351                 assert(str);
05352 
05353                 return impl::as_wide_impl(str, strlen(str));
05354         }
05355         
05356         PUGI__FN std::basic_string<wchar_t> PUGIXML_FUNCTION as_wide(const std::string& str)
05357         {
05358                 return impl::as_wide_impl(str.c_str(), str.size());
05359         }
05360 #endif
05361 
05362         PUGI__FN void PUGIXML_FUNCTION set_memory_management_functions(allocation_function allocate, deallocation_function deallocate)
05363         {
05364                 impl::xml_memory::allocate = allocate;
05365                 impl::xml_memory::deallocate = deallocate;
05366         }
05367 
05368         PUGI__FN allocation_function PUGIXML_FUNCTION get_memory_allocation_function()
05369         {
05370                 return impl::xml_memory::allocate;
05371         }
05372 
05373         PUGI__FN deallocation_function PUGIXML_FUNCTION get_memory_deallocation_function()
05374         {
05375                 return impl::xml_memory::deallocate;
05376         }
05377 }
05378 
05379 #if !defined(PUGIXML_NO_STL) && (defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__ICC))
05380 namespace std
05381 {
05382         // Workarounds for (non-standard) iterator category detection for older versions (MSVC7/IC8 and earlier)
05383         PUGI__FN std::bidirectional_iterator_tag _Iter_cat(const pugi::xml_node_iterator&)
05384         {
05385                 return std::bidirectional_iterator_tag();
05386         }
05387 
05388         PUGI__FN std::bidirectional_iterator_tag _Iter_cat(const pugi::xml_attribute_iterator&)
05389         {
05390                 return std::bidirectional_iterator_tag();
05391         }
05392 
05393         PUGI__FN std::forward_iterator_tag _Iter_cat(const pugi::xml_named_node_iterator&)
05394         {
05395                 return std::forward_iterator_tag();
05396         }
05397 }
05398 #endif
05399 
05400 #if !defined(PUGIXML_NO_STL) && defined(__SUNPRO_CC)
05401 namespace std
05402 {
05403         // Workarounds for (non-standard) iterator category detection
05404         PUGI__FN std::bidirectional_iterator_tag __iterator_category(const pugi::xml_node_iterator&)
05405         {
05406                 return std::bidirectional_iterator_tag();
05407         }
05408 
05409         PUGI__FN std::bidirectional_iterator_tag __iterator_category(const pugi::xml_attribute_iterator&)
05410         {
05411                 return std::bidirectional_iterator_tag();
05412         }
05413 
05414         PUGI__FN std::forward_iterator_tag __iterator_category(const pugi::xml_named_node_iterator&)
05415         {
05416                 return std::forward_iterator_tag();
05417         }
05418 }
05419 #endif
05420 
05421 #ifndef PUGIXML_NO_XPATH
05422 
05423 // STL replacements
05424 PUGI__NS_BEGIN
05425         struct equal_to
05426         {
05427                 template <typename T> bool operator()(const T& lhs, const T& rhs) const
05428                 {
05429                         return lhs == rhs;
05430                 }
05431         };
05432 
05433         struct not_equal_to
05434         {
05435                 template <typename T> bool operator()(const T& lhs, const T& rhs) const
05436                 {
05437                         return lhs != rhs;
05438                 }
05439         };
05440 
05441         struct less
05442         {
05443                 template <typename T> bool operator()(const T& lhs, const T& rhs) const
05444                 {
05445                         return lhs < rhs;
05446                 }
05447         };
05448 
05449         struct less_equal
05450         {
05451                 template <typename T> bool operator()(const T& lhs, const T& rhs) const
05452                 {
05453                         return lhs <= rhs;
05454                 }
05455         };
05456 
05457         template <typename T> void swap(T& lhs, T& rhs)
05458         {
05459                 T temp = lhs;
05460                 lhs = rhs;
05461                 rhs = temp;
05462         }
05463 
05464         template <typename I, typename Pred> I min_element(I begin, I end, const Pred& pred)
05465         {
05466                 I result = begin;
05467 
05468                 for (I it = begin + 1; it != end; ++it)
05469                         if (pred(*it, *result))
05470                                 result = it;
05471 
05472                 return result;
05473         }
05474 
05475         template <typename I> void reverse(I begin, I end)
05476         {
05477                 while (begin + 1 < end) swap(*begin++, *--end);
05478         }
05479 
05480         template <typename I> I unique(I begin, I end)
05481         {
05482                 // fast skip head
05483                 while (begin + 1 < end && *begin != *(begin + 1)) begin++;
05484 
05485                 if (begin == end) return begin;
05486 
05487                 // last written element
05488                 I write = begin++; 
05489 
05490                 // merge unique elements
05491                 while (begin != end)
05492                 {
05493                         if (*begin != *write)
05494                                 *++write = *begin++;
05495                         else
05496                                 begin++;
05497                 }
05498 
05499                 // past-the-end (write points to live element)
05500                 return write + 1;
05501         }
05502 
05503         template <typename I> void copy_backwards(I begin, I end, I target)
05504         {
05505                 while (begin != end) *--target = *--end;
05506         }
05507 
05508         template <typename I, typename Pred, typename T> void insertion_sort(I begin, I end, const Pred& pred, T*)
05509         {
05510                 assert(begin != end);
05511 
05512                 for (I it = begin + 1; it != end; ++it)
05513                 {
05514                         T val = *it;
05515 
05516                         if (pred(val, *begin))
05517                         {
05518                                 // move to front
05519                                 copy_backwards(begin, it, it + 1);
05520                                 *begin = val;
05521                         }
05522                         else
05523                         {
05524                                 I hole = it;
05525 
05526                                 // move hole backwards
05527                                 while (pred(val, *(hole - 1)))
05528                                 {
05529                                         *hole = *(hole - 1);
05530                                         hole--;
05531                                 }
05532 
05533                                 // fill hole with element
05534                                 *hole = val;
05535                         }
05536                 }
05537         }
05538 
05539         // std variant for elements with ==
05540         template <typename I, typename Pred> void partition(I begin, I middle, I end, const Pred& pred, I* out_eqbeg, I* out_eqend)
05541         {
05542                 I eqbeg = middle, eqend = middle + 1;
05543 
05544                 // expand equal range
05545                 while (eqbeg != begin && *(eqbeg - 1) == *eqbeg) --eqbeg;
05546                 while (eqend != end && *eqend == *eqbeg) ++eqend;
05547 
05548                 // process outer elements
05549                 I ltend = eqbeg, gtbeg = eqend;
05550 
05551                 for (;;)
05552                 {
05553                         // find the element from the right side that belongs to the left one
05554                         for (; gtbeg != end; ++gtbeg)
05555                                 if (!pred(*eqbeg, *gtbeg))
05556                                 {
05557                                         if (*gtbeg == *eqbeg) swap(*gtbeg, *eqend++);
05558                                         else break;
05559                                 }
05560 
05561                         // find the element from the left side that belongs to the right one
05562                         for (; ltend != begin; --ltend)
05563                                 if (!pred(*(ltend - 1), *eqbeg))
05564                                 {
05565                                         if (*eqbeg == *(ltend - 1)) swap(*(ltend - 1), *--eqbeg);
05566                                         else break;
05567                                 }
05568 
05569                         // scanned all elements
05570                         if (gtbeg == end && ltend == begin)
05571                         {
05572                                 *out_eqbeg = eqbeg;
05573                                 *out_eqend = eqend;
05574                                 return;
05575                         }
05576 
05577                         // make room for elements by moving equal area
05578                         if (gtbeg == end)
05579                         {
05580                                 if (--ltend != --eqbeg) swap(*ltend, *eqbeg);
05581                                 swap(*eqbeg, *--eqend);
05582                         }
05583                         else if (ltend == begin)
05584                         {
05585                                 if (eqend != gtbeg) swap(*eqbeg, *eqend);
05586                                 ++eqend;
05587                                 swap(*gtbeg++, *eqbeg++);
05588                         }
05589                         else swap(*gtbeg++, *--ltend);
05590                 }
05591         }
05592 
05593         template <typename I, typename Pred> void median3(I first, I middle, I last, const Pred& pred)
05594         {
05595                 if (pred(*middle, *first)) swap(*middle, *first);
05596                 if (pred(*last, *middle)) swap(*last, *middle);
05597                 if (pred(*middle, *first)) swap(*middle, *first);
05598         }
05599 
05600         template <typename I, typename Pred> void median(I first, I middle, I last, const Pred& pred)
05601         {
05602                 if (last - first <= 40)
05603                 {
05604                         // median of three for small chunks
05605                         median3(first, middle, last, pred);
05606                 }
05607                 else
05608                 {
05609                         // median of nine
05610                         size_t step = (last - first + 1) / 8;
05611 
05612                         median3(first, first + step, first + 2 * step, pred);
05613                         median3(middle - step, middle, middle + step, pred);
05614                         median3(last - 2 * step, last - step, last, pred);
05615                         median3(first + step, middle, last - step, pred);
05616                 }
05617         }
05618 
05619         template <typename I, typename Pred> void sort(I begin, I end, const Pred& pred)
05620         {
05621                 // sort large chunks
05622                 while (end - begin > 32)
05623                 {
05624                         // find median element
05625                         I middle = begin + (end - begin) / 2;
05626                         median(begin, middle, end - 1, pred);
05627 
05628                         // partition in three chunks (< = >)
05629                         I eqbeg, eqend;
05630                         partition(begin, middle, end, pred, &eqbeg, &eqend);
05631 
05632                         // loop on larger half
05633                         if (eqbeg - begin > end - eqend)
05634                         {
05635                                 sort(eqend, end, pred);
05636                                 end = eqbeg;
05637                         }
05638                         else
05639                         {
05640                                 sort(begin, eqbeg, pred);
05641                                 begin = eqend;
05642                         }
05643                 }
05644 
05645                 // insertion sort small chunk
05646                 if (begin != end) insertion_sort(begin, end, pred, &*begin);
05647         }
05648 PUGI__NS_END
05649 
05650 // Allocator used for AST and evaluation stacks
05651 PUGI__NS_BEGIN
05652         struct xpath_memory_block
05653         {       
05654                 xpath_memory_block* next;
05655 
05656                 char data[
05657         #ifdef PUGIXML_MEMORY_XPATH_PAGE_SIZE
05658                         PUGIXML_MEMORY_XPATH_PAGE_SIZE
05659         #else
05660                         4096
05661         #endif
05662                 ];
05663         };
05664                 
05665         class xpath_allocator
05666         {
05667                 xpath_memory_block* _root;
05668                 size_t _root_size;
05669 
05670         public:
05671         #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
05672                 jmp_buf* error_handler;
05673         #endif
05674 
05675                 xpath_allocator(xpath_memory_block* root, size_t root_size = 0): _root(root), _root_size(root_size)
05676                 {
05677                 #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
05678                         error_handler = 0;
05679                 #endif
05680                 }
05681                 
05682                 void* allocate_nothrow(size_t size)
05683                 {
05684                         const size_t block_capacity = sizeof(_root->data);
05685 
05686                         // align size so that we're able to store pointers in subsequent blocks
05687                         size = (size + sizeof(void*) - 1) & ~(sizeof(void*) - 1);
05688 
05689                         if (_root_size + size <= block_capacity)
05690                         {
05691                                 void* buf = _root->data + _root_size;
05692                                 _root_size += size;
05693                                 return buf;
05694                         }
05695                         else
05696                         {
05697                                 size_t block_data_size = (size > block_capacity) ? size : block_capacity;
05698                                 size_t block_size = block_data_size + offsetof(xpath_memory_block, data);
05699 
05700                                 xpath_memory_block* block = static_cast<xpath_memory_block*>(xml_memory::allocate(block_size));
05701                                 if (!block) return 0;
05702                                 
05703                                 block->next = _root;
05704                                 
05705                                 _root = block;
05706                                 _root_size = size;
05707                                 
05708                                 return block->data;
05709                         }
05710                 }
05711 
05712                 void* allocate(size_t size)
05713                 {
05714                         void* result = allocate_nothrow(size);
05715 
05716                         if (!result)
05717                         {
05718                         #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
05719                                 assert(error_handler);
05720                                 longjmp(*error_handler, 1);
05721                         #else
05722                                 throw std::bad_alloc();
05723                         #endif
05724                         }
05725 
05726                         return result;
05727                 }
05728 
05729                 void* reallocate(void* ptr, size_t old_size, size_t new_size)
05730                 {
05731                         // align size so that we're able to store pointers in subsequent blocks
05732                         old_size = (old_size + sizeof(void*) - 1) & ~(sizeof(void*) - 1);
05733                         new_size = (new_size + sizeof(void*) - 1) & ~(sizeof(void*) - 1);
05734 
05735                         // we can only reallocate the last object
05736                         assert(ptr == 0 || static_cast<char*>(ptr) + old_size == _root->data + _root_size);
05737 
05738                         // adjust root size so that we have not allocated the object at all
05739                         bool only_object = (_root_size == old_size);
05740 
05741                         if (ptr) _root_size -= old_size;
05742 
05743                         // allocate a new version (this will obviously reuse the memory if possible)
05744                         void* result = allocate(new_size);
05745                         assert(result);
05746 
05747                         // we have a new block
05748                         if (result != ptr && ptr)
05749                         {
05750                                 // copy old data
05751                                 assert(new_size > old_size);
05752                                 memcpy(result, ptr, old_size);
05753 
05754                                 // free the previous page if it had no other objects
05755                                 if (only_object)
05756                                 {
05757                                         assert(_root->data == result);
05758                                         assert(_root->next);
05759 
05760                                         xpath_memory_block* next = _root->next->next;
05761 
05762                                         if (next)
05763                                         {
05764                                                 // deallocate the whole page, unless it was the first one
05765                                                 xml_memory::deallocate(_root->next);
05766                                                 _root->next = next;
05767                                         }
05768                                 }
05769                         }
05770 
05771                         return result;
05772                 }
05773 
05774                 void revert(const xpath_allocator& state)
05775                 {
05776                         // free all new pages
05777                         xpath_memory_block* cur = _root;
05778 
05779                         while (cur != state._root)
05780                         {
05781                                 xpath_memory_block* next = cur->next;
05782 
05783                                 xml_memory::deallocate(cur);
05784 
05785                                 cur = next;
05786                         }
05787 
05788                         // restore state
05789                         _root = state._root;
05790                         _root_size = state._root_size;
05791                 }
05792 
05793                 void release()
05794                 {
05795                         xpath_memory_block* cur = _root;
05796                         assert(cur);
05797 
05798                         while (cur->next)
05799                         {
05800                                 xpath_memory_block* next = cur->next;
05801 
05802                                 xml_memory::deallocate(cur);
05803 
05804                                 cur = next;
05805                         }
05806                 }
05807         };
05808 
05809         struct xpath_allocator_capture
05810         {
05811                 xpath_allocator_capture(xpath_allocator* alloc): _target(alloc), _state(*alloc)
05812                 {
05813                 }
05814 
05815                 ~xpath_allocator_capture()
05816                 {
05817                         _target->revert(_state);
05818                 }
05819 
05820                 xpath_allocator* _target;
05821                 xpath_allocator _state;
05822         };
05823 
05824         struct xpath_stack
05825         {
05826                 xpath_allocator* result;
05827                 xpath_allocator* temp;
05828         };
05829 
05830         struct xpath_stack_data
05831         {
05832                 xpath_memory_block blocks[2];
05833                 xpath_allocator result;
05834                 xpath_allocator temp;
05835                 xpath_stack stack;
05836 
05837         #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
05838                 jmp_buf error_handler;
05839         #endif
05840 
05841                 xpath_stack_data(): result(blocks + 0), temp(blocks + 1)
05842                 {
05843                         blocks[0].next = blocks[1].next = 0;
05844 
05845                         stack.result = &result;
05846                         stack.temp = &temp;
05847 
05848                 #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
05849                         result.error_handler = temp.error_handler = &error_handler;
05850                 #endif
05851                 }
05852 
05853                 ~xpath_stack_data()
05854                 {
05855                         result.release();
05856                         temp.release();
05857                 }
05858         };
05859 PUGI__NS_END
05860 
05861 // String class
05862 PUGI__NS_BEGIN
05863         class xpath_string
05864         {
05865                 const char_t* _buffer;
05866                 bool _uses_heap;
05867 
05868                 static char_t* duplicate_string(const char_t* string, size_t length, xpath_allocator* alloc)
05869                 {
05870                         char_t* result = static_cast<char_t*>(alloc->allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)));
05871                         assert(result);
05872 
05873                         memcpy(result, string, length * sizeof(char_t));
05874                         result[length] = 0;
05875 
05876                         return result;
05877                 }
05878 
05879                 static char_t* duplicate_string(const char_t* string, xpath_allocator* alloc)
05880                 {
05881                         return duplicate_string(string, strlength(string), alloc);
05882                 }
05883 
05884         public:
05885                 xpath_string(): _buffer(PUGIXML_TEXT("")), _uses_heap(false)
05886                 {
05887                 }
05888 
05889                 explicit xpath_string(const char_t* str, xpath_allocator* alloc)
05890                 {
05891                         bool empty_ = (*str == 0);
05892 
05893                         _buffer = empty_ ? PUGIXML_TEXT("") : duplicate_string(str, alloc);
05894                         _uses_heap = !empty_;
05895                 }
05896 
05897                 explicit xpath_string(const char_t* str, bool use_heap): _buffer(str), _uses_heap(use_heap)
05898                 {
05899                 }
05900 
05901                 xpath_string(const char_t* begin, const char_t* end, xpath_allocator* alloc)
05902                 {
05903                         assert(begin <= end);
05904 
05905                         bool empty_ = (begin == end);
05906 
05907                         _buffer = empty_ ? PUGIXML_TEXT("") : duplicate_string(begin, static_cast<size_t>(end - begin), alloc);
05908                         _uses_heap = !empty_;
05909                 }
05910 
05911                 void append(const xpath_string& o, xpath_allocator* alloc)
05912                 {
05913                         // skip empty sources
05914                         if (!*o._buffer) return;
05915 
05916                         // fast append for constant empty target and constant source
05917                         if (!*_buffer && !_uses_heap && !o._uses_heap)
05918                         {
05919                                 _buffer = o._buffer;
05920                         }
05921                         else
05922                         {
05923                                 // need to make heap copy
05924                                 size_t target_length = strlength(_buffer);
05925                                 size_t source_length = strlength(o._buffer);
05926                                 size_t result_length = target_length + source_length;
05927 
05928                                 // allocate new buffer
05929                                 char_t* result = static_cast<char_t*>(alloc->reallocate(_uses_heap ? const_cast<char_t*>(_buffer) : 0, (target_length + 1) * sizeof(char_t), (result_length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)));
05930                                 assert(result);
05931 
05932                                 // append first string to the new buffer in case there was no reallocation
05933                                 if (!_uses_heap) memcpy(result, _buffer, target_length * sizeof(char_t));
05934 
05935                                 // append second string to the new buffer
05936                                 memcpy(result + target_length, o._buffer, source_length * sizeof(char_t));
05937                                 result[result_length] = 0;
05938 
05939                                 // finalize
05940                                 _buffer = result;
05941                                 _uses_heap = true;
05942                         }
05943                 }
05944 
05945                 const char_t* c_str() const
05946                 {
05947                         return _buffer;
05948                 }
05949 
05950                 size_t length() const
05951                 {
05952                         return strlength(_buffer);
05953                 }
05954                 
05955                 char_t* data(xpath_allocator* alloc)
05956                 {
05957                         // make private heap copy
05958                         if (!_uses_heap)
05959                         {
05960                                 _buffer = duplicate_string(_buffer, alloc);
05961                                 _uses_heap = true;
05962                         }
05963 
05964                         return const_cast<char_t*>(_buffer);
05965                 }
05966 
05967                 bool empty() const
05968                 {
05969                         return *_buffer == 0;
05970                 }
05971 
05972                 bool operator==(const xpath_string& o) const
05973                 {
05974                         return strequal(_buffer, o._buffer);
05975                 }
05976 
05977                 bool operator!=(const xpath_string& o) const
05978                 {
05979                         return !strequal(_buffer, o._buffer);
05980                 }
05981 
05982                 bool uses_heap() const
05983                 {
05984                         return _uses_heap;
05985                 }
05986         };
05987 
05988         PUGI__FN xpath_string xpath_string_const(const char_t* str)
05989         {
05990                 return xpath_string(str, false);
05991         }
05992 PUGI__NS_END
05993 
05994 PUGI__NS_BEGIN
05995         PUGI__FN bool starts_with(const char_t* string, const char_t* pattern)
05996         {
05997                 while (*pattern && *string == *pattern)
05998                 {
05999                         string++;
06000                         pattern++;
06001                 }
06002 
06003                 return *pattern == 0;
06004         }
06005 
06006         PUGI__FN const char_t* find_char(const char_t* s, char_t c)
06007         {
06008         #ifdef PUGIXML_WCHAR_MODE
06009                 return wcschr(s, c);
06010         #else
06011                 return strchr(s, c);
06012         #endif
06013         }
06014 
06015         PUGI__FN const char_t* find_substring(const char_t* s, const char_t* p)
06016         {
06017         #ifdef PUGIXML_WCHAR_MODE
06018                 // MSVC6 wcsstr bug workaround (if s is empty it always returns 0)
06019                 return (*p == 0) ? s : wcsstr(s, p);
06020         #else
06021                 return strstr(s, p);
06022         #endif
06023         }
06024 
06025         // Converts symbol to lower case, if it is an ASCII one
06026         PUGI__FN char_t tolower_ascii(char_t ch)
06027         {
06028                 return static_cast<unsigned int>(ch - 'A') < 26 ? static_cast<char_t>(ch | ' ') : ch;
06029         }
06030 
06031         PUGI__FN xpath_string string_value(const xpath_node& na, xpath_allocator* alloc)
06032         {
06033                 if (na.attribute())
06034                         return xpath_string_const(na.attribute().value());
06035                 else
06036                 {
06037                         const xml_node& n = na.node();
06038 
06039                         switch (n.type())
06040                         {
06041                         case node_pcdata:
06042                         case node_cdata:
06043                         case node_comment:
06044                         case node_pi:
06045                                 return xpath_string_const(n.value());
06046                         
06047                         case node_document:
06048                         case node_element:
06049                         {
06050                                 xpath_string result;
06051 
06052                                 xml_node cur = n.first_child();
06053                                 
06054                                 while (cur && cur != n)
06055                                 {
06056                                         if (cur.type() == node_pcdata || cur.type() == node_cdata)
06057                                                 result.append(xpath_string_const(cur.value()), alloc);
06058 
06059                                         if (cur.first_child())
06060                                                 cur = cur.first_child();
06061                                         else if (cur.next_sibling())
06062                                                 cur = cur.next_sibling();
06063                                         else
06064                                         {
06065                                                 while (!cur.next_sibling() && cur != n)
06066                                                         cur = cur.parent();
06067 
06068                                                 if (cur != n) cur = cur.next_sibling();
06069                                         }
06070                                 }
06071                                 
06072                                 return result;
06073                         }
06074                         
06075                         default:
06076                                 return xpath_string();
06077                         }
06078                 }
06079         }
06080         
06081         PUGI__FN unsigned int node_height(xml_node n)
06082         {
06083                 unsigned int result = 0;
06084                 
06085                 while (n)
06086                 {
06087                         ++result;
06088                         n = n.parent();
06089                 }
06090                 
06091                 return result;
06092         }
06093         
06094         PUGI__FN bool node_is_before(xml_node ln, unsigned int lh, xml_node rn, unsigned int rh)
06095         {
06096                 // normalize heights
06097                 for (unsigned int i = rh; i < lh; i++) ln = ln.parent();
06098                 for (unsigned int j = lh; j < rh; j++) rn = rn.parent();
06099                 
06100                 // one node is the ancestor of the other
06101                 if (ln == rn) return lh < rh;
06102                 
06103                 // find common ancestor
06104                 while (ln.parent() != rn.parent())
06105                 {
06106                         ln = ln.parent();
06107                         rn = rn.parent();
06108                 }
06109 
06110                 // there is no common ancestor (the shared parent is null), nodes are from different documents
06111                 if (!ln.parent()) return ln < rn;
06112 
06113                 // determine sibling order
06114                 for (; ln; ln = ln.next_sibling())
06115                         if (ln == rn)
06116                                 return true;
06117                                 
06118                 return false;
06119         }
06120 
06121         PUGI__FN bool node_is_ancestor(xml_node parent, xml_node node)
06122         {
06123                 while (node && node != parent) node = node.parent();
06124 
06125                 return parent && node == parent;
06126         }
06127 
06128         PUGI__FN const void* document_order(const xpath_node& xnode)
06129         {
06130                 xml_node_struct* node = xnode.node().internal_object();
06131 
06132                 if (node)
06133                 {
06134                         if (node->name && (node->header & xml_memory_page_name_allocated_mask) == 0) return node->name;
06135                         if (node->value && (node->header & xml_memory_page_value_allocated_mask) == 0) return node->value;
06136                         return 0;
06137                 }
06138 
06139                 xml_attribute_struct* attr = xnode.attribute().internal_object();
06140 
06141                 if (attr)
06142                 {
06143                         if ((attr->header & xml_memory_page_name_allocated_mask) == 0) return attr->name;
06144                         if ((attr->header & xml_memory_page_value_allocated_mask) == 0) return attr->value;
06145                         return 0;
06146                 }
06147 
06148                 return 0;
06149         }
06150         
06151         struct document_order_comparator
06152         {
06153                 bool operator()(const xpath_node& lhs, const xpath_node& rhs) const
06154                 {
06155                         // optimized document order based check
06156                         const void* lo = document_order(lhs);
06157                         const void* ro = document_order(rhs);
06158 
06159                         if (lo && ro) return lo < ro;
06160 
06161                         // slow comparison
06162                         xml_node ln = lhs.node(), rn = rhs.node();
06163 
06164                         // compare attributes
06165                         if (lhs.attribute() && rhs.attribute())
06166                         {
06167                                 // shared parent
06168                                 if (lhs.parent() == rhs.parent())
06169                                 {
06170                                         // determine sibling order
06171                                         for (xml_attribute a = lhs.attribute(); a; a = a.next_attribute())
06172                                                 if (a == rhs.attribute())
06173                                                         return true;
06174                                         
06175                                         return false;
06176                                 }
06177                                 
06178                                 // compare attribute parents
06179                                 ln = lhs.parent();
06180                                 rn = rhs.parent();
06181                         }
06182                         else if (lhs.attribute())
06183                         {
06184                                 // attributes go after the parent element
06185                                 if (lhs.parent() == rhs.node()) return false;
06186                                 
06187                                 ln = lhs.parent();
06188                         }
06189                         else if (rhs.attribute())
06190                         {
06191                                 // attributes go after the parent element
06192                                 if (rhs.parent() == lhs.node()) return true;
06193                                 
06194                                 rn = rhs.parent();
06195                         }
06196 
06197                         if (ln == rn) return false;
06198                         
06199                         unsigned int lh = node_height(ln);
06200                         unsigned int rh = node_height(rn);
06201                         
06202                         return node_is_before(ln, lh, rn, rh);
06203                 }
06204         };
06205 
06206         struct duplicate_comparator
06207         {
06208                 bool operator()(const xpath_node& lhs, const xpath_node& rhs) const
06209                 {
06210                         if (lhs.attribute()) return rhs.attribute() ? lhs.attribute() < rhs.attribute() : true;
06211                         else return rhs.attribute() ? false : lhs.node() < rhs.node();
06212                 }
06213         };
06214         
06215         PUGI__FN double gen_nan()
06216         {
06217         #if defined(__STDC_IEC_559__) || ((FLT_RADIX - 0 == 2) && (FLT_MAX_EXP - 0 == 128) && (FLT_MANT_DIG - 0 == 24))
06218                 union { float f; uint32_t i; } u[sizeof(float) == sizeof(uint32_t) ? 1 : -1];
06219                 u[0].i = 0x7fc00000;
06220                 return u[0].f;
06221         #else
06222                 // fallback
06223                 const volatile double zero = 0.0;
06224                 return zero / zero;
06225         #endif
06226         }
06227         
06228         PUGI__FN bool is_nan(double value)
06229         {
06230         #if defined(PUGI__MSVC_CRT_VERSION) || defined(__BORLANDC__)
06231                 return !!_isnan(value);
06232         #elif defined(fpclassify) && defined(FP_NAN)
06233                 return fpclassify(value) == FP_NAN;
06234         #else
06235                 // fallback
06236                 const volatile double v = value;
06237                 return v != v;
06238         #endif
06239         }
06240         
06241         PUGI__FN const char_t* convert_number_to_string_special(double value)
06242         {
06243         #if defined(PUGI__MSVC_CRT_VERSION) || defined(__BORLANDC__)
06244                 if (_finite(value)) return (value == 0) ? PUGIXML_TEXT("0") : 0;
06245                 if (_isnan(value)) return PUGIXML_TEXT("NaN");
06246                 return value > 0 ? PUGIXML_TEXT("Infinity") : PUGIXML_TEXT("-Infinity");
06247         #elif defined(fpclassify) && defined(FP_NAN) && defined(FP_INFINITE) && defined(FP_ZERO)
06248                 switch (fpclassify(value))
06249                 {
06250                 case FP_NAN:
06251                         return PUGIXML_TEXT("NaN");
06252 
06253                 case FP_INFINITE:
06254                         return value > 0 ? PUGIXML_TEXT("Infinity") : PUGIXML_TEXT("-Infinity");
06255 
06256                 case FP_ZERO:
06257                         return PUGIXML_TEXT("0");
06258 
06259                 default:
06260                         return 0;
06261                 }
06262         #else
06263                 // fallback
06264                 const volatile double v = value;
06265 
06266                 if (v == 0) return PUGIXML_TEXT("0");
06267                 if (v != v) return PUGIXML_TEXT("NaN");
06268                 if (v * 2 == v) return value > 0 ? PUGIXML_TEXT("Infinity") : PUGIXML_TEXT("-Infinity");
06269                 return 0;
06270         #endif
06271         }
06272         
06273         PUGI__FN bool convert_number_to_boolean(double value)
06274         {
06275                 return (value != 0 && !is_nan(value));
06276         }
06277         
06278         PUGI__FN void truncate_zeros(char* begin, char* end)
06279         {
06280                 while (begin != end && end[-1] == '0') end--;
06281 
06282                 *end = 0;
06283         }
06284 
06285         // gets mantissa digits in the form of 0.xxxxx with 0. implied and the exponent
06286 #if defined(PUGI__MSVC_CRT_VERSION) && PUGI__MSVC_CRT_VERSION >= 1400 && !defined(_WIN32_WCE)
06287         PUGI__FN void convert_number_to_mantissa_exponent(double value, char* buffer, size_t buffer_size, char** out_mantissa, int* out_exponent)
06288         {
06289                 // get base values
06290                 int sign, exponent;
06291                 _ecvt_s(buffer, buffer_size, value, DBL_DIG + 1, &exponent, &sign);
06292 
06293                 // truncate redundant zeros
06294                 truncate_zeros(buffer, buffer + strlen(buffer));
06295 
06296                 // fill results
06297                 *out_mantissa = buffer;
06298                 *out_exponent = exponent;
06299         }
06300 #else
06301         PUGI__FN void convert_number_to_mantissa_exponent(double value, char* buffer, size_t buffer_size, char** out_mantissa, int* out_exponent)
06302         {
06303                 // get a scientific notation value with IEEE DBL_DIG decimals
06304                 sprintf(buffer, "%.*e", DBL_DIG, value);
06305                 assert(strlen(buffer) < buffer_size);
06306                 (void)!buffer_size;
06307 
06308                 // get the exponent (possibly negative)
06309                 char* exponent_string = strchr(buffer, 'e');
06310                 assert(exponent_string);
06311 
06312                 int exponent = atoi(exponent_string + 1);
06313 
06314                 // extract mantissa string: skip sign
06315                 char* mantissa = buffer[0] == '-' ? buffer + 1 : buffer;
06316                 assert(mantissa[0] != '0' && mantissa[1] == '.');
06317 
06318                 // divide mantissa by 10 to eliminate integer part
06319                 mantissa[1] = mantissa[0];
06320                 mantissa++;
06321                 exponent++;
06322 
06323                 // remove extra mantissa digits and zero-terminate mantissa
06324                 truncate_zeros(mantissa, exponent_string);
06325 
06326                 // fill results
06327                 *out_mantissa = mantissa;
06328                 *out_exponent = exponent;
06329         }
06330 #endif
06331 
06332         PUGI__FN xpath_string convert_number_to_string(double value, xpath_allocator* alloc)
06333         {
06334                 // try special number conversion
06335                 const char_t* special = convert_number_to_string_special(value);
06336                 if (special) return xpath_string_const(special);
06337 
06338                 // get mantissa + exponent form
06339                 char mantissa_buffer[64];
06340 
06341                 char* mantissa;
06342                 int exponent;
06343                 convert_number_to_mantissa_exponent(value, mantissa_buffer, sizeof(mantissa_buffer), &mantissa, &exponent);
06344 
06345                 // make the number!
06346                 char_t result[512];
06347                 char_t* s = result;
06348 
06349                 // sign
06350                 if (value < 0) *s++ = '-';
06351 
06352                 // integer part
06353                 if (exponent <= 0)
06354                 {
06355                         *s++ = '0';
06356                 }
06357                 else
06358                 {
06359                         while (exponent > 0)
06360                         {
06361                                 assert(*mantissa == 0 || static_cast<unsigned int>(*mantissa - '0') <= 9);
06362                                 *s++ = *mantissa ? *mantissa++ : '0';
06363                                 exponent--;
06364                         }
06365                 }
06366 
06367                 // fractional part
06368                 if (*mantissa)
06369                 {
06370                         // decimal point
06371                         *s++ = '.';
06372 
06373                         // extra zeroes from negative exponent
06374                         while (exponent < 0)
06375                         {
06376                                 *s++ = '0';
06377                                 exponent++;
06378                         }
06379 
06380                         // extra mantissa digits
06381                         while (*mantissa)
06382                         {
06383                                 assert(static_cast<unsigned int>(*mantissa - '0') <= 9);
06384                                 *s++ = *mantissa++;
06385                         }
06386                 }
06387 
06388                 // zero-terminate
06389                 assert(s < result + sizeof(result) / sizeof(result[0]));
06390                 *s = 0;
06391 
06392                 return xpath_string(result, alloc);
06393         }
06394         
06395         PUGI__FN bool check_string_to_number_format(const char_t* string)
06396         {
06397                 // parse leading whitespace
06398                 while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*string, ct_space)) ++string;
06399 
06400                 // parse sign
06401                 if (*string == '-') ++string;
06402 
06403                 if (!*string) return false;
06404 
06405                 // if there is no integer part, there should be a decimal part with at least one digit
06406                 if (!PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(string[0], ctx_digit) && (string[0] != '.' || !PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(string[1], ctx_digit))) return false;
06407 
06408                 // parse integer part
06409                 while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*string, ctx_digit)) ++string;
06410 
06411                 // parse decimal part
06412                 if (*string == '.')
06413                 {
06414                         ++string;
06415 
06416                         while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*string, ctx_digit)) ++string;
06417                 }
06418 
06419                 // parse trailing whitespace
06420                 while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*string, ct_space)) ++string;
06421 
06422                 return *string == 0;
06423         }
06424 
06425         PUGI__FN double convert_string_to_number(const char_t* string)
06426         {
06427                 // check string format
06428                 if (!check_string_to_number_format(string)) return gen_nan();
06429 
06430                 // parse string
06431         #ifdef PUGIXML_WCHAR_MODE
06432                 return wcstod(string, 0);
06433         #else
06434                 return atof(string);
06435         #endif
06436         }
06437 
06438         PUGI__FN bool convert_string_to_number(const char_t* begin, const char_t* end, double* out_result)
06439         {
06440                 char_t buffer[32];
06441 
06442                 size_t length = static_cast<size_t>(end - begin);
06443                 char_t* scratch = buffer;
06444 
06445                 if (length >= sizeof(buffer) / sizeof(buffer[0]))
06446                 {
06447                         // need to make dummy on-heap copy
06448                         scratch = static_cast<char_t*>(xml_memory::allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)));
06449                         if (!scratch) return false;
06450                 }
06451 
06452                 // copy string to zero-terminated buffer and perform conversion
06453                 memcpy(scratch, begin, length * sizeof(char_t));
06454                 scratch[length] = 0;
06455 
06456                 *out_result = convert_string_to_number(scratch);
06457 
06458                 // free dummy buffer
06459                 if (scratch != buffer) xml_memory::deallocate(scratch);
06460 
06461                 return true;
06462         }
06463         
06464         PUGI__FN double round_nearest(double value)
06465         {
06466                 return floor(value + 0.5);
06467         }
06468 
06469         PUGI__FN double round_nearest_nzero(double value)
06470         {
06471                 // same as round_nearest, but returns -0 for [-0.5, -0]
06472                 // ceil is used to differentiate between +0 and -0 (we return -0 for [-0.5, -0] and +0 for +0)
06473                 return (value >= -0.5 && value <= 0) ? ceil(value) : floor(value + 0.5);
06474         }
06475         
06476         PUGI__FN const char_t* qualified_name(const xpath_node& node)
06477         {
06478                 return node.attribute() ? node.attribute().name() : node.node().name();
06479         }
06480         
06481         PUGI__FN const char_t* local_name(const xpath_node& node)
06482         {
06483                 const char_t* name = qualified_name(node);
06484                 const char_t* p = find_char(name, ':');
06485                 
06486                 return p ? p + 1 : name;
06487         }
06488 
06489         struct namespace_uri_predicate
06490         {
06491                 const char_t* prefix;
06492                 size_t prefix_length;
06493 
06494                 namespace_uri_predicate(const char_t* name)
06495                 {
06496                         const char_t* pos = find_char(name, ':');
06497 
06498                         prefix = pos ? name : 0;
06499                         prefix_length = pos ? static_cast<size_t>(pos - name) : 0;
06500                 }
06501 
06502                 bool operator()(const xml_attribute& a) const
06503                 {
06504                         const char_t* name = a.name();
06505 
06506                         if (!starts_with(name, PUGIXML_TEXT("xmlns"))) return false;
06507 
06508                         return prefix ? name[5] == ':' && strequalrange(name + 6, prefix, prefix_length) : name[5] == 0;
06509                 }
06510         };
06511 
06512         PUGI__FN const char_t* namespace_uri(const xml_node& node)
06513         {
06514                 namespace_uri_predicate pred = node.name();
06515                 
06516                 xml_node p = node;
06517                 
06518                 while (p)
06519                 {
06520                         xml_attribute a = p.find_attribute(pred);
06521                         
06522                         if (a) return a.value();
06523                         
06524                         p = p.parent();
06525                 }
06526                 
06527                 return PUGIXML_TEXT("");
06528         }
06529 
06530         PUGI__FN const char_t* namespace_uri(const xml_attribute& attr, const xml_node& parent)
06531         {
06532                 namespace_uri_predicate pred = attr.name();
06533                 
06534                 // Default namespace does not apply to attributes
06535                 if (!pred.prefix) return PUGIXML_TEXT("");
06536                 
06537                 xml_node p = parent;
06538                 
06539                 while (p)
06540                 {
06541                         xml_attribute a = p.find_attribute(pred);
06542                         
06543                         if (a) return a.value();
06544                         
06545                         p = p.parent();
06546                 }
06547                 
06548                 return PUGIXML_TEXT("");
06549         }
06550 
06551         PUGI__FN const char_t* namespace_uri(const xpath_node& node)
06552         {
06553                 return node.attribute() ? namespace_uri(node.attribute(), node.parent()) : namespace_uri(node.node());
06554         }
06555 
06556         PUGI__FN void normalize_space(char_t* buffer)
06557         {
06558                 char_t* write = buffer;
06559 
06560                 for (char_t* it = buffer; *it; )
06561                 {
06562                         char_t ch = *it++;
06563 
06564                         if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(ch, ct_space))
06565                         {
06566                                 // replace whitespace sequence with single space
06567                                 while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*it, ct_space)) it++;
06568 
06569                                 // avoid leading spaces
06570                                 if (write != buffer) *write++ = ' ';
06571                         }
06572                         else *write++ = ch;
06573                 }
06574 
06575                 // remove trailing space
06576                 if (write != buffer && PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(write[-1], ct_space)) write--;
06577 
06578                 // zero-terminate
06579                 *write = 0;
06580         }
06581 
06582         PUGI__FN void translate(char_t* buffer, const char_t* from, const char_t* to)
06583         {
06584                 size_t to_length = strlength(to);
06585 
06586                 char_t* write = buffer;
06587 
06588                 while (*buffer)
06589                 {
06590                         PUGI__DMC_VOLATILE char_t ch = *buffer++;
06591 
06592                         const char_t* pos = find_char(from, ch);
06593 
06594                         if (!pos)
06595                                 *write++ = ch; // do not process
06596                         else if (static_cast<size_t>(pos - from) < to_length)
06597                                 *write++ = to[pos - from]; // replace
06598                 }
06599 
06600                 // zero-terminate
06601                 *write = 0;
06602         }
06603 
06604         struct xpath_variable_boolean: xpath_variable
06605         {
06606                 xpath_variable_boolean(): value(false)
06607                 {
06608                 }
06609 
06610                 bool value;
06611                 char_t name[1];
06612         };
06613 
06614         struct xpath_variable_number: xpath_variable
06615         {
06616                 xpath_variable_number(): value(0)
06617                 {
06618                 }
06619 
06620                 double value;
06621                 char_t name[1];
06622         };
06623 
06624         struct xpath_variable_string: xpath_variable
06625         {
06626                 xpath_variable_string(): value(0)
06627                 {
06628                 }
06629 
06630                 ~xpath_variable_string()
06631                 {
06632                         if (value) xml_memory::deallocate(value);
06633                 }
06634 
06635                 char_t* value;
06636                 char_t name[1];
06637         };
06638 
06639         struct xpath_variable_node_set: xpath_variable
06640         {
06641                 xpath_node_set value;
06642                 char_t name[1];
06643         };
06644 
06645         static const xpath_node_set dummy_node_set;
06646 
06647         PUGI__FN unsigned int hash_string(const char_t* str)
06648         {
06649                 // Jenkins one-at-a-time hash (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jenkins_hash_function#one-at-a-time)
06650                 unsigned int result = 0;
06651 
06652                 while (*str)
06653                 {
06654                         result += static_cast<unsigned int>(*str++);
06655                         result += result << 10;
06656                         result ^= result >> 6;
06657                 }
06658         
06659                 result += result << 3;
06660                 result ^= result >> 11;
06661                 result += result << 15;
06662         
06663                 return result;
06664         }
06665 
06666         template <typename T> PUGI__FN T* new_xpath_variable(const char_t* name)
06667         {
06668                 size_t length = strlength(name);
06669                 if (length == 0) return 0; // empty variable names are invalid
06670 
06671                 // $$ we can't use offsetof(T, name) because T is non-POD, so we just allocate additional length characters
06672                 void* memory = xml_memory::allocate(sizeof(T) + length * sizeof(char_t));
06673                 if (!memory) return 0;
06674 
06675                 T* result = new (memory) T();
06676 
06677                 memcpy(result->name, name, (length + 1) * sizeof(char_t));
06678 
06679                 return result;
06680         }
06681 
06682         PUGI__FN xpath_variable* new_xpath_variable(xpath_value_type type, const char_t* name)
06683         {
06684                 switch (type)
06685                 {
06686                 case xpath_type_node_set:
06687                         return new_xpath_variable<xpath_variable_node_set>(name);
06688 
06689                 case xpath_type_number:
06690                         return new_xpath_variable<xpath_variable_number>(name);
06691 
06692                 case xpath_type_string:
06693                         return new_xpath_variable<xpath_variable_string>(name);
06694 
06695                 case xpath_type_boolean:
06696                         return new_xpath_variable<xpath_variable_boolean>(name);
06697 
06698                 default:
06699                         return 0;
06700                 }
06701         }
06702 
06703         template <typename T> PUGI__FN void delete_xpath_variable(T* var)
06704         {
06705                 var->~T();
06706                 xml_memory::deallocate(var);
06707         }
06708 
06709         PUGI__FN void delete_xpath_variable(xpath_value_type type, xpath_variable* var)
06710         {
06711                 switch (type)
06712                 {
06713                 case xpath_type_node_set:
06714                         delete_xpath_variable(static_cast<xpath_variable_node_set*>(var));
06715                         break;
06716 
06717                 case xpath_type_number:
06718                         delete_xpath_variable(static_cast<xpath_variable_number*>(var));
06719                         break;
06720 
06721                 case xpath_type_string:
06722                         delete_xpath_variable(static_cast<xpath_variable_string*>(var));
06723                         break;
06724 
06725                 case xpath_type_boolean:
06726                         delete_xpath_variable(static_cast<xpath_variable_boolean*>(var));
06727                         break;
06728 
06729                 default:
06730                         assert(!"Invalid variable type");
06731                 }
06732         }
06733 
06734         PUGI__FN xpath_variable* get_variable(xpath_variable_set* set, const char_t* begin, const char_t* end)
06735         {
06736                 char_t buffer[32];
06737 
06738                 size_t length = static_cast<size_t>(end - begin);
06739                 char_t* scratch = buffer;
06740 
06741                 if (length >= sizeof(buffer) / sizeof(buffer[0]))
06742                 {
06743                         // need to make dummy on-heap copy
06744                         scratch = static_cast<char_t*>(xml_memory::allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)));
06745                         if (!scratch) return 0;
06746                 }
06747 
06748                 // copy string to zero-terminated buffer and perform lookup
06749                 memcpy(scratch, begin, length * sizeof(char_t));
06750                 scratch[length] = 0;
06751 
06752                 xpath_variable* result = set->get(scratch);
06753 
06754                 // free dummy buffer
06755                 if (scratch != buffer) xml_memory::deallocate(scratch);
06756 
06757                 return result;
06758         }
06759 PUGI__NS_END
06760 
06761 // Internal node set class
06762 PUGI__NS_BEGIN
06763         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::type_t xpath_sort(xpath_node* begin, xpath_node* end, xpath_node_set::type_t type, bool rev)
06764         {
06765                 xpath_node_set::type_t order = rev ? xpath_node_set::type_sorted_reverse : xpath_node_set::type_sorted;
06766 
06767                 if (type == xpath_node_set::type_unsorted)
06768                 {
06769                         sort(begin, end, document_order_comparator());
06770 
06771                         type = xpath_node_set::type_sorted;
06772                 }
06773                 
06774                 if (type != order) reverse(begin, end);
06775                         
06776                 return order;
06777         }
06778 
06779         PUGI__FN xpath_node xpath_first(const xpath_node* begin, const xpath_node* end, xpath_node_set::type_t type)
06780         {
06781                 if (begin == end) return xpath_node();
06782 
06783                 switch (type)
06784                 {
06785                 case xpath_node_set::type_sorted:
06786                         return *begin;
06787 
06788                 case xpath_node_set::type_sorted_reverse:
06789                         return *(end - 1);
06790 
06791                 case xpath_node_set::type_unsorted:
06792                         return *min_element(begin, end, document_order_comparator());
06793 
06794                 default:
06795                         assert(!"Invalid node set type");
06796                         return xpath_node();
06797                 }
06798         }
06799 
06800         class xpath_node_set_raw
06801         {
06802                 xpath_node_set::type_t _type;
06803 
06804                 xpath_node* _begin;
06805                 xpath_node* _end;
06806                 xpath_node* _eos;
06807 
06808         public:
06809                 xpath_node_set_raw(): _type(xpath_node_set::type_unsorted), _begin(0), _end(0), _eos(0)
06810                 {
06811                 }
06812 
06813                 xpath_node* begin() const
06814                 {
06815                         return _begin;
06816                 }
06817 
06818                 xpath_node* end() const
06819                 {
06820                         return _end;
06821                 }
06822 
06823                 bool empty() const
06824                 {
06825                         return _begin == _end;
06826                 }
06827 
06828                 size_t size() const
06829                 {
06830                         return static_cast<size_t>(_end - _begin);
06831                 }
06832 
06833                 xpath_node first() const
06834                 {
06835                         return xpath_first(_begin, _end, _type);
06836                 }
06837 
06838                 void push_back(const xpath_node& node, xpath_allocator* alloc)
06839                 {
06840                         if (_end == _eos)
06841                         {
06842                                 size_t capacity = static_cast<size_t>(_eos - _begin);
06843 
06844                                 // get new capacity (1.5x rule)
06845                                 size_t new_capacity = capacity + capacity / 2 + 1;
06846 
06847                                 // reallocate the old array or allocate a new one
06848                                 xpath_node* data = static_cast<xpath_node*>(alloc->reallocate(_begin, capacity * sizeof(xpath_node), new_capacity * sizeof(xpath_node)));
06849                                 assert(data);
06850 
06851                                 // finalize
06852                                 _begin = data;
06853                                 _end = data + capacity;
06854                                 _eos = data + new_capacity;
06855                         }
06856 
06857                         *_end++ = node;
06858                 }
06859 
06860                 void append(const xpath_node* begin_, const xpath_node* end_, xpath_allocator* alloc)
06861                 {
06862                         size_t size_ = static_cast<size_t>(_end - _begin);
06863                         size_t capacity = static_cast<size_t>(_eos - _begin);
06864                         size_t count = static_cast<size_t>(end_ - begin_);
06865 
06866                         if (size_ + count > capacity)
06867                         {
06868                                 // reallocate the old array or allocate a new one
06869                                 xpath_node* data = static_cast<xpath_node*>(alloc->reallocate(_begin, capacity * sizeof(xpath_node), (size_ + count) * sizeof(xpath_node)));
06870                                 assert(data);
06871 
06872                                 // finalize
06873                                 _begin = data;
06874                                 _end = data + size_;
06875                                 _eos = data + size_ + count;
06876                         }
06877 
06878                         memcpy(_end, begin_, count * sizeof(xpath_node));
06879                         _end += count;
06880                 }
06881 
06882                 void sort_do()
06883                 {
06884                         _type = xpath_sort(_begin, _end, _type, false);
06885                 }
06886 
06887                 void truncate(xpath_node* pos)
06888                 {
06889                         assert(_begin <= pos && pos <= _end);
06890 
06891                         _end = pos;
06892                 }
06893 
06894                 void remove_duplicates()
06895                 {
06896                         if (_type == xpath_node_set::type_unsorted)
06897                                 sort(_begin, _end, duplicate_comparator());
06898                 
06899                         _end = unique(_begin, _end);
06900                 }
06901 
06902                 xpath_node_set::type_t type() const
06903                 {
06904                         return _type;
06905                 }
06906 
06907                 void set_type(xpath_node_set::type_t value)
06908                 {
06909                         _type = value;
06910                 }
06911         };
06912 PUGI__NS_END
06913 
06914 PUGI__NS_BEGIN
06915         struct xpath_context
06916         {
06917                 xpath_node n;
06918                 size_t position, size;
06919 
06920                 xpath_context(const xpath_node& n_, size_t position_, size_t size_): n(n_), position(position_), size(size_)
06921                 {
06922                 }
06923         };
06924 
06925         enum lexeme_t
06926         {
06927                 lex_none = 0,
06928                 lex_equal,
06929                 lex_not_equal,
06930                 lex_less,
06931                 lex_greater,
06932                 lex_less_or_equal,
06933                 lex_greater_or_equal,
06934                 lex_plus,
06935                 lex_minus,
06936                 lex_multiply,
06937                 lex_union,
06938                 lex_var_ref,
06939                 lex_open_brace,
06940                 lex_close_brace,
06941                 lex_quoted_string,
06942                 lex_number,
06943                 lex_slash,
06944                 lex_double_slash,
06945                 lex_open_square_brace,
06946                 lex_close_square_brace,
06947                 lex_string,
06948                 lex_comma,
06949                 lex_axis_attribute,
06950                 lex_dot,
06951                 lex_double_dot,
06952                 lex_double_colon,
06953                 lex_eof
06954         };
06955 
06956         struct xpath_lexer_string
06957         {
06958                 const char_t* begin;
06959                 const char_t* end;
06960 
06961                 xpath_lexer_string(): begin(0), end(0)
06962                 {
06963                 }
06964 
06965                 bool operator==(const char_t* other) const
06966                 {
06967                         size_t length = static_cast<size_t>(end - begin);
06968 
06969                         return strequalrange(other, begin, length);
06970                 }
06971         };
06972 
06973         class xpath_lexer
06974         {
06975                 const char_t* _cur;
06976                 const char_t* _cur_lexeme_pos;
06977                 xpath_lexer_string _cur_lexeme_contents;
06978 
06979                 lexeme_t _cur_lexeme;
06980 
06981         public:
06982                 explicit xpath_lexer(const char_t* query): _cur(query)
06983                 {
06984                         next();
06985                 }
06986                 
06987                 const char_t* state() const
06988                 {
06989                         return _cur;
06990                 }
06991                 
06992                 void next()
06993                 {
06994                         const char_t* cur = _cur;
06995 
06996                         while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*cur, ct_space)) ++cur;
06997 
06998                         // save lexeme position for error reporting
06999                         _cur_lexeme_pos = cur;
07000 
07001                         switch (*cur)
07002                         {
07003                         case 0:
07004                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_eof;
07005                                 break;
07006                         
07007                         case '>':
07008                                 if (*(cur+1) == '=')
07009                                 {
07010                                         cur += 2;
07011                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_greater_or_equal;
07012                                 }
07013                                 else
07014                                 {
07015                                         cur += 1;
07016                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_greater;
07017                                 }
07018                                 break;
07019 
07020                         case '<':
07021                                 if (*(cur+1) == '=')
07022                                 {
07023                                         cur += 2;
07024                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_less_or_equal;
07025                                 }
07026                                 else
07027                                 {
07028                                         cur += 1;
07029                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_less;
07030                                 }
07031                                 break;
07032 
07033                         case '!':
07034                                 if (*(cur+1) == '=')
07035                                 {
07036                                         cur += 2;
07037                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_not_equal;
07038                                 }
07039                                 else
07040                                 {
07041                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_none;
07042                                 }
07043                                 break;
07044 
07045                         case '=':
07046                                 cur += 1;
07047                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_equal;
07048 
07049                                 break;
07050                         
07051                         case '+':
07052                                 cur += 1;
07053                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_plus;
07054 
07055                                 break;
07056 
07057                         case '-':
07058                                 cur += 1;
07059                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_minus;
07060 
07061                                 break;
07062 
07063                         case '*':
07064                                 cur += 1;
07065                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_multiply;
07066 
07067                                 break;
07068 
07069                         case '|':
07070                                 cur += 1;
07071                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_union;
07072 
07073                                 break;
07074                         
07075                         case '$':
07076                                 cur += 1;
07077 
07078                                 if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_start_symbol))
07079                                 {
07080                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.begin = cur;
07081 
07082                                         while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_symbol)) cur++;
07083
