07084                                         if (cur[0] == ':' && PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(cur[1], ctx_symbol)) // qname
07085                                         {
07086                                                 cur++; // :
07087 
07088                                                 while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_symbol)) cur++;
07089                                         }
07090 
07091                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.end = cur;
07092                                 
07093                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_var_ref;
07094                                 }
07095                                 else
07096                                 {
07097                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_none;
07098                                 }
07099 
07100                                 break;
07101 
07102                         case '(':
07103                                 cur += 1;
07104                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_open_brace;
07105 
07106                                 break;
07107 
07108                         case ')':
07109                                 cur += 1;
07110                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_close_brace;
07111 
07112                                 break;
07113                         
07114                         case '[':
07115                                 cur += 1;
07116                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_open_square_brace;
07117 
07118                                 break;
07119 
07120                         case ']':
07121                                 cur += 1;
07122                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_close_square_brace;
07123 
07124                                 break;
07125 
07126                         case ',':
07127                                 cur += 1;
07128                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_comma;
07129 
07130                                 break;
07131 
07132                         case '/':
07133                                 if (*(cur+1) == '/')
07134                                 {
07135                                         cur += 2;
07136                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_double_slash;
07137                                 }
07138                                 else
07139                                 {
07140                                         cur += 1;
07141                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_slash;
07142                                 }
07143                                 break;
07144                 
07145                         case '.':
07146                                 if (*(cur+1) == '.')
07147                                 {
07148                                         cur += 2;
07149                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_double_dot;
07150                                 }
07151                                 else if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*(cur+1), ctx_digit))
07152                                 {
07153                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.begin = cur; // .
07154 
07155                                         ++cur;
07156 
07157                                         while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_digit)) cur++;
07158 
07159                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.end = cur;
07160                                         
07161                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_number;
07162                                 }
07163                                 else
07164                                 {
07165                                         cur += 1;
07166                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_dot;
07167                                 }
07168                                 break;
07169 
07170                         case '@':
07171                                 cur += 1;
07172                                 _cur_lexeme = lex_axis_attribute;
07173 
07174                                 break;
07175 
07176                         case '"':
07177                         case '\'':
07178                         {
07179                                 char_t terminator = *cur;
07180 
07181                                 ++cur;
07182 
07183                                 _cur_lexeme_contents.begin = cur;
07184                                 while (*cur && *cur != terminator) cur++;
07185                                 _cur_lexeme_contents.end = cur;
07186                                 
07187                                 if (!*cur)
07188                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_none;
07189                                 else
07190                                 {
07191                                         cur += 1;
07192                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_quoted_string;
07193                                 }
07194 
07195                                 break;
07196                         }
07197 
07198                         case ':':
07199                                 if (*(cur+1) == ':')
07200                                 {
07201                                         cur += 2;
07202                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_double_colon;
07203                                 }
07204                                 else
07205                                 {
07206                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_none;
07207                                 }
07208                                 break;
07209 
07210                         default:
07211                                 if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_digit))
07212                                 {
07213                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.begin = cur;
07214 
07215                                         while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_digit)) cur++;
07216                                 
07217                                         if (*cur == '.')
07218                                         {
07219                                                 cur++;
07220 
07221                                                 while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_digit)) cur++;
07222                                         }
07223 
07224                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.end = cur;
07225 
07226                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_number;
07227                                 }
07228                                 else if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_start_symbol))
07229                                 {
07230                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.begin = cur;
07231 
07232                                         while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_symbol)) cur++;
07233 
07234                                         if (cur[0] == ':')
07235                                         {
07236                                                 if (cur[1] == '*') // namespace test ncname:*
07237                                                 {
07238                                                         cur += 2; // :*
07239                                                 }
07240                                                 else if (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(cur[1], ctx_symbol)) // namespace test qname
07241                                                 {
07242                                                         cur++; // :
07243 
07244                                                         while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX(*cur, ctx_symbol)) cur++;
07245                                                 }
07246                                         }
07247 
07248                                         _cur_lexeme_contents.end = cur;
07249                                 
07250                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_string;
07251                                 }
07252                                 else
07253                                 {
07254                                         _cur_lexeme = lex_none;
07255                                 }
07256                         }
07257 
07258                         _cur = cur;
07259                 }
07260 
07261                 lexeme_t current() const
07262                 {
07263                         return _cur_lexeme;
07264                 }
07265 
07266                 const char_t* current_pos() const
07267                 {
07268                         return _cur_lexeme_pos;
07269                 }
07270 
07271                 const xpath_lexer_string& contents() const
07272                 {
07273                         assert(_cur_lexeme == lex_var_ref || _cur_lexeme == lex_number || _cur_lexeme == lex_string || _cur_lexeme == lex_quoted_string);
07274 
07275                         return _cur_lexeme_contents;
07276                 }
07277         };
07278 
07279         enum ast_type_t
07280         {
07281                 ast_op_or,                                              // left or right
07282                 ast_op_and,                                             // left and right
07283                 ast_op_equal,                                   // left = right
07284                 ast_op_not_equal,                               // left != right
07285                 ast_op_less,                                    // left < right
07286                 ast_op_greater,                                 // left > right
07287                 ast_op_less_or_equal,                   // left <= right
07288                 ast_op_greater_or_equal,                // left >= right
07289                 ast_op_add,                                             // left + right
07290                 ast_op_subtract,                                // left - right
07291                 ast_op_multiply,                                // left * right
07292                 ast_op_divide,                                  // left / right
07293                 ast_op_mod,                                             // left % right
07294                 ast_op_negate,                                  // left - right
07295                 ast_op_union,                                   // left | right
07296                 ast_predicate,                                  // apply predicate to set; next points to next predicate
07297                 ast_filter,                                             // select * from left where right
07298                 ast_filter_posinv,                              // select * from left where right; proximity position invariant
07299                 ast_string_constant,                    // string constant
07300                 ast_number_constant,                    // number constant
07301                 ast_variable,                                   // variable
07302                 ast_func_last,                                  // last()
07303                 ast_func_position,                              // position()
07304                 ast_func_count,                                 // count(left)
07305                 ast_func_id,                                    // id(left)
07306                 ast_func_local_name_0,                  // local-name()
07307                 ast_func_local_name_1,                  // local-name(left)
07308                 ast_func_namespace_uri_0,               // namespace-uri()
07309                 ast_func_namespace_uri_1,               // namespace-uri(left)
07310                 ast_func_name_0,                                // name()
07311                 ast_func_name_1,                                // name(left)
07312                 ast_func_string_0,                              // string()
07313                 ast_func_string_1,                              // string(left)
07314                 ast_func_concat,                                // concat(left, right, siblings)
07315                 ast_func_starts_with,                   // starts_with(left, right)
07316                 ast_func_contains,                              // contains(left, right)
07317                 ast_func_substring_before,              // substring-before(left, right)
07318                 ast_func_substring_after,               // substring-after(left, right)
07319                 ast_func_substring_2,                   // substring(left, right)
07320                 ast_func_substring_3,                   // substring(left, right, third)
07321                 ast_func_string_length_0,               // string-length()
07322                 ast_func_string_length_1,               // string-length(left)
07323                 ast_func_normalize_space_0,             // normalize-space()
07324                 ast_func_normalize_space_1,             // normalize-space(left)
07325                 ast_func_translate,                             // translate(left, right, third)
07326                 ast_func_boolean,                               // boolean(left)
07327                 ast_func_not,                                   // not(left)
07328                 ast_func_true,                                  // true()
07329                 ast_func_false,                                 // false()
07330                 ast_func_lang,                                  // lang(left)
07331                 ast_func_number_0,                              // number()
07332                 ast_func_number_1,                              // number(left)
07333                 ast_func_sum,                                   // sum(left)
07334                 ast_func_floor,                                 // floor(left)
07335                 ast_func_ceiling,                               // ceiling(left)
07336                 ast_func_round,                                 // round(left)
07337                 ast_step,                                               // process set left with step
07338                 ast_step_root                                   // select root node
07339         };
07340 
07341         enum axis_t
07342         {
07343                 axis_ancestor,
07344                 axis_ancestor_or_self,
07345                 axis_attribute,
07346                 axis_child,
07347                 axis_descendant,
07348                 axis_descendant_or_self,
07349                 axis_following,
07350                 axis_following_sibling,
07351                 axis_namespace,
07352                 axis_parent,
07353                 axis_preceding,
07354                 axis_preceding_sibling,
07355                 axis_self
07356         };
07357         
07358         enum nodetest_t
07359         {
07360                 nodetest_none,
07361                 nodetest_name,
07362                 nodetest_type_node,
07363                 nodetest_type_comment,
07364                 nodetest_type_pi,
07365                 nodetest_type_text,
07366                 nodetest_pi,
07367                 nodetest_all,
07368                 nodetest_all_in_namespace
07369         };
07370 
07371         template <axis_t N> struct axis_to_type
07372         {
07373                 static const axis_t axis;
07374         };
07375 
07376         template <axis_t N> const axis_t axis_to_type<N>::axis = N;
07377                 
07378         class xpath_ast_node
07379         {
07380         private:
07381                 // node type
07382                 char _type;
07383                 char _rettype;
07384 
07385                 // for ast_step / ast_predicate
07386                 char _axis;
07387                 char _test;
07388 
07389                 // tree node structure
07390                 xpath_ast_node* _left;
07391                 xpath_ast_node* _right;
07392                 xpath_ast_node* _next;
07393 
07394                 union
07395                 {
07396                         // value for ast_string_constant
07397                         const char_t* string;
07398                         // value for ast_number_constant
07399                         double number;
07400                         // variable for ast_variable
07401                         xpath_variable* variable;
07402                         // node test for ast_step (node name/namespace/node type/pi target)
07403                         const char_t* nodetest;
07404                 } _data;
07405 
07406                 xpath_ast_node(const xpath_ast_node&);
07407                 xpath_ast_node& operator=(const xpath_ast_node&);
07408 
07409                 template <class Comp> static bool compare_eq(xpath_ast_node* lhs, xpath_ast_node* rhs, const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack, const Comp& comp)
07410                 {
07411                         xpath_value_type lt = lhs->rettype(), rt = rhs->rettype();
07412 
07413                         if (lt != xpath_type_node_set && rt != xpath_type_node_set)
07414                         {
07415                                 if (lt == xpath_type_boolean || rt == xpath_type_boolean)
07416                                         return comp(lhs->eval_boolean(c, stack), rhs->eval_boolean(c, stack));
07417                                 else if (lt == xpath_type_number || rt == xpath_type_number)
07418                                         return comp(lhs->eval_number(c, stack), rhs->eval_number(c, stack));
07419                                 else if (lt == xpath_type_string || rt == xpath_type_string)
07420                                 {
07421                                         xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
07422 
07423                                         xpath_string ls = lhs->eval_string(c, stack);
07424                                         xpath_string rs = rhs->eval_string(c, stack);
07425 
07426                                         return comp(ls, rs);
07427                                 }
07428                         }
07429                         else if (lt == xpath_type_node_set && rt == xpath_type_node_set)
07430                         {
07431                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
07432 
07433                                 xpath_node_set_raw ls = lhs->eval_node_set(c, stack);
07434                                 xpath_node_set_raw rs = rhs->eval_node_set(c, stack);
07435 
07436                                 for (const xpath_node* li = ls.begin(); li != ls.end(); ++li)
07437                                         for (const xpath_node* ri = rs.begin(); ri != rs.end(); ++ri)
07438                                         {
07439                                                 xpath_allocator_capture cri(stack.result);
07440 
07441                                                 if (comp(string_value(*li, stack.result), string_value(*ri, stack.result)))
07442                                                         return true;
07443                                         }
07444 
07445                                 return false;
07446                         }
07447                         else
07448                         {
07449                                 if (lt == xpath_type_node_set)
07450                                 {
07451                                         swap(lhs, rhs);
07452                                         swap(lt, rt);
07453                                 }
07454 
07455                                 if (lt == xpath_type_boolean)
07456                                         return comp(lhs->eval_boolean(c, stack), rhs->eval_boolean(c, stack));
07457                                 else if (lt == xpath_type_number)
07458                                 {
07459                                         xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
07460 
07461                                         double l = lhs->eval_number(c, stack);
07462                                         xpath_node_set_raw rs = rhs->eval_node_set(c, stack);
07463 
07464                                         for (const xpath_node* ri = rs.begin(); ri != rs.end(); ++ri)
07465                                         {
07466                                                 xpath_allocator_capture cri(stack.result);
07467 
07468                                                 if (comp(l, convert_string_to_number(string_value(*ri, stack.result).c_str())))
07469                                                         return true;
07470                                         }
07471 
07472                                         return false;
07473                                 }
07474                                 else if (lt == xpath_type_string)
07475                                 {
07476                                         xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
07477 
07478                                         xpath_string l = lhs->eval_string(c, stack);
07479                                         xpath_node_set_raw rs = rhs->eval_node_set(c, stack);
07480 
07481                                         for (const xpath_node* ri = rs.begin(); ri != rs.end(); ++ri)
07482                                         {
07483                                                 xpath_allocator_capture cri(stack.result);
07484 
07485                                                 if (comp(l, string_value(*ri, stack.result)))
07486                                                         return true;
07487                                         }
07488 
07489                                         return false;
07490                                 }
07491                         }
07492 
07493                         assert(!"Wrong types");
07494                         return false;
07495                 }
07496 
07497                 template <class Comp> static bool compare_rel(xpath_ast_node* lhs, xpath_ast_node* rhs, const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack, const Comp& comp)
07498                 {
07499                         xpath_value_type lt = lhs->rettype(), rt = rhs->rettype();
07500 
07501                         if (lt != xpath_type_node_set && rt != xpath_type_node_set)
07502                                 return comp(lhs->eval_number(c, stack), rhs->eval_number(c, stack));
07503                         else if (lt == xpath_type_node_set && rt == xpath_type_node_set)
07504                         {
07505                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
07506 
07507                                 xpath_node_set_raw ls = lhs->eval_node_set(c, stack);
07508                                 xpath_node_set_raw rs = rhs->eval_node_set(c, stack);
07509 
07510                                 for (const xpath_node* li = ls.begin(); li != ls.end(); ++li)
07511                                 {
07512                                         xpath_allocator_capture cri(stack.result);
07513 
07514                                         double l = convert_string_to_number(string_value(*li, stack.result).c_str());
07515 
07516                                         for (const xpath_node* ri = rs.begin(); ri != rs.end(); ++ri)
07517                                         {
07518                                                 xpath_allocator_capture crii(stack.result);
07519 
07520                                                 if (comp(l, convert_string_to_number(string_value(*ri, stack.result).c_str())))
07521                                                         return true;
07522                                         }
07523                                 }
07524 
07525                                 return false;
07526                         }
07527                         else if (lt != xpath_type_node_set && rt == xpath_type_node_set)
07528                         {
07529                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
07530 
07531                                 double l = lhs->eval_number(c, stack);
07532                                 xpath_node_set_raw rs = rhs->eval_node_set(c, stack);
07533 
07534                                 for (const xpath_node* ri = rs.begin(); ri != rs.end(); ++ri)
07535                                 {
07536                                         xpath_allocator_capture cri(stack.result);
07537 
07538                                         if (comp(l, convert_string_to_number(string_value(*ri, stack.result).c_str())))
07539                                                 return true;
07540                                 }
07541 
07542                                 return false;
07543                         }
07544                         else if (lt == xpath_type_node_set && rt != xpath_type_node_set)
07545                         {
07546                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
07547 
07548                                 xpath_node_set_raw ls = lhs->eval_node_set(c, stack);
07549                                 double r = rhs->eval_number(c, stack);
07550 
07551                                 for (const xpath_node* li = ls.begin(); li != ls.end(); ++li)
07552                                 {
07553                                         xpath_allocator_capture cri(stack.result);
07554 
07555                                         if (comp(convert_string_to_number(string_value(*li, stack.result).c_str()), r))
07556                                                 return true;
07557                                 }
07558 
07559                                 return false;
07560                         }
07561                         else
07562                         {
07563                                 assert(!"Wrong types");
07564                                 return false;
07565                         }
07566                 }
07567 
07568                 void apply_predicate(xpath_node_set_raw& ns, size_t first, xpath_ast_node* expr, const xpath_stack& stack)
07569                 {
07570                         assert(ns.size() >= first);
07571 
07572                         size_t i = 1;
07573                         size_t size = ns.size() - first;
07574                                 
07575                         xpath_node* last = ns.begin() + first;
07576                                 
07577                         // remove_if... or well, sort of
07578                         for (xpath_node* it = last; it != ns.end(); ++it, ++i)
07579                         {
07580                                 xpath_context c(*it, i, size);
07581                         
07582                                 if (expr->rettype() == xpath_type_number)
07583                                 {
07584                                         if (expr->eval_number(c, stack) == i)
07585                                                 *last++ = *it;
07586                                 }
07587                                 else if (expr->eval_boolean(c, stack))
07588                                         *last++ = *it;
07589                         }
07590                         
07591                         ns.truncate(last);
07592                 }
07593 
07594                 void apply_predicates(xpath_node_set_raw& ns, size_t first, const xpath_stack& stack)
07595                 {
07596                         if (ns.size() == first) return;
07597                         
07598                         for (xpath_ast_node* pred = _right; pred; pred = pred->_next)
07599                         {
07600                                 apply_predicate(ns, first, pred->_left, stack);
07601                         }
07602                 }
07603 
07604                 void step_push(xpath_node_set_raw& ns, const xml_attribute& a, const xml_node& parent, xpath_allocator* alloc)
07605                 {
07606                         if (!a) return;
07607 
07608                         const char_t* name = a.name();
07609 
07610                         // There are no attribute nodes corresponding to attributes that declare namespaces
07611                         // That is, "xmlns:..." or "xmlns"
07612                         if (starts_with(name, PUGIXML_TEXT("xmlns")) && (name[5] == 0 || name[5] == ':')) return;
07613                         
07614                         switch (_test)
07615                         {
07616                         case nodetest_name:
07617                                 if (strequal(name, _data.nodetest)) ns.push_back(xpath_node(a, parent), alloc);
07618                                 break;
07619                                 
07620                         case nodetest_type_node:
07621                         case nodetest_all:
07622                                 ns.push_back(xpath_node(a, parent), alloc);
07623                                 break;
07624                                 
07625                         case nodetest_all_in_namespace:
07626                                 if (starts_with(name, _data.nodetest))
07627                                         ns.push_back(xpath_node(a, parent), alloc);
07628                                 break;
07629                         
07630                         default:
07631                                 ;
07632                         }
07633                 }
07634                 
07635                 void step_push(xpath_node_set_raw& ns, const xml_node& n, xpath_allocator* alloc)
07636                 {
07637                         if (!n) return;
07638 
07639                         switch (_test)
07640                         {
07641                         case nodetest_name:
07642                                 if (n.type() == node_element && strequal(n.name(), _data.nodetest)) ns.push_back(n, alloc);
07643                                 break;
07644                                 
07645                         case nodetest_type_node:
07646                                 ns.push_back(n, alloc);
07647                                 break;
07648                                 
07649                         case nodetest_type_comment:
07650                                 if (n.type() == node_comment)
07651                                         ns.push_back(n, alloc);
07652                                 break;
07653                                 
07654                         case nodetest_type_text:
07655                                 if (n.type() == node_pcdata || n.type() == node_cdata)
07656                                         ns.push_back(n, alloc);
07657                                 break;
07658                                 
07659                         case nodetest_type_pi:
07660                                 if (n.type() == node_pi)
07661                                         ns.push_back(n, alloc);
07662                                 break;
07663                                                                         
07664                         case nodetest_pi:
07665                                 if (n.type() == node_pi && strequal(n.name(), _data.nodetest))
07666                                         ns.push_back(n, alloc);
07667                                 break;
07668                                 
07669                         case nodetest_all:
07670                                 if (n.type() == node_element)
07671                                         ns.push_back(n, alloc);
07672                                 break;
07673                                 
07674                         case nodetest_all_in_namespace:
07675                                 if (n.type() == node_element && starts_with(n.name(), _data.nodetest))
07676                                         ns.push_back(n, alloc);
07677                                 break;
07678 
07679                         default:
07680                                 assert(!"Unknown axis");
07681                         } 
07682                 }
07683 
07684                 template <class T> void step_fill(xpath_node_set_raw& ns, const xml_node& n, xpath_allocator* alloc, T)
07685                 {
07686                         const axis_t axis = T::axis;
07687 
07688                         switch (axis)
07689                         {
07690                         case axis_attribute:
07691                         {
07692                                 for (xml_attribute a = n.first_attribute(); a; a = a.next_attribute())
07693                                         step_push(ns, a, n, alloc);
07694                                 
07695                                 break;
07696                         }
07697                         
07698                         case axis_child:
07699                         {
07700                                 for (xml_node c = n.first_child(); c; c = c.next_sibling())
07701                                         step_push(ns, c, alloc);
07702                                         
07703                                 break;
07704                         }
07705                         
07706                         case axis_descendant:
07707                         case axis_descendant_or_self:
07708                         {
07709                                 if (axis == axis_descendant_or_self)
07710                                         step_push(ns, n, alloc);
07711                                         
07712                                 xml_node cur = n.first_child();
07713                                 
07714                                 while (cur && cur != n)
07715                                 {
07716                                         step_push(ns, cur, alloc);
07717                                         
07718                                         if (cur.first_child())
07719                                                 cur = cur.first_child();
07720                                         else if (cur.next_sibling())
07721                                                 cur = cur.next_sibling();
07722                                         else
07723                                         {
07724                                                 while (!cur.next_sibling() && cur != n)
07725                                                         cur = cur.parent();
07726                                         
07727                                                 if (cur != n) cur = cur.next_sibling();
07728                                         }
07729                                 }
07730                                 
07731                                 break;
07732                         }
07733                         
07734                         case axis_following_sibling:
07735                         {
07736                                 for (xml_node c = n.next_sibling(); c; c = c.next_sibling())
07737                                         step_push(ns, c, alloc);
07738                                 
07739                                 break;
07740                         }
07741                         
07742                         case axis_preceding_sibling:
07743                         {
07744                                 for (xml_node c = n.previous_sibling(); c; c = c.previous_sibling())
07745                                         step_push(ns, c, alloc);
07746                                 
07747                                 break;
07748                         }
07749                         
07750                         case axis_following:
07751                         {
07752                                 xml_node cur = n;
07753 
07754                                 // exit from this node so that we don't include descendants
07755                                 while (cur && !cur.next_sibling()) cur = cur.parent();
07756                                 cur = cur.next_sibling();
07757 
07758                                 for (;;)
07759                                 {
07760                                         step_push(ns, cur, alloc);
07761 
07762                                         if (cur.first_child())
07763                                                 cur = cur.first_child();
07764                                         else if (cur.next_sibling())
07765                                                 cur = cur.next_sibling();
07766                                         else
07767                                         {
07768                                                 while (cur && !cur.next_sibling()) cur = cur.parent();
07769                                                 cur = cur.next_sibling();
07770 
07771                                                 if (!cur) break;
07772                                         }
07773                                 }
07774 
07775                                 break;
07776                         }
07777 
07778                         case axis_preceding:
07779                         {
07780                                 xml_node cur = n;
07781 
07782                                 while (cur && !cur.previous_sibling()) cur = cur.parent();
07783                                 cur = cur.previous_sibling();
07784 
07785                                 for (;;)
07786                                 {
07787                                         if (cur.last_child())
07788                                                 cur = cur.last_child();
07789                                         else
07790                                         {
07791                                                 // leaf node, can't be ancestor
07792                                                 step_push(ns, cur, alloc);
07793 
07794                                                 if (cur.previous_sibling())
07795                                                         cur = cur.previous_sibling();
07796                                                 else
07797                                                 {
07798                                                         do 
07799                                                         {
07800                                                                 cur = cur.parent();
07801                                                                 if (!cur) break;
07802 
07803                                                                 if (!node_is_ancestor(cur, n)) step_push(ns, cur, alloc);
07804                                                         }
07805                                                         while (!cur.previous_sibling());
07806 
07807                                                         cur = cur.previous_sibling();
07808 
07809                                                         if (!cur) break;
07810                                                 }
07811                                         }
07812                                 }
07813 
07814                                 break;
07815                         }
07816                         
07817                         case axis_ancestor:
07818                         case axis_ancestor_or_self:
07819                         {
07820                                 if (axis == axis_ancestor_or_self)
07821                                         step_push(ns, n, alloc);
07822 
07823                                 xml_node cur = n.parent();
07824                                 
07825                                 while (cur)
07826                                 {
07827                                         step_push(ns, cur, alloc);
07828                                         
07829                                         cur = cur.parent();
07830                                 }
07831                                 
07832                                 break;
07833                         }
07834 
07835                         case axis_self:
07836                         {
07837                                 step_push(ns, n, alloc);
07838 
07839                                 break;
07840                         }
07841 
07842                         case axis_parent:
07843                         {
07844                                 if (n.parent()) step_push(ns, n.parent(), alloc);
07845 
07846                                 break;
07847                         }
07848                                 
07849                         default:
07850                                 assert(!"Unimplemented axis");
07851                         }
07852                 }
07853                 
07854                 template <class T> void step_fill(xpath_node_set_raw& ns, const xml_attribute& a, const xml_node& p, xpath_allocator* alloc, T v)
07855                 {
07856                         const axis_t axis = T::axis;
07857 
07858                         switch (axis)
07859                         {
07860                         case axis_ancestor:
07861                         case axis_ancestor_or_self:
07862                         {
07863                                 if (axis == axis_ancestor_or_self && _test == nodetest_type_node) // reject attributes based on principal node type test
07864                                         step_push(ns, a, p, alloc);
07865 
07866                                 xml_node cur = p;
07867                                 
07868                                 while (cur)
07869                                 {
07870                                         step_push(ns, cur, alloc);
07871                                         
07872                                         cur = cur.parent();
07873                                 }
07874                                 
07875                                 break;
07876                         }
07877 
07878                         case axis_descendant_or_self:
07879                         case axis_self:
07880                         {
07881                                 if (_test == nodetest_type_node) // reject attributes based on principal node type test
07882                                         step_push(ns, a, p, alloc);
07883 
07884                                 break;
07885                         }
07886 
07887                         case axis_following:
07888                         {
07889                                 xml_node cur = p;
07890                                 
07891                                 for (;;)
07892                                 {
07893                                         if (cur.first_child())
07894                                                 cur = cur.first_child();
07895                                         else if (cur.next_sibling())
07896                                                 cur = cur.next_sibling();
07897                                         else
07898                                         {
07899                                                 while (cur && !cur.next_sibling()) cur = cur.parent();
07900                                                 cur = cur.next_sibling();
07901                                                 
07902                                                 if (!cur) break;
07903                                         }
07904 
07905                                         step_push(ns, cur, alloc);
07906                                 }
07907 
07908                                 break;
07909                         }
07910 
07911                         case axis_parent:
07912                         {
07913                                 step_push(ns, p, alloc);
07914 
07915                                 break;
07916                         }
07917 
07918                         case axis_preceding:
07919                         {
07920                                 // preceding:: axis does not include attribute nodes and attribute ancestors (they are the same as parent's ancestors), so we can reuse node preceding
07921                                 step_fill(ns, p, alloc, v);
07922                                 break;
07923                         }
07924                         
07925                         default:
07926                                 assert(!"Unimplemented axis");
07927                         }
07928                 }
07929                 
07930                 template <class T> xpath_node_set_raw step_do(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack, T v)
07931                 {
07932                         const axis_t axis = T::axis;
07933                         bool attributes = (axis == axis_ancestor || axis == axis_ancestor_or_self || axis == axis_descendant_or_self || axis == axis_following || axis == axis_parent || axis == axis_preceding || axis == axis_self);
07934 
07935                         xpath_node_set_raw ns;
07936                         ns.set_type((axis == axis_ancestor || axis == axis_ancestor_or_self || axis == axis_preceding || axis == axis_preceding_sibling) ? xpath_node_set::type_sorted_reverse : xpath_node_set::type_sorted);
07937 
07938                         if (_left)
07939                         {
07940                                 xpath_node_set_raw s = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack);
07941 
07942                                 // self axis preserves the original order
07943                                 if (axis == axis_self) ns.set_type(s.type());
07944 
07945                                 for (const xpath_node* it = s.begin(); it != s.end(); ++it)
07946                                 {
07947                                         size_t size = ns.size();
07948 
07949                                         // in general, all axes generate elements in a particular order, but there is no order guarantee if axis is applied to two nodes
07950                                         if (axis != axis_self && size != 0) ns.set_type(xpath_node_set::type_unsorted);
07951                                         
07952                                         if (it->node())
07953                                                 step_fill(ns, it->node(), stack.result, v);
07954                                         else if (attributes)
07955                                                 step_fill(ns, it->attribute(), it->parent(), stack.result, v);
07956                                                 
07957                                         apply_predicates(ns, size, stack);
07958                                 }
07959                         }
07960                         else
07961                         {
07962                                 if (c.n.node())
07963                                         step_fill(ns, c.n.node(), stack.result, v);
07964                                 else if (attributes)
07965                                         step_fill(ns, c.n.attribute(), c.n.parent(), stack.result, v);
07966                                 
07967                                 apply_predicates(ns, 0, stack);
07968                         }
07969 
07970                         // child, attribute and self axes always generate unique set of nodes
07971                         // for other axis, if the set stayed sorted, it stayed unique because the traversal algorithms do not visit the same node twice
07972                         if (axis != axis_child && axis != axis_attribute && axis != axis_self && ns.type() == xpath_node_set::type_unsorted)
07973                                 ns.remove_duplicates();
07974 
07975                         return ns;
07976                 }
07977                 
07978         public:
07979                 xpath_ast_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_value_type rettype_, const char_t* value):
07980                         _type(static_cast<char>(type)), _rettype(static_cast<char>(rettype_)), _axis(0), _test(0), _left(0), _right(0), _next(0)
07981                 {
07982                         assert(type == ast_string_constant);
07983                         _data.string = value;
07984                 }
07985 
07986                 xpath_ast_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_value_type rettype_, double value):
07987                         _type(static_cast<char>(type)), _rettype(static_cast<char>(rettype_)), _axis(0), _test(0), _left(0), _right(0), _next(0)
07988                 {
07989                         assert(type == ast_number_constant);
07990                         _data.number = value;
07991                 }
07992                 
07993                 xpath_ast_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_value_type rettype_, xpath_variable* value):
07994                         _type(static_cast<char>(type)), _rettype(static_cast<char>(rettype_)), _axis(0), _test(0), _left(0), _right(0), _next(0)
07995                 {
07996                         assert(type == ast_variable);
07997                         _data.variable = value;
07998                 }
07999                 
08000                 xpath_ast_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_value_type rettype_, xpath_ast_node* left = 0, xpath_ast_node* right = 0):
08001                         _type(static_cast<char>(type)), _rettype(static_cast<char>(rettype_)), _axis(0), _test(0), _left(left), _right(right), _next(0)
08002                 {
08003                 }
08004 
08005                 xpath_ast_node(ast_type_t type, xpath_ast_node* left, axis_t axis, nodetest_t test, const char_t* contents):
08006                         _type(static_cast<char>(type)), _rettype(xpath_type_node_set), _axis(static_cast<char>(axis)), _test(static_cast<char>(test)), _left(left), _right(0), _next(0)
08007                 {
08008                         _data.nodetest = contents;
08009                 }
08010 
08011                 void set_next(xpath_ast_node* value)
08012                 {
08013                         _next = value;
08014                 }
08015 
08016                 void set_right(xpath_ast_node* value)
08017                 {
08018                         _right = value;
08019                 }
08020 
08021                 bool eval_boolean(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack)
08022                 {
08023                         switch (_type)
08024                         {
08025                         case ast_op_or:
08026                                 return _left->eval_boolean(c, stack) || _right->eval_boolean(c, stack);
08027                                 
08028                         case ast_op_and:
08029                                 return _left->eval_boolean(c, stack) && _right->eval_boolean(c, stack);
08030                                 
08031                         case ast_op_equal:
08032                                 return compare_eq(_left, _right, c, stack, equal_to());
08033 
08034                         case ast_op_not_equal:
08035                                 return compare_eq(_left, _right, c, stack, not_equal_to());
08036         
08037                         case ast_op_less:
08038                                 return compare_rel(_left, _right, c, stack, less());
08039                         
08040                         case ast_op_greater:
08041                                 return compare_rel(_right, _left, c, stack, less());
08042 
08043                         case ast_op_less_or_equal:
08044                                 return compare_rel(_left, _right, c, stack, less_equal());
08045                         
08046                         case ast_op_greater_or_equal:
08047                                 return compare_rel(_right, _left, c, stack, less_equal());
08048 
08049                         case ast_func_starts_with:
08050                         {
08051                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08052 
08053                                 xpath_string lr = _left->eval_string(c, stack);
08054                                 xpath_string rr = _right->eval_string(c, stack);
08055 
08056                                 return starts_with(lr.c_str(), rr.c_str());
08057                         }
08058 
08059                         case ast_func_contains:
08060                         {
08061                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08062 
08063                                 xpath_string lr = _left->eval_string(c, stack);
08064                                 xpath_string rr = _right->eval_string(c, stack);
08065 
08066                                 return find_substring(lr.c_str(), rr.c_str()) != 0;
08067                         }
08068 
08069                         case ast_func_boolean:
08070                                 return _left->eval_boolean(c, stack);
08071                                 
08072                         case ast_func_not:
08073                                 return !_left->eval_boolean(c, stack);
08074                                 
08075                         case ast_func_true:
08076                                 return true;
08077                                 
08078                         case ast_func_false:
08079                                 return false;
08080 
08081                         case ast_func_lang:
08082                         {
08083                                 if (c.n.attribute()) return false;
08084                                 
08085                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08086 
08087                                 xpath_string lang = _left->eval_string(c, stack);
08088                                 
08089                                 for (xml_node n = c.n.node(); n; n = n.parent())
08090                                 {
08091                                         xml_attribute a = n.attribute(PUGIXML_TEXT("xml:lang"));
08092                                         
08093                                         if (a)
08094                                         {
08095                                                 const char_t* value = a.value();
08096                                                 
08097                                                 // strnicmp / strncasecmp is not portable
08098                                                 for (const char_t* lit = lang.c_str(); *lit; ++lit)
08099                                                 {
08100                                                         if (tolower_ascii(*lit) != tolower_ascii(*value)) return false;
08101                                                         ++value;
08102                                                 }
08103                                                 
08104                                                 return *value == 0 || *value == '-';
08105                                         }
08106                                 }
08107                                 
08108                                 return false;
08109                         }
08110 
08111                         case ast_variable:
08112                         {
08113                                 assert(_rettype == _data.variable->type());
08114 
08115                                 if (_rettype == xpath_type_boolean)
08116                                         return _data.variable->get_boolean();
08117 
08118                                 // fallthrough to type conversion
08119                         }
08120 
08121                         default:
08122                         {
08123                                 switch (_rettype)
08124                                 {
08125                                 case xpath_type_number:
08126                                         return convert_number_to_boolean(eval_number(c, stack));
08127                                         
08128                                 case xpath_type_string:
08129                                 {
08130                                         xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08131 
08132                                         return !eval_string(c, stack).empty();
08133                                 }
08134                                         
08135                                 case xpath_type_node_set:                               
08136                                 {
08137                                         xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08138 
08139                                         return !eval_node_set(c, stack).empty();
08140                                 }
08141 
08142                                 default:
08143                                         assert(!"Wrong expression for return type boolean");
08144                                         return false;
08145                                 }
08146                         }
08147                         }
08148                 }
08149 
08150                 double eval_number(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack)
08151                 {
08152                         switch (_type)
08153                         {
08154                         case ast_op_add:
08155                                 return _left->eval_number(c, stack) + _right->eval_number(c, stack);
08156                                 
08157                         case ast_op_subtract:
08158                                 return _left->eval_number(c, stack) - _right->eval_number(c, stack);
08159 
08160                         case ast_op_multiply:
08161                                 return _left->eval_number(c, stack) * _right->eval_number(c, stack);
08162 
08163                         case ast_op_divide:
08164                                 return _left->eval_number(c, stack) / _right->eval_number(c, stack);
08165 
08166                         case ast_op_mod:
08167                                 return fmod(_left->eval_number(c, stack), _right->eval_number(c, stack));
08168 
08169                         case ast_op_negate:
08170                                 return -_left->eval_number(c, stack);
08171 
08172                         case ast_number_constant:
08173                                 return _data.number;
08174 
08175                         case ast_func_last:
08176                                 return static_cast<double>(c.size);
08177                         
08178                         case ast_func_position:
08179                                 return static_cast<double>(c.position);
08180 
08181                         case ast_func_count:
08182                         {
08183                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08184 
08185                                 return static_cast<double>(_left->eval_node_set(c, stack).size());
08186                         }
08187                         
08188                         case ast_func_string_length_0:
08189                         {
08190                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08191 
08192                                 return static_cast<double>(string_value(c.n, stack.result).length());
08193                         }
08194                         
08195                         case ast_func_string_length_1:
08196                         {
08197                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08198 
08199                                 return static_cast<double>(_left->eval_string(c, stack).length());
08200                         }
08201                         
08202                         case ast_func_number_0:
08203                         {
08204                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08205 
08206                                 return convert_string_to_number(string_value(c.n, stack.result).c_str());
08207                         }
08208                         
08209                         case ast_func_number_1:
08210                                 return _left->eval_number(c, stack);
08211 
08212                         case ast_func_sum:
08213                         {
08214                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08215 
08216                                 double r = 0;
08217                                 
08218                                 xpath_node_set_raw ns = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack);
08219                                 
08220                                 for (const xpath_node* it = ns.begin(); it != ns.end(); ++it)
08221                                 {
08222                                         xpath_allocator_capture cri(stack.result);
08223 
08224                                         r += convert_string_to_number(string_value(*it, stack.result).c_str());
08225                                 }
08226                         
08227                                 return r;
08228                         }
08229 
08230                         case ast_func_floor:
08231                         {
08232                                 double r = _left->eval_number(c, stack);
08233                                 
08234                                 return r == r ? floor(r) : r;
08235                         }
08236 
08237                         case ast_func_ceiling:
08238                         {
08239                                 double r = _left->eval_number(c, stack);
08240                                 
08241                                 return r == r ? ceil(r) : r;
08242                         }
08243 
08244                         case ast_func_round:
08245                                 return round_nearest_nzero(_left->eval_number(c, stack));
08246                         
08247                         case ast_variable:
08248                         {
08249                                 assert(_rettype == _data.variable->type());
08250 
08251                                 if (_rettype == xpath_type_number)
08252                                         return _data.variable->get_number();
08253 
08254                                 // fallthrough to type conversion
08255                         }
08256 
08257                         default:
08258                         {
08259                                 switch (_rettype)
08260                                 {
08261                                 case xpath_type_boolean:
08262                                         return eval_boolean(c, stack) ? 1 : 0;
08263                                         
08264                                 case xpath_type_string:
08265                                 {
08266                                         xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08267 
08268                                         return convert_string_to_number(eval_string(c, stack).c_str());
08269                                 }
08270                                         
08271                                 case xpath_type_node_set:
08272                                 {
08273                                         xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08274 
08275                                         return convert_string_to_number(eval_string(c, stack).c_str());
08276                                 }
08277                                         
08278                                 default:
08279                                         assert(!"Wrong expression for return type number");
08280                                         return 0;
08281                                 }
08282                                 
08283                         }
08284                         }
08285                 }
08286                 
08287                 xpath_string eval_string_concat(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack)
08288                 {
08289                         assert(_type == ast_func_concat);
08290 
08291                         xpath_allocator_capture ct(stack.temp);
08292 
08293                         // count the string number
08294                         size_t count = 1;
08295                         for (xpath_ast_node* nc = _right; nc; nc = nc->_next) count++;
08296 
08297                         // gather all strings
08298                         xpath_string static_buffer[4];
08299                         xpath_string* buffer = static_buffer;
08300 
08301                         // allocate on-heap for large concats
08302                         if (count > sizeof(static_buffer) / sizeof(static_buffer[0]))
08303                         {
08304                                 buffer = static_cast<xpath_string*>(stack.temp->allocate(count * sizeof(xpath_string)));
08305                                 assert(buffer);
08306                         }
08307 
08308                         // evaluate all strings to temporary stack
08309                         xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
08310 
08311                         buffer[0] = _left->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
08312 
08313                         size_t pos = 1;
08314                         for (xpath_ast_node* n = _right; n; n = n->_next, ++pos) buffer[pos] = n->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
08315                         assert(pos == count);
08316 
08317                         // get total length
08318                         size_t length = 0;
08319                         for (size_t i = 0; i < count; ++i) length += buffer[i].length();
08320 
08321                         // create final string
08322                         char_t* result = static_cast<char_t*>(stack.result->allocate((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)));
08323                         assert(result);
08324 
08325                         char_t* ri = result;
08326 
08327                         for (size_t j = 0; j < count; ++j)
08328                                 for (const char_t* bi = buffer[j].c_str(); *bi; ++bi)
08329                                         *ri++ = *bi;
08330 
08331                         *ri = 0;
08332 
08333                         return xpath_string(result, true);
08334                 }
08335 
08336                 xpath_string eval_string(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack)
08337                 {
08338                         switch (_type)
08339                         {
08340                         case ast_string_constant:
08341                                 return xpath_string_const(_data.string);
08342                         
08343                         case ast_func_local_name_0:
08344                         {
08345                                 xpath_node na = c.n;
08346                                 
08347                                 return xpath_string_const(local_name(na));
08348                         }
08349 
08350                         case ast_func_local_name_1:
08351                         {
08352                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08353 
08354                                 xpath_node_set_raw ns = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack);
08355                                 xpath_node na = ns.first();
08356                                 
08357                                 return xpath_string_const(local_name(na));
08358                         }
08359 
08360                         case ast_func_name_0:
08361                         {
08362                                 xpath_node na = c.n;
08363                                 
08364                                 return xpath_string_const(qualified_name(na));
08365                         }
08366 
08367                         case ast_func_name_1:
08368                         {
08369                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08370 
08371                                 xpath_node_set_raw ns = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack);
08372                                 xpath_node na = ns.first();
08373                                 
08374                                 return xpath_string_const(qualified_name(na));
08375                         }
08376 
08377                         case ast_func_namespace_uri_0:
08378                         {
08379                                 xpath_node na = c.n;
08380                                 
08381                                 return xpath_string_const(namespace_uri(na));
08382                         }
08383 
08384                         case ast_func_namespace_uri_1:
08385                         {
08386                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.result);
08387 
08388                                 xpath_node_set_raw ns = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack);
08389                                 xpath_node na = ns.first();
08390                                 
08391                                 return xpath_string_const(namespace_uri(na));
08392                         }
08393 
08394                         case ast_func_string_0:
08395                                 return string_value(c.n, stack.result);
08396 
08397                         case ast_func_string_1:
08398                                 return _left->eval_string(c, stack);
08399 
08400                         case ast_func_concat:
08401                                 return eval_string_concat(c, stack);
08402 
08403                         case ast_func_substring_before:
08404                         {
08405                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
08406 
08407                                 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
08408 
08409                                 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
08410                                 xpath_string p = _right->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
08411 
08412                                 const char_t* pos = find_substring(s.c_str(), p.c_str());
08413                                 
08414                                 return pos ? xpath_string(s.c_str(), pos, stack.result) : xpath_string();
08415                         }
08416                         
08417                         case ast_func_substring_after:
08418                         {
08419                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
08420 
08421                                 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
08422 
08423                                 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
08424                                 xpath_string p = _right->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
08425                                 
08426                                 const char_t* pos = find_substring(s.c_str(), p.c_str());
08427                                 if (!pos) return xpath_string();
08428 
08429                                 const char_t* result = pos + p.length();
08430 
08431                                 return s.uses_heap() ? xpath_string(result, stack.result) : xpath_string_const(result);
08432                         }
08433 
08434                         case ast_func_substring_2:
08435                         {
08436                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
08437 
08438                                 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
08439 
08440                                 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
08441                                 size_t s_length = s.length();
08442 
08443                                 double first = round_nearest(_right->eval_number(c, stack));
08444                                 
08445                                 if (is_nan(first)) return xpath_string(); // NaN
08446                                 else if (first >= s_length + 1) return xpath_string();
08447                                 
08448                                 size_t pos = first < 1 ? 1 : static_cast<size_t>(first);
08449                                 assert(1 <= pos && pos <= s_length + 1);
08450 
08451                                 const char_t* rbegin = s.c_str() + (pos - 1);
08452                                 
08453                                 return s.uses_heap() ? xpath_string(rbegin, stack.result) : xpath_string_const(rbegin);
08454                         }
08455                         
08456                         case ast_func_substring_3:
08457                         {
08458                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
08459 
08460                                 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
08461 
08462                                 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
08463                                 size_t s_length = s.length();
08464 
08465                                 double first = round_nearest(_right->eval_number(c, stack));
08466                                 double last = first + round_nearest(_right->_next->eval_number(c, stack));
08467                                 
08468                                 if (is_nan(first) || is_nan(last)) return xpath_string();
08469                                 else if (first >= s_length + 1) return xpath_string();
08470                                 else if (first >= last) return xpath_string();
08471                                 else if (last < 1) return xpath_string();
08472                                 
08473                                 size_t pos = first < 1 ? 1 : static_cast<size_t>(first);
08474                                 size_t end = last >= s_length + 1 ? s_length + 1 : static_cast<size_t>(last);
08475 
08476                                 assert(1 <= pos && pos <= end && end <= s_length + 1);
08477                                 const char_t* rbegin = s.c_str() + (pos - 1);
08478                                 const char_t* rend = s.c_str() + (end - 1);
08479 
08480                                 return (end == s_length + 1 && !s.uses_heap()) ? xpath_string_const(rbegin) : xpath_string(rbegin, rend, stack.result);
08481                         }
08482 
08483                         case ast_func_normalize_space_0:
08484                         {
08485                                 xpath_string s = string_value(c.n, stack.result);
08486 
08487                                 normalize_space(s.data(stack.result));
08488 
08489                                 return s;
08490                         }
08491 
08492                         case ast_func_normalize_space_1:
08493                         {
08494                                 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, stack);
08495 
08496                                 normalize_space(s.data(stack.result));
08497                         
08498                                 return s;
08499                         }
08500 
08501                         case ast_func_translate:
08502                         {
08503                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
08504 
08505                                 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
08506 
08507                                 xpath_string s = _left->eval_string(c, stack);
08508                                 xpath_string from = _right->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
08509                                 xpath_string to = _right->_next->eval_string(c, swapped_stack);
08510 
08511                                 translate(s.data(stack.result), from.c_str(), to.c_str());
08512 
08513                                 return s;
08514                         }
08515 
08516                         case ast_variable:
08517                         {
08518                                 assert(_rettype == _data.variable->type());
08519 
08520                                 if (_rettype == xpath_type_string)
08521                                         return xpath_string_const(_data.variable->get_string());
08522 
08523                                 // fallthrough to type conversion
08524                         }
08525 
08526                         default:
08527                         {
08528                                 switch (_rettype)
08529                                 {
08530                                 case xpath_type_boolean:
08531                                         return xpath_string_const(eval_boolean(c, stack) ? PUGIXML_TEXT("true") : PUGIXML_TEXT("false"));
08532                                         
08533                                 case xpath_type_number:
08534                                         return convert_number_to_string(eval_number(c, stack), stack.result);
08535                                         
08536                                 case xpath_type_node_set:
08537                                 {
08538                                         xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
08539 
08540                                         xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
08541 
08542                                         xpath_node_set_raw ns = eval_node_set(c, swapped_stack);
08543                                         return ns.empty() ? xpath_string() : string_value(ns.first(), stack.result);
08544                                 }
08545                                 
08546                                 default:
08547                                         assert(!"Wrong expression for return type string");
08548                                         return xpath_string();
08549                                 }
08550                         }
08551                         }
08552                 }
08553 
08554                 xpath_node_set_raw eval_node_set(const xpath_context& c, const xpath_stack& stack)
08555                 {
08556                         switch (_type)
08557                         {
08558                         case ast_op_union:
08559                         {
08560                                 xpath_allocator_capture cr(stack.temp);
08561 
08562                                 xpath_stack swapped_stack = {stack.temp, stack.result};
08563 
08564                                 xpath_node_set_raw ls = _left->eval_node_set(c, swapped_stack);
08565                                 xpath_node_set_raw rs = _right->eval_node_set(c, stack);
08566                                 
08567                                 // we can optimize merging two sorted sets, but this is a very rare operation, so don't bother
08568                                 rs.set_type(xpath_node_set::type_unsorted);
08569 
08570                                 rs.append(ls.begin(), ls.end(), stack.result);
08571                                 rs.remove_duplicates();
08572                                 
08573                                 return rs;
08574                         }
08575 
08576                         case ast_filter:
08577                         case ast_filter_posinv:
08578                         {
08579                                 xpath_node_set_raw set = _left->eval_node_set(c, stack);
08580 
08581                                 // either expression is a number or it contains position() call; sort by document order
08582                                 if (_type == ast_filter) set.sort_do();
08583 
08584                                 apply_predicate(set, 0, _right, stack);
08585                         
08586                                 return set;
08587                         }
08588                         
08589                         case ast_func_id:
08590                                 return xpath_node_set_raw();
08591                         
08592                         case ast_step:
08593                         {
08594                                 switch (_axis)
