08595                                 {
08596                                 case axis_ancestor:
08597                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_ancestor>());
08598                                         
08599                                 case axis_ancestor_or_self:
08600                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_ancestor_or_self>());
08601 
08602                                 case axis_attribute:
08603                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_attribute>());
08604 
08605                                 case axis_child:
08606                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_child>());
08607                                 
08608                                 case axis_descendant:
08609                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_descendant>());
08610 
08611                                 case axis_descendant_or_self:
08612                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_descendant_or_self>());
08613 
08614                                 case axis_following:
08615                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_following>());
08616                                 
08617                                 case axis_following_sibling:
08618                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_following_sibling>());
08619                                 
08620                                 case axis_namespace:
08621                                         // namespaced axis is not supported
08622                                         return xpath_node_set_raw();
08623                                 
08624                                 case axis_parent:
08625                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_parent>());
08626                                 
08627                                 case axis_preceding:
08628                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_preceding>());
08629 
08630                                 case axis_preceding_sibling:
08631                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_preceding_sibling>());
08632                                 
08633                                 case axis_self:
08634                                         return step_do(c, stack, axis_to_type<axis_self>());
08635 
08636                                 default:
08637                                         assert(!"Unknown axis");
08638                                         return xpath_node_set_raw();
08639                                 }
08640                         }
08641 
08642                         case ast_step_root:
08643                         {
08644                                 assert(!_right); // root step can't have any predicates
08645 
08646                                 xpath_node_set_raw ns;
08647 
08648                                 ns.set_type(xpath_node_set::type_sorted);
08649 
08650                                 if (c.n.node()) ns.push_back(c.n.node().root(), stack.result);
08651                                 else if (c.n.attribute()) ns.push_back(c.n.parent().root(), stack.result);
08652 
08653                                 return ns;
08654                         }
08655 
08656                         case ast_variable:
08657                         {
08658                                 assert(_rettype == _data.variable->type());
08659 
08660                                 if (_rettype == xpath_type_node_set)
08661                                 {
08662                                         const xpath_node_set& s = _data.variable->get_node_set();
08663 
08664                                         xpath_node_set_raw ns;
08665 
08666                                         ns.set_type(s.type());
08667                                         ns.append(s.begin(), s.end(), stack.result);
08668 
08669                                         return ns;
08670                                 }
08671 
08672                                 // fallthrough to type conversion
08673                         }
08674 
08675                         default:
08676                                 assert(!"Wrong expression for return type node set");
08677                                 return xpath_node_set_raw();
08678                         }
08679                 }
08680                 
08681                 bool is_posinv()
08682                 {
08683                         switch (_type)
08684                         {
08685                         case ast_func_position:
08686                                 return false;
08687 
08688                         case ast_string_constant:
08689                         case ast_number_constant:
08690                         case ast_variable:
08691                                 return true;
08692 
08693                         case ast_step:
08694                         case ast_step_root:
08695                                 return true;
08696 
08697                         case ast_predicate:
08698                         case ast_filter:
08699                         case ast_filter_posinv:
08700                                 return true;
08701 
08702                         default:
08703                                 if (_left && !_left->is_posinv()) return false;
08704                                 
08705                                 for (xpath_ast_node* n = _right; n; n = n->_next)
08706                                         if (!n->is_posinv()) return false;
08707                                         
08708                                 return true;
08709                         }
08710                 }
08711 
08712                 xpath_value_type rettype() const
08713                 {
08714                         return static_cast<xpath_value_type>(_rettype);
08715                 }
08716         };
08717 
08718         struct xpath_parser
08719         {
08720                 xpath_allocator* _alloc;
08721                 xpath_lexer _lexer;
08722 
08723                 const char_t* _query;
08724                 xpath_variable_set* _variables;
08725 
08726                 xpath_parse_result* _result;
08727 
08728         #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
08729                 jmp_buf _error_handler;
08730         #endif
08731 
08732                 void throw_error(const char* message)
08733                 {
08734                         _result->error = message;
08735                         _result->offset = _lexer.current_pos() - _query;
08736 
08737                 #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
08738                         longjmp(_error_handler, 1);
08739                 #else
08740                         throw xpath_exception(*_result);
08741                 #endif
08742                 }
08743 
08744                 void throw_error_oom()
08745                 {
08746                 #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
08747                         throw_error("Out of memory");
08748                 #else
08749                         throw std::bad_alloc();
08750                 #endif
08751                 }
08752 
08753                 void* alloc_node()
08754                 {
08755                         void* result = _alloc->allocate_nothrow(sizeof(xpath_ast_node));
08756 
08757                         if (!result) throw_error_oom();
08758 
08759                         return result;
08760                 }
08761 
08762                 const char_t* alloc_string(const xpath_lexer_string& value)
08763                 {
08764                         if (value.begin)
08765                         {
08766                                 size_t length = static_cast<size_t>(value.end - value.begin);
08767 
08768                                 char_t* c = static_cast<char_t*>(_alloc->allocate_nothrow((length + 1) * sizeof(char_t)));
08769                                 if (!c) throw_error_oom();
08770 
08771                                 memcpy(c, value.begin, length * sizeof(char_t));
08772                                 c[length] = 0;
08773 
08774                                 return c;
08775                         }
08776                         else return 0;
08777                 }
08778 
08779                 xpath_ast_node* parse_function_helper(ast_type_t type0, ast_type_t type1, size_t argc, xpath_ast_node* args[2])
08780                 {
08781                         assert(argc <= 1);
08782 
08783                         if (argc == 1 && args[0]->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) throw_error("Function has to be applied to node set");
08784 
08785                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 0 ? type0 : type1, xpath_type_string, args[0]);
08786                 }
08787 
08788                 xpath_ast_node* parse_function(const xpath_lexer_string& name, size_t argc, xpath_ast_node* args[2])
08789                 {
08790                         switch (name.begin[0])
08791                         {
08792                         case 'b':
08793                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("boolean") && argc == 1)
08794                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_boolean, xpath_type_boolean, args[0]);
08795                                         
08796                                 break;
08797                         
08798                         case 'c':
08799                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("count") && argc == 1)
08800                                 {
08801                                         if (args[0]->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) throw_error("Function has to be applied to node set");
08802                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_count, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
08803                                 }
08804                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("contains") && argc == 2)
08805                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_contains, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
08806                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("concat") && argc >= 2)
08807                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_concat, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
08808                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("ceiling") && argc == 1)
08809                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_ceiling, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
08810                                         
08811                                 break;
08812                         
08813                         case 'f':
08814                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("false") && argc == 0)
08815                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_false, xpath_type_boolean);
08816                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("floor") && argc == 1)
08817                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_floor, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
08818                                         
08819                                 break;
08820                         
08821                         case 'i':
08822                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("id") && argc == 1)
08823                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_id, xpath_type_node_set, args[0]);
08824                                         
08825                                 break;
08826                         
08827                         case 'l':
08828                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("last") && argc == 0)
08829                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_last, xpath_type_number);
08830                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("lang") && argc == 1)
08831                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_lang, xpath_type_boolean, args[0]);
08832                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("local-name") && argc <= 1)
08833                                         return parse_function_helper(ast_func_local_name_0, ast_func_local_name_1, argc, args);
08834                         
08835                                 break;
08836                         
08837                         case 'n':
08838                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("name") && argc <= 1)
08839                                         return parse_function_helper(ast_func_name_0, ast_func_name_1, argc, args);
08840                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("namespace-uri") && argc <= 1)
08841                                         return parse_function_helper(ast_func_namespace_uri_0, ast_func_namespace_uri_1, argc, args);
08842                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("normalize-space") && argc <= 1)
08843                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_normalize_space_0 : ast_func_normalize_space_1, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
08844                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("not") && argc == 1)
08845                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_not, xpath_type_boolean, args[0]);
08846                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("number") && argc <= 1)
08847                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_number_0 : ast_func_number_1, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
08848                         
08849                                 break;
08850                         
08851                         case 'p':
08852                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("position") && argc == 0)
08853                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_position, xpath_type_number);
08854                                 
08855                                 break;
08856                         
08857                         case 'r':
08858                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("round") && argc == 1)
08859                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_round, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
08860 
08861                                 break;
08862                         
08863                         case 's':
08864                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("string") && argc <= 1)
08865                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_string_0 : ast_func_string_1, xpath_type_string, args[0]);
08866                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("string-length") && argc <= 1)
08867                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 0 ? ast_func_string_length_0 : ast_func_string_length_1, xpath_type_string, args[0]);
08868                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("starts-with") && argc == 2)
08869                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_starts_with, xpath_type_boolean, args[0], args[1]);
08870                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("substring-before") && argc == 2)
08871                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_substring_before, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
08872                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("substring-after") && argc == 2)
08873                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_substring_after, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
08874                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("substring") && (argc == 2 || argc == 3))
08875                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(argc == 2 ? ast_func_substring_2 : ast_func_substring_3, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
08876                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("sum") && argc == 1)
08877                                 {
08878                                         if (args[0]->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) throw_error("Function has to be applied to node set");
08879                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_sum, xpath_type_number, args[0]);
08880                                 }
08881 
08882                                 break;
08883                         
08884                         case 't':
08885                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("translate") && argc == 3)
08886                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_translate, xpath_type_string, args[0], args[1]);
08887                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("true") && argc == 0)
08888                                         return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_func_true, xpath_type_boolean);
08889                                         
08890                                 break;
08891 
08892                         default:
08893                                 break;
08894                         }
08895 
08896                         throw_error("Unrecognized function or wrong parameter count");
08897 
08898                         return 0;
08899                 }
08900 
08901                 axis_t parse_axis_name(const xpath_lexer_string& name, bool& specified)
08902                 {
08903                         specified = true;
08904 
08905                         switch (name.begin[0])
08906                         {
08907                         case 'a':
08908                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("ancestor"))
08909                                         return axis_ancestor;
08910                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("ancestor-or-self"))
08911                                         return axis_ancestor_or_self;
08912                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("attribute"))
08913                                         return axis_attribute;
08914                                 
08915                                 break;
08916                         
08917                         case 'c':
08918                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("child"))
08919                                         return axis_child;
08920                                 
08921                                 break;
08922                         
08923                         case 'd':
08924                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("descendant"))
08925                                         return axis_descendant;
08926                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("descendant-or-self"))
08927                                         return axis_descendant_or_self;
08928                                 
08929                                 break;
08930                         
08931                         case 'f':
08932                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("following"))
08933                                         return axis_following;
08934                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("following-sibling"))
08935                                         return axis_following_sibling;
08936                                 
08937                                 break;
08938                         
08939                         case 'n':
08940                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("namespace"))
08941                                         return axis_namespace;
08942                                 
08943                                 break;
08944                         
08945                         case 'p':
08946                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("parent"))
08947                                         return axis_parent;
08948                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("preceding"))
08949                                         return axis_preceding;
08950                                 else if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("preceding-sibling"))
08951                                         return axis_preceding_sibling;
08952                                 
08953                                 break;
08954                         
08955                         case 's':
08956                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("self"))
08957                                         return axis_self;
08958                                 
08959                                 break;
08960 
08961                         default:
08962                                 break;
08963                         }
08964 
08965                         specified = false;
08966                         return axis_child;
08967                 }
08968 
08969                 nodetest_t parse_node_test_type(const xpath_lexer_string& name)
08970                 {
08971                         switch (name.begin[0])
08972                         {
08973                         case 'c':
08974                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("comment"))
08975                                         return nodetest_type_comment;
08976 
08977                                 break;
08978 
08979                         case 'n':
08980                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("node"))
08981                                         return nodetest_type_node;
08982 
08983                                 break;
08984 
08985                         case 'p':
08986                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("processing-instruction"))
08987                                         return nodetest_type_pi;
08988 
08989                                 break;
08990 
08991                         case 't':
08992                                 if (name == PUGIXML_TEXT("text"))
08993                                         return nodetest_type_text;
08994 
08995                                 break;
08996                         
08997                         default:
08998                                 break;
08999                         }
09000 
09001                         return nodetest_none;
09002                 }
09003 
09004                 // PrimaryExpr ::= VariableReference | '(' Expr ')' | Literal | Number | FunctionCall
09005                 xpath_ast_node* parse_primary_expression()
09006                 {
09007                         switch (_lexer.current())
09008                         {
09009                         case lex_var_ref:
09010                         {
09011                                 xpath_lexer_string name = _lexer.contents();
09012 
09013                                 if (!_variables)
09014                                         throw_error("Unknown variable: variable set is not provided");
09015 
09016                                 xpath_variable* var = get_variable(_variables, name.begin, name.end);
09017 
09018                                 if (!var)
09019                                         throw_error("Unknown variable: variable set does not contain the given name");
09020 
09021                                 _lexer.next();
09022 
09023                                 return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_variable, var->type(), var);
09024                         }
09025 
09026                         case lex_open_brace:
09027                         {
09028                                 _lexer.next();
09029 
09030                                 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_expression();
09031 
09032                                 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_brace)
09033                                         throw_error("Unmatched braces");
09034 
09035                                 _lexer.next();
09036 
09037                                 return n;
09038                         }
09039 
09040                         case lex_quoted_string:
09041                         {
09042                                 const char_t* value = alloc_string(_lexer.contents());
09043 
09044                                 xpath_ast_node* n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_string_constant, xpath_type_string, value);
09045                                 _lexer.next();
09046 
09047                                 return n;
09048                         }
09049 
09050                         case lex_number:
09051                         {
09052                                 double value = 0;
09053 
09054                                 if (!convert_string_to_number(_lexer.contents().begin, _lexer.contents().end, &value))
09055                                         throw_error_oom();
09056 
09057                                 xpath_ast_node* n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_number_constant, xpath_type_number, value);
09058                                 _lexer.next();
09059 
09060                                 return n;
09061                         }
09062 
09063                         case lex_string:
09064                         {
09065                                 xpath_ast_node* args[2] = {0};
09066                                 size_t argc = 0;
09067                                 
09068                                 xpath_lexer_string function = _lexer.contents();
09069                                 _lexer.next();
09070                                 
09071                                 xpath_ast_node* last_arg = 0;
09072                                 
09073                                 if (_lexer.current() != lex_open_brace)
09074                                         throw_error("Unrecognized function call");
09075                                 _lexer.next();
09076 
09077                                 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_brace)
09078                                         args[argc++] = parse_expression();
09079 
09080                                 while (_lexer.current() != lex_close_brace)
09081                                 {
09082                                         if (_lexer.current() != lex_comma)
09083                                                 throw_error("No comma between function arguments");
09084                                         _lexer.next();
09085                                         
09086                                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_expression();
09087                                         
09088                                         if (argc < 2) args[argc] = n;
09089                                         else last_arg->set_next(n);
09090 
09091                                         argc++;
09092                                         last_arg = n;
09093                                 }
09094                                 
09095                                 _lexer.next();
09096 
09097                                 return parse_function(function, argc, args);
09098                         }
09099 
09100                         default:
09101                                 throw_error("Unrecognizable primary expression");
09102 
09103                                 return 0;
09104                         }
09105                 }
09106                 
09107                 // FilterExpr ::= PrimaryExpr | FilterExpr Predicate
09108                 // Predicate ::= '[' PredicateExpr ']'
09109                 // PredicateExpr ::= Expr
09110                 xpath_ast_node* parse_filter_expression()
09111                 {
09112                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_primary_expression();
09113 
09114                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_open_square_brace)
09115                         {
09116                                 _lexer.next();
09117 
09118                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_expression();
09119 
09120                                 if (n->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) throw_error("Predicate has to be applied to node set");
09121 
09122                                 bool posinv = expr->rettype() != xpath_type_number && expr->is_posinv();
09123 
09124                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(posinv ? ast_filter_posinv : ast_filter, xpath_type_node_set, n, expr);
09125 
09126                                 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_square_brace)
09127                                         throw_error("Unmatched square brace");
09128                         
09129                                 _lexer.next();
09130                         }
09131                         
09132                         return n;
09133                 }
09134                 
09135                 // Step ::= AxisSpecifier NodeTest Predicate* | AbbreviatedStep
09136                 // AxisSpecifier ::= AxisName '::' | '@'?
09137                 // NodeTest ::= NameTest | NodeType '(' ')' | 'processing-instruction' '(' Literal ')'
09138                 // NameTest ::= '*' | NCName ':' '*' | QName
09139                 // AbbreviatedStep ::= '.' | '..'
09140                 xpath_ast_node* parse_step(xpath_ast_node* set)
09141                 {
09142                         if (set && set->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set)
09143                                 throw_error("Step has to be applied to node set");
09144 
09145                         bool axis_specified = false;
09146                         axis_t axis = axis_child; // implied child axis
09147 
09148                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_axis_attribute)
09149                         {
09150                                 axis = axis_attribute;
09151                                 axis_specified = true;
09152                                 
09153                                 _lexer.next();
09154                         }
09155                         else if (_lexer.current() == lex_dot)
09156                         {
09157                                 _lexer.next();
09158                                 
09159                                 return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, set, axis_self, nodetest_type_node, 0);
09160                         }
09161                         else if (_lexer.current() == lex_double_dot)
09162                         {
09163                                 _lexer.next();
09164                                 
09165                                 return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, set, axis_parent, nodetest_type_node, 0);
09166                         }
09167                 
09168                         nodetest_t nt_type = nodetest_none;
09169                         xpath_lexer_string nt_name;
09170                         
09171                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_string)
09172                         {
09173                                 // node name test
09174                                 nt_name = _lexer.contents();
09175                                 _lexer.next();
09176 
09177                                 // was it an axis name?
09178                                 if (_lexer.current() == lex_double_colon)
09179                                 {
09180                                         // parse axis name
09181                                         if (axis_specified) throw_error("Two axis specifiers in one step");
09182 
09183                                         axis = parse_axis_name(nt_name, axis_specified);
09184 
09185                                         if (!axis_specified) throw_error("Unknown axis");
09186 
09187                                         // read actual node test
09188                                         _lexer.next();
09189 
09190                                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_multiply)
09191                                         {
09192                                                 nt_type = nodetest_all;
09193                                                 nt_name = xpath_lexer_string();
09194                                                 _lexer.next();
09195                                         }
09196                                         else if (_lexer.current() == lex_string)
09197                                         {
09198                                                 nt_name = _lexer.contents();
09199                                                 _lexer.next();
09200                                         }
09201                                         else throw_error("Unrecognized node test");
09202                                 }
09203                                 
09204                                 if (nt_type == nodetest_none)
09205                                 {
09206                                         // node type test or processing-instruction
09207                                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_open_brace)
09208                                         {
09209                                                 _lexer.next();
09210                                                 
09211                                                 if (_lexer.current() == lex_close_brace)
09212                                                 {
09213                                                         _lexer.next();
09214 
09215                                                         nt_type = parse_node_test_type(nt_name);
09216 
09217                                                         if (nt_type == nodetest_none) throw_error("Unrecognized node type");
09218                                                         
09219                                                         nt_name = xpath_lexer_string();
09220                                                 }
09221                                                 else if (nt_name == PUGIXML_TEXT("processing-instruction"))
09222                                                 {
09223                                                         if (_lexer.current() != lex_quoted_string)
09224                                                                 throw_error("Only literals are allowed as arguments to processing-instruction()");
09225                                                 
09226                                                         nt_type = nodetest_pi;
09227                                                         nt_name = _lexer.contents();
09228                                                         _lexer.next();
09229                                                         
09230                                                         if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_brace)
09231                                                                 throw_error("Unmatched brace near processing-instruction()");
09232                                                         _lexer.next();
09233                                                 }
09234                                                 else
09235                                                         throw_error("Unmatched brace near node type test");
09236 
09237                                         }
09238                                         // QName or NCName:*
09239                                         else
09240                                         {
09241                                                 if (nt_name.end - nt_name.begin > 2 && nt_name.end[-2] == ':' && nt_name.end[-1] == '*') // NCName:*
09242                                                 {
09243                                                         nt_name.end--; // erase *
09244                                                         
09245                                                         nt_type = nodetest_all_in_namespace;
09246                                                 }
09247                                                 else nt_type = nodetest_name;
09248                                         }
09249                                 }
09250                         }
09251                         else if (_lexer.current() == lex_multiply)
09252                         {
09253                                 nt_type = nodetest_all;
09254                                 _lexer.next();
09255                         }
09256                         else throw_error("Unrecognized node test");
09257                         
09258                         xpath_ast_node* n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, set, axis, nt_type, alloc_string(nt_name));
09259                         
09260                         xpath_ast_node* last = 0;
09261                         
09262                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_open_square_brace)
09263                         {
09264                                 _lexer.next();
09265                                 
09266                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_expression();
09267 
09268                                 xpath_ast_node* pred = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_predicate, xpath_type_node_set, expr);
09269                                 
09270                                 if (_lexer.current() != lex_close_square_brace)
09271                                         throw_error("Unmatched square brace");
09272                                 _lexer.next();
09273                                 
09274                                 if (last) last->set_next(pred);
09275                                 else n->set_right(pred);
09276                                 
09277                                 last = pred;
09278                         }
09279                         
09280                         return n;
09281                 }
09282                 
09283                 // RelativeLocationPath ::= Step | RelativeLocationPath '/' Step | RelativeLocationPath '//' Step
09284                 xpath_ast_node* parse_relative_location_path(xpath_ast_node* set)
09285                 {
09286                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_step(set);
09287                         
09288                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_slash || _lexer.current() == lex_double_slash)
09289                         {
09290                                 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current();
09291                                 _lexer.next();
09292 
09293                                 if (l == lex_double_slash)
09294                                         n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, n, axis_descendant_or_self, nodetest_type_node, 0);
09295                                 
09296                                 n = parse_step(n);
09297                         }
09298                         
09299                         return n;
09300                 }
09301                 
09302                 // LocationPath ::= RelativeLocationPath | AbsoluteLocationPath
09303                 // AbsoluteLocationPath ::= '/' RelativeLocationPath? | '//' RelativeLocationPath
09304                 xpath_ast_node* parse_location_path()
09305                 {
09306                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_slash)
09307                         {
09308                                 _lexer.next();
09309                                 
09310                                 xpath_ast_node* n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step_root, xpath_type_node_set);
09311 
09312                                 // relative location path can start from axis_attribute, dot, double_dot, multiply and string lexemes; any other lexeme means standalone root path
09313                                 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current();
09314 
09315                                 if (l == lex_string || l == lex_axis_attribute || l == lex_dot || l == lex_double_dot || l == lex_multiply)
09316                                         return parse_relative_location_path(n);
09317                                 else
09318                                         return n;
09319                         }
09320                         else if (_lexer.current() == lex_double_slash)
09321                         {
09322                                 _lexer.next();
09323                                 
09324                                 xpath_ast_node* n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step_root, xpath_type_node_set);
09325                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, n, axis_descendant_or_self, nodetest_type_node, 0);
09326                                 
09327                                 return parse_relative_location_path(n);
09328                         }
09329 
09330                         // else clause moved outside of if because of bogus warning 'control may reach end of non-void function being inlined' in gcc 4.0.1
09331                         return parse_relative_location_path(0);
09332                 }
09333                 
09334                 // PathExpr ::= LocationPath
09335                 //                              | FilterExpr
09336                 //                              | FilterExpr '/' RelativeLocationPath
09337                 //                              | FilterExpr '//' RelativeLocationPath
09338                 xpath_ast_node* parse_path_expression()
09339                 {
09340                         // Clarification.
09341                         // PathExpr begins with either LocationPath or FilterExpr.
09342                         // FilterExpr begins with PrimaryExpr
09343                         // PrimaryExpr begins with '$' in case of it being a variable reference,
09344                         // '(' in case of it being an expression, string literal, number constant or
09345                         // function call.
09346 
09347                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_var_ref || _lexer.current() == lex_open_brace || 
09348                                 _lexer.current() == lex_quoted_string || _lexer.current() == lex_number ||
09349                                 _lexer.current() == lex_string)
09350                         {
09351                                 if (_lexer.current() == lex_string)
09352                                 {
09353                                         // This is either a function call, or not - if not, we shall proceed with location path
09354                                         const char_t* state = _lexer.state();
09355                                         
09356                                         while (PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE(*state, ct_space)) ++state;
09357                                         
09358                                         if (*state != '(') return parse_location_path();
09359 
09360                                         // This looks like a function call; however this still can be a node-test. Check it.
09361                                         if (parse_node_test_type(_lexer.contents()) != nodetest_none) return parse_location_path();
09362                                 }
09363                                 
09364                                 xpath_ast_node* n = parse_filter_expression();
09365 
09366                                 if (_lexer.current() == lex_slash || _lexer.current() == lex_double_slash)
09367                                 {
09368                                         lexeme_t l = _lexer.current();
09369                                         _lexer.next();
09370                                         
09371                                         if (l == lex_double_slash)
09372                                         {
09373                                                 if (n->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set) throw_error("Step has to be applied to node set");
09374 
09375                                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_step, n, axis_descendant_or_self, nodetest_type_node, 0);
09376                                         }
09377         
09378                                         // select from location path
09379                                         return parse_relative_location_path(n);
09380                                 }
09381 
09382                                 return n;
09383                         }
09384                         else return parse_location_path();
09385                 }
09386 
09387                 // UnionExpr ::= PathExpr | UnionExpr '|' PathExpr
09388                 xpath_ast_node* parse_union_expression()
09389                 {
09390                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_path_expression();
09391 
09392                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_union)
09393                         {
09394                                 _lexer.next();
09395 
09396                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_union_expression();
09397 
09398                                 if (n->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set || expr->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set)
09399                                         throw_error("Union operator has to be applied to node sets");
09400 
09401                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_op_union, xpath_type_node_set, n, expr);
09402                         }
09403 
09404                         return n;
09405                 }
09406 
09407                 // UnaryExpr ::= UnionExpr | '-' UnaryExpr
09408                 xpath_ast_node* parse_unary_expression()
09409                 {
09410                         if (_lexer.current() == lex_minus)
09411                         {
09412                                 _lexer.next();
09413 
09414                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_unary_expression();
09415 
09416                                 return new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_op_negate, xpath_type_number, expr);
09417                         }
09418                         else return parse_union_expression();
09419                 }
09420                 
09421                 // MultiplicativeExpr ::= UnaryExpr
09422                 //                                                | MultiplicativeExpr '*' UnaryExpr
09423                 //                                                | MultiplicativeExpr 'div' UnaryExpr
09424                 //                                                | MultiplicativeExpr 'mod' UnaryExpr
09425                 xpath_ast_node* parse_multiplicative_expression()
09426                 {
09427                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_unary_expression();
09428 
09429                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_multiply || (_lexer.current() == lex_string &&
09430                                    (_lexer.contents() == PUGIXML_TEXT("mod") || _lexer.contents() == PUGIXML_TEXT("div"))))
09431                         {
09432                                 ast_type_t op = _lexer.current() == lex_multiply ? ast_op_multiply :
09433                                         _lexer.contents().begin[0] == 'd' ? ast_op_divide : ast_op_mod;
09434                                 _lexer.next();
09435 
09436                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_unary_expression();
09437 
09438                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(op, xpath_type_number, n, expr);
09439                         }
09440 
09441                         return n;
09442                 }
09443 
09444                 // AdditiveExpr ::= MultiplicativeExpr
09445                 //                                      | AdditiveExpr '+' MultiplicativeExpr
09446                 //                                      | AdditiveExpr '-' MultiplicativeExpr
09447                 xpath_ast_node* parse_additive_expression()
09448                 {
09449                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_multiplicative_expression();
09450 
09451                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_plus || _lexer.current() == lex_minus)
09452                         {
09453                                 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current();
09454 
09455                                 _lexer.next();
09456 
09457                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_multiplicative_expression();
09458 
09459                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(l == lex_plus ? ast_op_add : ast_op_subtract, xpath_type_number, n, expr);
09460                         }
09461 
09462                         return n;
09463                 }
09464 
09465                 // RelationalExpr ::= AdditiveExpr
09466                 //                                        | RelationalExpr '<' AdditiveExpr
09467                 //                                        | RelationalExpr '>' AdditiveExpr
09468                 //                                        | RelationalExpr '<=' AdditiveExpr
09469                 //                                        | RelationalExpr '>=' AdditiveExpr
09470                 xpath_ast_node* parse_relational_expression()
09471                 {
09472                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_additive_expression();
09473 
09474                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_less || _lexer.current() == lex_less_or_equal || 
09475                                    _lexer.current() == lex_greater || _lexer.current() == lex_greater_or_equal)
09476                         {
09477                                 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current();
09478                                 _lexer.next();
09479 
09480                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_additive_expression();
09481 
09482                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(l == lex_less ? ast_op_less : l == lex_greater ? ast_op_greater :
09483                                                                 l == lex_less_or_equal ? ast_op_less_or_equal : ast_op_greater_or_equal, xpath_type_boolean, n, expr);
09484                         }
09485 
09486                         return n;
09487                 }
09488                 
09489                 // EqualityExpr ::= RelationalExpr
09490                 //                                      | EqualityExpr '=' RelationalExpr
09491                 //                                      | EqualityExpr '!=' RelationalExpr
09492                 xpath_ast_node* parse_equality_expression()
09493                 {
09494                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_relational_expression();
09495 
09496                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_equal || _lexer.current() == lex_not_equal)
09497                         {
09498                                 lexeme_t l = _lexer.current();
09499 
09500                                 _lexer.next();
09501 
09502                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_relational_expression();
09503 
09504                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(l == lex_equal ? ast_op_equal : ast_op_not_equal, xpath_type_boolean, n, expr);
09505                         }
09506 
09507                         return n;
09508                 }
09509                 
09510                 // AndExpr ::= EqualityExpr | AndExpr 'and' EqualityExpr
09511                 xpath_ast_node* parse_and_expression()
09512                 {
09513                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_equality_expression();
09514 
09515                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_string && _lexer.contents() == PUGIXML_TEXT("and"))
09516                         {
09517                                 _lexer.next();
09518 
09519                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_equality_expression();
09520 
09521                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_op_and, xpath_type_boolean, n, expr);
09522                         }
09523 
09524                         return n;
09525                 }
09526 
09527                 // OrExpr ::= AndExpr | OrExpr 'or' AndExpr
09528                 xpath_ast_node* parse_or_expression()
09529                 {
09530                         xpath_ast_node* n = parse_and_expression();
09531 
09532                         while (_lexer.current() == lex_string && _lexer.contents() == PUGIXML_TEXT("or"))
09533                         {
09534                                 _lexer.next();
09535 
09536                                 xpath_ast_node* expr = parse_and_expression();
09537 
09538                                 n = new (alloc_node()) xpath_ast_node(ast_op_or, xpath_type_boolean, n, expr);
09539                         }
09540 
09541                         return n;
09542                 }
09543                 
09544                 // Expr ::= OrExpr
09545                 xpath_ast_node* parse_expression()
09546                 {
09547                         return parse_or_expression();
09548                 }
09549 
09550                 xpath_parser(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables, xpath_allocator* alloc, xpath_parse_result* result): _alloc(alloc), _lexer(query), _query(query), _variables(variables), _result(result)
09551                 {
09552                 }
09553 
09554                 xpath_ast_node* parse()
09555                 {
09556                         xpath_ast_node* result = parse_expression();
09557                         
09558                         if (_lexer.current() != lex_eof)
09559                         {
09560                                 // there are still unparsed tokens left, error
09561                                 throw_error("Incorrect query");
09562                         }
09563                         
09564                         return result;
09565                 }
09566 
09567                 static xpath_ast_node* parse(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables, xpath_allocator* alloc, xpath_parse_result* result)
09568                 {
09569                         xpath_parser parser(query, variables, alloc, result);
09570 
09571                 #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
09572                         int error = setjmp(parser._error_handler);
09573 
09574                         return (error == 0) ? parser.parse() : 0;
09575                 #else
09576                         return parser.parse();
09577                 #endif
09578                 }
09579         };
09580 
09581         struct xpath_query_impl
09582         {
09583                 static xpath_query_impl* create()
09584                 {
09585                         void* memory = xml_memory::allocate(sizeof(xpath_query_impl));
09586 
09587                         return new (memory) xpath_query_impl();
09588                 }
09589 
09590                 static void destroy(void* ptr)
09591                 {
09592                         if (!ptr) return;
09593                         
09594                         // free all allocated pages
09595                         static_cast<xpath_query_impl*>(ptr)->alloc.release();
09596 
09597                         // free allocator memory (with the first page)
09598                         xml_memory::deallocate(ptr);
09599                 }
09600 
09601                 xpath_query_impl(): root(0), alloc(&block)
09602                 {
09603                         block.next = 0;
09604                 }
09605 
09606                 xpath_ast_node* root;
09607                 xpath_allocator alloc;
09608                 xpath_memory_block block;
09609         };
09610 
09611         PUGI__FN xpath_string evaluate_string_impl(xpath_query_impl* impl, const xpath_node& n, xpath_stack_data& sd)
09612         {
09613                 if (!impl) return xpath_string();
09614 
09615         #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
09616                 if (setjmp(sd.error_handler)) return xpath_string();
09617         #endif
09618 
09619                 xpath_context c(n, 1, 1);
09620 
09621                 return impl->root->eval_string(c, sd.stack);
09622         }
09623 PUGI__NS_END
09624 
09625 namespace pugi
09626 {
09627 #ifndef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
09628         PUGI__FN xpath_exception::xpath_exception(const xpath_parse_result& result_): _result(result_)
09629         {
09630                 assert(_result.error);
09631         }
09632         
09633         PUGI__FN const char* xpath_exception::what() const throw()
09634         {
09635                 return _result.error;
09636         }
09637 
09638         PUGI__FN const xpath_parse_result& xpath_exception::result() const
09639         {
09640                 return _result;
09641         }
09642 #endif
09643         
09644         PUGI__FN xpath_node::xpath_node()
09645         {
09646         }
09647                 
09648         PUGI__FN xpath_node::xpath_node(const xml_node& node_): _node(node_)
09649         {
09650         }
09651                 
09652         PUGI__FN xpath_node::xpath_node(const xml_attribute& attribute_, const xml_node& parent_): _node(attribute_ ? parent_ : xml_node()), _attribute(attribute_)
09653         {
09654         }
09655 
09656         PUGI__FN xml_node xpath_node::node() const
09657         {
09658                 return _attribute ? xml_node() : _node;
09659         }
09660                 
09661         PUGI__FN xml_attribute xpath_node::attribute() const
09662         {
09663                 return _attribute;
09664         }
09665         
09666         PUGI__FN xml_node xpath_node::parent() const
09667         {
09668                 return _attribute ? _node : _node.parent();
09669         }
09670 
09671         PUGI__FN static void unspecified_bool_xpath_node(xpath_node***)
09672         {
09673         }
09674 
09675         PUGI__FN xpath_node::operator xpath_node::unspecified_bool_type() const
09676         {
09677                 return (_node || _attribute) ? unspecified_bool_xpath_node : 0;
09678         }
09679         
09680         PUGI__FN bool xpath_node::operator!() const
09681         {
09682                 return !(_node || _attribute);
09683         }
09684 
09685         PUGI__FN bool xpath_node::operator==(const xpath_node& n) const
09686         {
09687                 return _node == n._node && _attribute == n._attribute;
09688         }
09689         
09690         PUGI__FN bool xpath_node::operator!=(const xpath_node& n) const
09691         {
09692                 return _node != n._node || _attribute != n._attribute;
09693         }
09694 
09695 #ifdef __BORLANDC__
09696         PUGI__FN bool operator&&(const xpath_node& lhs, bool rhs)
09697         {
09698                 return (bool)lhs && rhs;
09699         }
09700 
09701         PUGI__FN bool operator||(const xpath_node& lhs, bool rhs)
09702         {
09703                 return (bool)lhs || rhs;
09704         }
09705 #endif
09706 
09707         PUGI__FN void xpath_node_set::_assign(const_iterator begin_, const_iterator end_)
09708         {
09709                 assert(begin_ <= end_);
09710 
09711                 size_t size_ = static_cast<size_t>(end_ - begin_);
09712 
09713                 if (size_ <= 1)
09714                 {
09715                         // deallocate old buffer
09716                         if (_begin != &_storage) impl::xml_memory::deallocate(_begin);
09717 
09718                         // use internal buffer
09719                         if (begin_ != end_) _storage = *begin_;
09720 
09721                         _begin = &_storage;
09722                         _end = &_storage + size_;
09723                 }
09724                 else
09725                 {
09726                         // make heap copy
09727                         xpath_node* storage = static_cast<xpath_node*>(impl::xml_memory::allocate(size_ * sizeof(xpath_node)));
09728 
09729                         if (!storage)
09730                         {
09731                         #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
09732                                 return;
09733                         #else
09734                                 throw std::bad_alloc();
09735                         #endif
09736                         }
09737 
09738                         memcpy(storage, begin_, size_ * sizeof(xpath_node));
09739                         
09740                         // deallocate old buffer
09741                         if (_begin != &_storage) impl::xml_memory::deallocate(_begin);
09742 
09743                         // finalize
09744                         _begin = storage;
09745                         _end = storage + size_;
09746                 }
09747         }
09748 
09749         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::xpath_node_set(): _type(type_unsorted), _begin(&_storage), _end(&_storage)
09750         {
09751         }
09752 
09753         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::xpath_node_set(const_iterator begin_, const_iterator end_, type_t type_): _type(type_), _begin(&_storage), _end(&_storage)
09754         {
09755                 _assign(begin_, end_);
09756         }
09757 
09758         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::~xpath_node_set()
09759         {
09760                 if (_begin != &_storage) impl::xml_memory::deallocate(_begin);
09761         }
09762                 
09763         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::xpath_node_set(const xpath_node_set& ns): _type(ns._type), _begin(&_storage), _end(&_storage)
09764         {
09765                 _assign(ns._begin, ns._end);
09766         }
09767         
09768         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set& xpath_node_set::operator=(const xpath_node_set& ns)
09769         {
09770                 if (this == &ns) return *this;
09771                 
09772                 _type = ns._type;
09773                 _assign(ns._begin, ns._end);
09774 
09775                 return *this;
09776         }
09777 
09778         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::type_t xpath_node_set::type() const
09779         {
09780                 return _type;
09781         }
09782                 
09783         PUGI__FN size_t xpath_node_set::size() const
09784         {
09785                 return _end - _begin;
09786         }
09787                 
09788         PUGI__FN bool xpath_node_set::empty() const
09789         {
09790                 return _begin == _end;
09791         }
09792                 
09793         PUGI__FN const xpath_node& xpath_node_set::operator[](size_t index) const
09794         {
09795                 assert(index < size());
09796                 return _begin[index];
09797         }
09798 
09799         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::const_iterator xpath_node_set::begin() const
09800         {
09801                 return _begin;
09802         }
09803                 
09804         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set::const_iterator xpath_node_set::end() const
09805         {
09806                 return _end;
09807         }
09808         
09809         PUGI__FN void xpath_node_set::sort(bool reverse)
09810         {
09811                 _type = impl::xpath_sort(_begin, _end, _type, reverse);
09812         }
09813 
09814         PUGI__FN xpath_node xpath_node_set::first() const
09815         {
09816                 return impl::xpath_first(_begin, _end, _type);
09817         }
09818 
09819         PUGI__FN xpath_parse_result::xpath_parse_result(): error("Internal error"), offset(0)
09820         {
09821         }
09822 
09823         PUGI__FN xpath_parse_result::operator bool() const
09824         {
09825                 return error == 0;
09826         }
09827 
09828         PUGI__FN const char* xpath_parse_result::description() const
09829         {
09830                 return error ? error : "No error";
09831         }
09832 
09833         PUGI__FN xpath_variable::xpath_variable()
09834         {
09835         }
09836 
09837         PUGI__FN const char_t* xpath_variable::name() const
09838         {
09839                 switch (_type)
09840                 {
09841                 case xpath_type_node_set:
09842                         return static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_node_set*>(this)->name;
09843 
09844                 case xpath_type_number:
09845                         return static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_number*>(this)->name;
09846 
09847                 case xpath_type_string:
09848                         return static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_string*>(this)->name;
09849 
09850                 case xpath_type_boolean:
09851                         return static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_boolean*>(this)->name;
09852 
09853                 default:
09854                         assert(!"Invalid variable type");
09855                         return 0;
09856                 }
09857         }
09858 
09859         PUGI__FN xpath_value_type xpath_variable::type() const
09860         {
09861                 return _type;
09862         }
09863 
09864         PUGI__FN bool xpath_variable::get_boolean() const
09865         {
09866                 return (_type == xpath_type_boolean) ? static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_boolean*>(this)->value : false;
09867         }
09868 
09869         PUGI__FN double xpath_variable::get_number() const
09870         {
09871                 return (_type == xpath_type_number) ? static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_number*>(this)->value : impl::gen_nan();
09872         }
09873 
09874         PUGI__FN const char_t* xpath_variable::get_string() const
09875         {
09876                 const char_t* value = (_type == xpath_type_string) ? static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_string*>(this)->value : 0;
09877                 return value ? value : PUGIXML_TEXT("");
09878         }
09879 
09880         PUGI__FN const xpath_node_set& xpath_variable::get_node_set() const
09881         {
09882                 return (_type == xpath_type_node_set) ? static_cast<const impl::xpath_variable_node_set*>(this)->value : impl::dummy_node_set;
09883         }
09884 
09885         PUGI__FN bool xpath_variable::set(bool value)
09886         {
09887                 if (_type != xpath_type_boolean) return false;
09888 
09889                 static_cast<impl::xpath_variable_boolean*>(this)->value = value;
09890                 return true;
09891         }
09892 
09893         PUGI__FN bool xpath_variable::set(double value)
09894         {
09895                 if (_type != xpath_type_number) return false;
09896 
09897                 static_cast<impl::xpath_variable_number*>(this)->value = value;
09898                 return true;
09899         }
09900 
09901         PUGI__FN bool xpath_variable::set(const char_t* value)
09902         {
09903                 if (_type != xpath_type_string) return false;
09904 
09905                 impl::xpath_variable_string* var = static_cast<impl::xpath_variable_string*>(this);
09906 
09907                 // duplicate string
09908                 size_t size = (impl::strlength(value) + 1) * sizeof(char_t);
09909 
09910                 char_t* copy = static_cast<char_t*>(impl::xml_memory::allocate(size));
09911                 if (!copy) return false;
09912 
09913                 memcpy(copy, value, size);
09914 
09915                 // replace old string
09916                 if (var->value) impl::xml_memory::deallocate(var->value);
09917                 var->value = copy;
09918 
09919                 return true;
09920         }
09921 
09922         PUGI__FN bool xpath_variable::set(const xpath_node_set& value)
09923         {
09924                 if (_type != xpath_type_node_set) return false;
09925 
09926                 static_cast<impl::xpath_variable_node_set*>(this)->value = value;
09927                 return true;
09928         }
09929 
09930         PUGI__FN xpath_variable_set::xpath_variable_set()
09931         {
09932                 for (size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(_data) / sizeof(_data[0]); ++i) _data[i] = 0;
09933         }
09934 
09935         PUGI__FN xpath_variable_set::~xpath_variable_set()
09936         {
09937                 for (size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(_data) / sizeof(_data[0]); ++i)
09938                 {
09939                         xpath_variable* var = _data[i];
09940 
09941                         while (var)
09942                         {
09943                                 xpath_variable* next = var->_next;
09944 
09945                                 impl::delete_xpath_variable(var->_type, var);
09946 
09947                                 var = next;
09948                         }
09949                 }
09950         }
09951 
09952         PUGI__FN xpath_variable* xpath_variable_set::find(const char_t* name) const
09953         {
09954                 const size_t hash_size = sizeof(_data) / sizeof(_data[0]);
09955                 size_t hash = impl::hash_string(name) % hash_size;
09956 
09957                 // look for existing variable
09958                 for (xpath_variable* var = _data[hash]; var; var = var->_next)
09959                         if (impl::strequal(var->name(), name))
09960                                 return var;
09961 
09962                 return 0;
09963         }
09964 
09965         PUGI__FN xpath_variable* xpath_variable_set::add(const char_t* name, xpath_value_type type)
09966         {
09967                 const size_t hash_size = sizeof(_data) / sizeof(_data[0]);
09968                 size_t hash = impl::hash_string(name) % hash_size;
09969 
09970                 // look for existing variable
09971                 for (xpath_variable* var = _data[hash]; var; var = var->_next)
09972                         if (impl::strequal(var->name(), name))
09973                                 return var->type() == type ? var : 0;
09974 
09975                 // add new variable
09976                 xpath_variable* result = impl::new_xpath_variable(type, name);
09977 
09978                 if (result)
09979                 {
09980                         result->_type = type;
09981                         result->_next = _data[hash];
09982 
09983                         _data[hash] = result;
09984                 }
09985 
09986                 return result;
09987         }
09988 
09989         PUGI__FN bool xpath_variable_set::set(const char_t* name, bool value)
09990         {
09991                 xpath_variable* var = add(name, xpath_type_boolean);
09992                 return var ? var->set(value) : false;
09993         }
09994 
09995         PUGI__FN bool xpath_variable_set::set(const char_t* name, double value)
09996         {
09997                 xpath_variable* var = add(name, xpath_type_number);
09998                 return var ? var->set(value) : false;
09999         }
10000 
10001         PUGI__FN bool xpath_variable_set::set(const char_t* name, const char_t* value)
10002         {
10003                 xpath_variable* var = add(name, xpath_type_string);
10004                 return var ? var->set(value) : false;
10005         }
10006 
10007         PUGI__FN bool xpath_variable_set::set(const char_t* name, const xpath_node_set& value)
10008         {
10009                 xpath_variable* var = add(name, xpath_type_node_set);
10010                 return var ? var->set(value) : false;
10011         }
10012 
10013         PUGI__FN xpath_variable* xpath_variable_set::get(const char_t* name)
10014         {
10015                 return find(name);
10016         }
10017 
10018         PUGI__FN const xpath_variable* xpath_variable_set::get(const char_t* name) const
10019         {
10020                 return find(name);
10021         }
10022 
10023         PUGI__FN xpath_query::xpath_query(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables): _impl(0)
10024         {
10025                 impl::xpath_query_impl* qimpl = impl::xpath_query_impl::create();
10026 
10027                 if (!qimpl)
10028                 {
10029                 #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
10030                         _result.error = "Out of memory";
10031                 #else
10032                         throw std::bad_alloc();
10033                 #endif
10034                 }
10035                 else
10036                 {
10037                         impl::buffer_holder impl_holder(qimpl, impl::xpath_query_impl::destroy);
10038 
10039                         qimpl->root = impl::xpath_parser::parse(query, variables, &qimpl->alloc, &_result);
10040 
10041                         if (qimpl->root)
10042                         {
10043                                 _impl = static_cast<impl::xpath_query_impl*>(impl_holder.release());
10044                                 _result.error = 0;
10045                         }
10046                 }
10047         }
10048 
10049         PUGI__FN xpath_query::~xpath_query()
10050         {
10051                 impl::xpath_query_impl::destroy(_impl);
10052         }
10053 
10054         PUGI__FN xpath_value_type xpath_query::return_type() const
10055         {
10056                 if (!_impl) return xpath_type_none;
10057 
10058                 return static_cast<impl::xpath_query_impl*>(_impl)->root->rettype();
10059         }
10060 
10061         PUGI__FN bool xpath_query::evaluate_boolean(const xpath_node& n) const
10062         {
10063                 if (!_impl) return false;
10064                 
10065                 impl::xpath_context c(n, 1, 1);
10066                 impl::xpath_stack_data sd;
10067 
10068         #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
10069                 if (setjmp(sd.error_handler)) return false;
10070         #endif
10071                 
10072                 return static_cast<impl::xpath_query_impl*>(_impl)->root->eval_boolean(c, sd.stack);
10073         }
10074         
10075         PUGI__FN double xpath_query::evaluate_number(const xpath_node& n) const
10076         {
10077                 if (!_impl) return impl::gen_nan();
10078                 
10079                 impl::xpath_context c(n, 1, 1);
10080                 impl::xpath_stack_data sd;
10081 
10082         #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
10083                 if (setjmp(sd.error_handler)) return impl::gen_nan();
10084         #endif
10085 
10086                 return static_cast<impl::xpath_query_impl*>(_impl)->root->eval_number(c, sd.stack);
10087         }
10088 
10089 #ifndef PUGIXML_NO_STL
10090         PUGI__FN string_t xpath_query::evaluate_string(const xpath_node& n) const
10091         {
10092                 impl::xpath_stack_data sd;
10093 
10094                 return impl::evaluate_string_impl(static_cast<impl::xpath_query_impl*>(_impl), n, sd).c_str();
10095         }
10096 #endif
10097 
10098         PUGI__FN size_t xpath_query::evaluate_string(char_t* buffer, size_t capacity, const xpath_node& n) const
10099         {
10100                 impl::xpath_stack_data sd;
10101 
10102                 impl::xpath_string r = impl::evaluate_string_impl(static_cast<impl::xpath_query_impl*>(_impl), n, sd);
10103 
10104                 size_t full_size = r.length() + 1;
10105                 
10106                 if (capacity > 0)
10107                 {
10108                         size_t size = (full_size < capacity) ? full_size : capacity;
10109                         assert(size > 0);
10110 
10111                         memcpy(buffer, r.c_str(), (size - 1) * sizeof(char_t));
10112                         buffer[size - 1] = 0;
10113                 }
10114                 
10115                 return full_size;
10116         }
10117 
10118         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set xpath_query::evaluate_node_set(const xpath_node& n) const
10119         {
10120                 if (!_impl) return xpath_node_set();
10121 
10122                 impl::xpath_ast_node* root = static_cast<impl::xpath_query_impl*>(_impl)->root;
10123 
10124                 if (root->rettype() != xpath_type_node_set)
10125                 {
10126                 #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
10127                         return xpath_node_set();
10128                 #else
10129                         xpath_parse_result res;
10130                         res.error = "Expression does not evaluate to node set";
10131 
10132                         throw xpath_exception(res);
10133                 #endif
10134                 }
10135                 
10136                 impl::xpath_context c(n, 1, 1);
10137                 impl::xpath_stack_data sd;
10138 
10139         #ifdef PUGIXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
10140                 if (setjmp(sd.error_handler)) return xpath_node_set();
10141         #endif
10142 
10143                 impl::xpath_node_set_raw r = root->eval_node_set(c, sd.stack);
10144 
10145                 return xpath_node_set(r.begin(), r.end(), r.type());
10146         }
10147 
10148         PUGI__FN const xpath_parse_result& xpath_query::result() const
10149         {
10150                 return _result;
10151         }
10152 
10153         PUGI__FN static void unspecified_bool_xpath_query(xpath_query***)
10154         {
10155         }
10156 
10157         PUGI__FN xpath_query::operator xpath_query::unspecified_bool_type() const
10158         {
10159                 return _impl ? unspecified_bool_xpath_query : 0;
10160         }
10161 
10162         PUGI__FN bool xpath_query::operator!() const
10163         {
10164                 return !_impl;
10165         }
10166 
10167         PUGI__FN xpath_node xml_node::select_single_node(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables) const
10168         {
10169                 xpath_query q(query, variables);
10170                 return select_single_node(q);
10171         }
10172 
10173         PUGI__FN xpath_node xml_node::select_single_node(const xpath_query& query) const
10174         {
10175                 xpath_node_set s = query.evaluate_node_set(*this);
10176                 return s.empty() ? xpath_node() : s.first();
10177         }
10178 
10179         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set xml_node::select_nodes(const char_t* query, xpath_variable_set* variables) const
10180         {
10181                 xpath_query q(query, variables);
10182                 return select_nodes(q);
10183         }
10184 
10185         PUGI__FN xpath_node_set xml_node::select_nodes(const xpath_query& query) const
10186         {
10187                 return query.evaluate_node_set(*this);
10188         }
10189 }
10190 
10191 #endif
10192 
10193 #ifdef __BORLANDC__
10194 #       pragma option pop
10195 #endif
10196 
10197 // Intel C++ does not properly keep warning state for function templates,
10198 // so popping warning state at the end of translation unit leads to warnings in the middle.
10199 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
10200 #       pragma warning(pop)
10201 #endif

10203 // Undefine all local macros (makes sure we're not leaking macros in header-only mode)
10204 #undef PUGI__NO_INLINE
10205 #undef PUGI__STATIC_ASSERT
10206 #undef PUGI__DMC_VOLATILE
10207 #undef PUGI__MSVC_CRT_VERSION
10208 #undef PUGI__NS_BEGIN
10209 #undef PUGI__NS_END
10210 #undef PUGI__FN
10211 #undef PUGI__FN_NO_INLINE
10212 #undef PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE_IMPL
10213 #undef PUGI__IS_CHARTYPE
10214 #undef PUGI__IS_CHARTYPEX
10215 #undef PUGI__SKIPWS
10216 #undef PUGI__OPTSET
10217 #undef PUGI__PUSHNODE
10218 #undef PUGI__POPNODE
10219 #undef PUGI__SCANFOR
10220 #undef PUGI__SCANWHILE
10221 #undef PUGI__ENDSEG
10222 #undef PUGI__THROW_ERROR
10223 #undef PUGI__CHECK_ERROR
10224 
10225 #endif
